39467339.review:
[h1] Bit Blaster XL	[/h1]
Довольно годная и залипательная аркада про то, как надо взять себя в руки и всё-таки набрать эти 75 к очков!
От игрока требуется только реакция, руки, растущие из правильного места, и голова на плечах (необязательно).
В игре присутствует несколько видов космолётов, каждый из которых отличается какими-то характеристиками (скорость, количество жизней и количество зарядов). Естественно, самый последний - самый сбалансированный корабль. 
Интересной особенностью является то, что у каждого корабля есть свой саундрек! У медленного космолёта - мягкий и спокойный саунд, у последнего - взрывной и бодрящий.
Против нас выступает целая куча врагов: от обычных астероидов до чёрных дыр и лазерных ракет! В общем, скучать Вам не придётся :)

Из минусов отмечу две позиции.
Управление. Играть очень тяжело на стрелках, при условии, что нужны точные попадания. Будьте готовы к долгому привыканию.
А ещё, когда проигрываешь и резко возвращаешься к игре, то границы поля могут слететь (передвинуться). Это сильно раздражает, особенно, когда не можешь набрать 75 к в течение трёх часов.

В итоге получаем добротную леталку-стрелялку с годной музычкой, разнообразием врагов и космолётов, но с жутким управлением и переодически слетающими границами! Игра Вас затянет на пару вечеров, это я гарантирую!

[h1] Оценка: 7,0/10	[/h1]

39386396.review:
[h1][b]停不下来的魔性打飞机小游戏[/b][/h1]

[b]好玩的游戏未必就一定有多精美多复杂，有时候，一款玩法和画面简单到不能再简单的游戏，也能让你乐此不疲地玩了一局还想玩下一局。[/b]

Nickervision Studios "XL" 系列游戏中最知名的一部，足以在小游戏界傲视群雄、总数达4000+的“好评如潮”的评价足以证明它在玩家中受到的欢迎。作为一款模仿与致敬上世纪80年代街机平台流行的打飞机类型游戏的作品，Bit Blaster XL的复古的画面与简单易上手的玩法在让玩家感受到铺面而来的怀旧气息的同时，也能让我们体会到一种简单纯粹的乐趣，非常适合在闲暇无聊时玩上几局放松放松。

[h1]游戏的规则可以概括为以下四条：[/h1]
• 你的飞船总是永不停息地在移动！你必须用←→方向键控制飞船的转向、用↑方向键控制飞船加速来来避免冲撞边界或是吃下敌人的攻击；
• 你的飞船默认情况下总是在不停地射击！不过你可以在选项中关闭它，这时按下Ctrl键来手动发射子弹；游戏中还会随机掉落各种类型的增强弹药，吃下它们应对愈来愈多的敌机来袭；
• 飞机的弹药是有限的！注意控制弹药的消耗并且吃下掉落的弹药包及时进行补充；按下Alt键可以让你使出一计大招清屏，解围利器，不过场地中的道具也随敌机一起被清空了；
• 坚持生存更长的时间取得更高的分数！积累随机获得的金币购买解锁新的自机机型，它们拥有不同的移动攻击速度、生命值以及能够携带的大招炸弹数量。

相信吸引各位玩家的还有游戏中好听魔性又充满动感的8-bit风格BGM了。每架自机配合其中一首，当操作小飞船在屏幕上四处移动时不禁让人感觉飞船的特点和音乐的节奏有种微妙的合拍感。游戏原声DLC免费，购买本体游戏安装就可以在游戏目录下找到它们了；如果你希望在网易云中聆听它们，可以点击[url=http://music.163.com/#/radio?id=345970057&userid=104321718]这个歌单[/url]。

[i]Bit Blaster XL is a retro styled, addictive, and fast paced arcade shoot 'em up! (shmup).[/i]
[h1]不来玩上一局吗？(●'◡'●)[/h1]

39222706.review:
Bit Blaster is a game that goes back to gaming's roots. It's a game that seems to mash together the core concepts of two classics, Galaga and Asteroids, while maintaining a completely unique and fresh take on old concepts.

It took me 4.2 hours to complete the game, which revolves around collecting coins that drop every once in a while from incoming asteroids and enemy ships. With these coins, the player purchases new ships from the start menu. Also, the player can collect powerups while playing, which introduce clever twists into the gameplay. It's a simple, yet surprisingly fun game. I had a lot of fun playing it on a long road trip I recently went on.

I played this game on my laptop, which has a 4th-gen Intel Core i5 with integrated graphics. At 1080p, there were absolutely no frame drops or crashes -- the game was totally stable and reliable. The game also supports controllers, and my SteelSeries Stratus XL works perfectly with it (though I didn't end up using this feature much -- keyboards are far more accurate).

Now, let's talk about the best part of this game: the value. I'm pretty sure I bought this for 99 cents, and what amazes me, as well as many other reviewers, is the amount of gameplay you get for that price. I got 4.2 hours of gameplay from this game, and I'm sure that I could get far more if I could find the "clear data" button. Or I could just try to beat my highscore again. Or I could try to master using some of my less preferred ships. See, there's just so much to do! And all for the price of something you'd get at a vending machine!

If I had to put anything against this game, it would have to be the overpoweredness of the enemy ships that appear. These ships shoot projectiles at time intervals, and the problem is that since you can't stop your ship, you will often go through multiple insane manuevers, dodging entire *waves* of bullets, and then die while flying towards a ship, getting in close (the ships are really, REALLY inaccurate) and then getting shot by the ship you were half a second from destroying. This is not helped by another flaw in the game mechanics -- accuracy. As I mentioned above, the inaccuracy of the ship's guns cause you to *have* to get in close, which makes it nearly impossible to avoid being shot. Yes, you "get the hang of it," but even after 4.2 hours of doing the same thing over and over again, I'd say that I was still getting shot 20% of the time. 

I think the dev could kill two birds with one stone by fixing the latter of the above problems by introducing some form of aim assistance into the game. I would suggest that the dev make shots fired a certain amount of degrees off (5? 7? 10?) hit their target. It could vastly improve the gameplay experience, and make dying from close-range fire much less common. 

In conclusion: I very much enjoy this game. It's a fresh take on old concepts, and is really a joy to play. I do think that this game has some issues, but I believe that these could be easily fixed by the developer. For the price of only 99 cents, this is a steal!

39203000.review:
What you see is what you get with Bit Blaster XL, a rather basic but engaging arcade high score chaser. The fair and solid gameplay induces a strive for mastery and the great chiptune tracks are compelling enough to keep the player in the loop and constantly try again.

It's simple at its core but highly polished with responsive movement, comprehensible hitboxes and balanced weapon pickups. While a small amount of luck is required for certain pickups to appear, player skill is still the most relevant asset in order to progress especially down the line. The focus on good aim at the start of a round gradually shifts to a tense bullet hell dodging ordeal. Concentration is required to score high, but since the mechanics are so easy to grasp, a quick round on the side can be just as captivating as a longer session. Once attuned to the controls, the gameplay is effortless and a good performance solely based on skill.

With an almost pastel colour palette, the graphics are easy on the eyes. Music and sound effects are similarly soft. But what Bit Blaster XL lacks in audiovisual fidelity it makes up with tight gameplay. It's a short and fun distraction.

38741357.review:
Bit Blaster XL est un shoot 'em up de Nickervision Studios, votre but sera de dégommer tous les vaisseaux ennemis qui apparaîtront à l'aide de bonus qui vous seront proposés tout au long de la partie ainsi que de vaisseaux débloquables avec chacun leurs propres statistiques.

Le jeu propose un seul mode de jeu où vous voudrez faire le plus gros highscore à chaque fois. Découvrez les effets des bonus et vaisseaux et créez votre propre style de partie : vous préférez foncer dans le tas et tout éclater ou la jouer défensive et laisser votre vaisseau tuer les ennemis lentement ? A vous d'essayer !

J'ai personnellement beaucoup aimé ce jeu, cependant il faut garder en tête qu'il s'agit plus d'un passe-temps qu'une aventure où vous y passerez des dizaines d'heures, même si pour moins d'un Euro j'ai passé de bons moments; de plus les succès Steam vous permettront de vous fixer des objectifs si vous ne savez pas vraiment quel highscore serait bien à battre au début.

[h1]Note finale : 8 / 10[/h1]

38740568.review: Bit Blaster XL, while not a very big game, is very fun. This isn't a game you should expect to sit there for hours on end playing, but it is a nice small game to pick up when you are bored. Quick, fun and easy, the objective is very simple; shoot stuff and don't let stuff shoot you. While a lot of what appear to be simple games at first have layers of secrets or other things, this game is really just a tid bit of fun, which some people might not appreciate but is really nice to have. And the creator behind it is incredible too. Most games, people complain, and only when enough have is a response heard, but scrolling through and of the negative reviews on a nickervision game and you'll find response after response from the creator, trying to help and improve it to be a game everbody can enjoy. It is not overly complex, quick and easy to come to and from, and has a great creator. Would Highly reccomend all of Nickervision's games

38722412.review:
If you're looking for a deep game that has you managing armies and cities or one that is going to tell some 3 hour story well... this isn't it.

This is an "old-school" arcade game.  Essentially an homage to Atari's Asteroids and it does a very good job at it.  The basics are that you're in a ship shooting rocks which break into smaller rocks while alien ships try to destroy you.  

Because your weapon only has a limited amount of shots you're required to pick up ammo capsules to keep reloading your weapon.  The power ups that you can collect are balanced nicely in that the more powerful ones tend to go through your ammo quicker.  You're also given a limited amount of super bombs which destroy everything on the screen.

The enemies are also of a nice variety.  Some shoot at you, others are essentially time bombs that blow up after a certain period of time, others launch a large volley of shots, etc.  

Gold coins will also appear from destroyed enemies.  These gold coins can be used to unlock other ships which have different stats: more shields, more super bombs, etc.  

The soundtrack is also pleasant to listen to.

TIP: If you want to make the game harder turn on auto-fire.  It keeps you from being able to conserve your ammo and makes picking up those ammo capsules even more important.

우주선을 조작하여 사방에서 몰려오는 온갖 잡다한 것들에게서 생존해야하는 탄막 슈팅 게임인 [b]《비트 블래스터 XL》[/b]다. 압도적으로 긍정적인 평가에는 다 이유가 있는 법이다. 이 게임은, 내가 생각하기에 [u]'가성비 끝판왕'[/u] 타이틀을 거머쥐어도 될 후보 중 하나다. 순수하게 게임성과 그래픽만 보면 솔직히 '어, 그래. 이게 왜 이렇게 평가가 좋지?' 라고 느낄 수 있다. 이해한다. 하지만 정가를 보라. 1,100원이다. 이 가격을 생각한다면 더 이상 이 게임성은 무시할 수준이 못된다. 

 + 압도적인 가성비 파워(심지어 할인도 자주 붙는다)
 + 스텟이 각기 다른 플레이어블 캐릭터(코인으로 해금)
 + 스코어가 올라갈수록 더 까다로운 적들이 등장
 + 부드러운 조작감, 다양한 무기 종류
 + 트레이딩 카드 존재(도전과제 올클리어 노릴 경우, 플탐 대비 파밍시간 적절)

 - 스코어 관련 도전과제가 있어서 노가다가 좀 있는 편이다

스코어를 더 많이 올리고 싶은가? 그렇다면 일단 스피드가 빠른ㅡ3 이상ㅡ 우주선을 택하자. 그리고 오토 파이어는 꺼라. 그리고 다음의 무기가 보이면 먹고, 다른 것으로 바꾸지 말자. 레이져, 화염방사기, 기체 주위를 도는 5개의 원. 이 세 가지가 내 경험상으로는 'TOP' 이다. 특히 5개의 원 같은 경우는 회전속도가 기체의 이동속도에 비례한다. 무슨 말이냐? 이거 먹고 부스트 쓰면서 그냥 적에게 돌진하면 점수가 알아서 들어온다는 뜻이다.

38583544.review:
Changing my review to Not Recommend, after arguing with another reviewer about the music. He said the music was good, and I was shocked since there was only a bit of melody played over and over. I kept thinking about this, and I realized there is not a lot to like about this game, except that it is inexpensive and it works. But is that the bar that must be met for me to RECOMMEND this game? I certainly would not recommend this game to a friend. After playing this for thirty seconds, I was pretty well bored with it, and while I will certainly play it again, I would not recommend anyone get it.

Let's compare it to another asteroid clone called Maelstrom on the Macintosh computer that totally blew me away, in 1995. When I first played Maelstrom, I could not get away from the keyboard for hours. I looked forward to playing it over and over. And yet the two games are so similar, with ship upgrades, a race for higher scores, rotating and thrusting for movement... Now here it is twenty years later, and what does Bit Blaster have that Maelstrom doesn't? Plus, Maelstrom was released as free software, so you can download it even before you finish reading this review.

I am fairly certain that the majority of reviewers would be spitting mad if they had purchased the Bit Blaster game for the ten dollars that most light steam games have for a price. I do not think the overwhelming positive reviews are a good reflection of the quality of this game, except that people have very low expectations when they are getting what they see as a bargain. (And my sympathies in advance to the game author, who no doubt will read this and try to respond, as I have seen him do to other negative reviews. I do understand you put a good faith effort into creating, pricing, and supporting this game.) In hopes of being balanced here, I want to point out that there is a nine MP3 track DLC that unlocks at no cost. It is chiptune music. I initially did not notice it, and it may be interesting for people still considering a purchase.

38543147.review:
This game is a steal for 79p full asking price, though the price at the time of writing this review is down to 39p. 
Ironically the lack of expense puts many people of purchasing this game, normally price can determine quality, not in this instance!

There are 8 ships in the game, you start out in the bog standard default ship while trying to earn enough coins to buy the next ship up, you can't skip from ship 2 to 6 for example, no, you have to buy them in order, I like this, it forces the user to try different play styles and adds more hours of playablity to the overall game.

the weapon powerups are fantastic, with a good selection of bullet types.

Each ship has a highscore, I use this to guage which ship I'm best at, the higher the score the better I am at that ship. 

I would recommend this arcade shootem up to pretty much anybody, it's a simple 2d game that should run on any system that runs steam, it's crazy cheap and has a surprisingly amount of polish.

I only played this game using an xbox360 control pad, the controls are nice and responcesive!

7.6/10 (A steal)

38540276.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a game that charges a fair price for what it is but in my opinion, it's worth much more.
Despite being a game of rustic assets, it's rather quaint. It feels reminiscent of a game that would have come with an iteration of Mandriva Linux and does give me a sort of nostalgic fondness for it. The essence of the game feels somewhat like "Beat Hazard" it shares a simple control scheme and objective; shoot stuff, score high. You may find yourself, however, less focused on shooting enemies and more concentrated on just avoiding incoming fire. Nevertheless, much like the aforementioned game, what really binds this little arcade-like gem in to a game worth playing is the soundtrack.
I find some of the most enjoyable games are the simplest as long as the soundtrack holds up. This will definitely be a game I will come back to over and over to kill time and enjoy with the great music.

Bit Blaster XL
Pros: 
+ Power Ups
+ Types of Enemies
+ Different Ships
+ Cheap

Cons: 
- Only One Power Up at a Time (Doesn't really bother me)
- Only One Game Mode

Review 
Bit Blaster XL is a fun retro game. There's only endless mode to play with new enemies being introduced as time goes on. The power ups are pretty cool, but you can only have one of them at a time. I think it would be cool to have more at once so it would be even more chaotic, but one let's there be a nice challenge. I enjoyed the different types of enemies. This game isn't amazing, but it was pretty good and it's at a cheap price. I would recommend this game.

마치 고전게임 느낌나는 슈팅 게임입니다.

한 화면에서 날아오는 장애물. 플레이어는 탄막을 발사해 장애물을 제거하며 공격을 피합니다.
이런 방식이 다인 엔드리스 형이지만, 코인을 모아 각자 능력치가 다른 우주선을 살 수 있으며,

탄막이 벽에 튕긴다든지, 후방에서도 발사 되거나 , 유도탄을 쏘거나 , 그냥 탄막을 안쏘고 레이저로 지진다든지.. 아이템들이 다양합니다.

게임 가격은 1,100원 이지만 1,100원 이상 값을 할 정도로 가성비가 좋습니다!

A fantastic little and very cheap Shoot'Em Up for those of us who are not born with asian-level dodging and reaction skills. 

The game has a clear artstyle which allows you to tactically maneuver and pick up specific power ups for the situation you are in. 

The progression system ties in nicely with the achievements and I was able to get all of the achievements and see all the game has to offer in a little under 4 hours.

[h1]Bit Blaster XL[/h1]
Fantastyczna zręcznościówka, tak prosta i trudna jednocześnie, spędziła mi z powiek 15 godzin snu, bo jest to gierka na posdumowanie dnia - "ostatnie 15 minut". Graj jest warta swojej żałośnie niskiej ceny, bo jest [b]zajebiście zajebista[/b]

黄色H是最好用的子弹，自动跟踪，还有小范围爆炸，只需要全身心躲避就可以了。紫色B是最难用的子弹。
V4是最好用的飞机，速度慢，来得及反应，最主要的是它发射速度也慢，省子弹，想不通那些发射速的超级快的怎么玩，试了试，一会子弹就没有了，即使见了字母就吃（吃字母送20发子弹）。

36450644.review:
Okay, so, initially I gave this game a negative review, but I've since started to appreciate it more.
It's basically exactly what it says in the description, just a little cute game where you shoot stuff in space. At first I was somewhat irked at the fact that the playing field is restricted to the player (i.e. not Asteroids-style, where you can fly off the screen on the right side and come out on the left side), but after further examination, that mechanic is actually fine within the context of the game, since it forces you to prioritize on what powerups to chase after, for example. 
The fact that you can unlock ships with different stats, and the fairly wide selection of weapon powerups (spreadshot, grenade, 'flame', laser etc.) gives this some more play and as much depth as it needs to keep you coming back. 
I'd totally recommend this game for the price, especially in comparison to a lot of other Steam games in this price range that seem like they didn't have half as much effort put into it as this one.

36314538.review: Love the retro 80s feel, this game is like a mixed version of a lot of really popular games from the time, like Galaga, 1942, Defender etc. I really like how these games have been put together and improved as well as adding another dimension to the game which is unlocking new ships, the best part about unlocking these new ships is they aren't just about different looks, they all have completely different stats, such as movement speed, lives, firing rate, and others. Another amazing feature is the music, with heaps of different soundtracks, you really can't get bored playing, in fact this game is probably the most addicting game I own! I really recommend this game for anything from a simple skill-based game to improve your high score, to something to play while you wait on friends. Thanks Adam Nickerson and I wish Nickervision Studios success!

36253784.review:
Olala
Un jeu qu'il est bien pour y jouer.
Bit Balster XL, mais késaco??
Et bien c'est très simple. On a là affaire à un shoot them' up dans un style très arcade, qui peut sembler simpliste dans son gameplay et vite lassant. Mais que neni.
On a la un jeu assez addictif (le fameux symdrome du 'encore une dernière'), avec une OST sympathique (1 morceau par vaisseaux, qui sont au nombre de 8), et surtout, un gameplay plus varié qu'il n'y parrait:
-Chaque vaisseau possède ses caractéristiques: vitesse de déplacement, de tir, nombre de bouclier et de bombes au début d'une partie.
-La présence de nombreux bonus variés, plus ou moins efficaces (on apprend rapidement lesquels correspondent le mieux à quels vaisseaux), mais toujours différents.
Bit Blaster XL est un jeu sans prétention, mais qui s'impose comme un incoutournable pour des courtes session de jeu: 1/4 d'heure par ci, 1/4 d'heure par là... Et au final, les heures montent vite.
L'ultime argument est son prix ridicule: 0,99€, et ce sans prendre en compte les régullières promo à 50% et les cartes à échanger déblocables.
Loin d'être un grand jeu, Bit Blaster XL aurait cependant très bien trouvé sa place dans les salles d'arcades des 80's-90's et nous offre quelques heures de divertissement sans prise de tête.

Je n'en peux plus...
Cela fait déjà deux ans que je possède ce jeu qui se trouvait dans un Humble Bundle avec Pac Man et Contrast...
Je pensais que c'était un bon petit jeu et finalement... il m'a eu ! 
Ce jeu était très bon, pour la première fois je dcouvrais un bon jeu qui reposait sur l'addiction !
Mais malheureusement... il fallait qu'il me suive.
Chaque fois que je rentrais de cours PAF ! une petite partie de Bit Blaster XL et puis je vais manger... et PAF une petite partie ! Tout les soirs je me sentais obligé d'y jouer... IL M'A SUIVI !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Pour arrêter cette malédiction j'ai traversé monts et merveilles pour arriver au siège de Nickervision Studios et là ils m'on dit ''Ahahahahaha bah écoute mon con, pour guérir ta malédiction il faut que 1000 copie de notre jeu soit vendus !!!'' et à y réfléchir je penses pas qu'ils se sont foutuent de ma gueule !
Bref... vous devez l'acheter pour arrêter ma malédiction... S'IL VOUS PLAIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT !!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Es un arcade bastante entretenido donde tienes que sobrevivir en una pantalla destruyendo meteoritos y naves espaciales básicamente, cogiendo power up temporales. 

Puedes desbloquear tres tipos de naves: la pequeña y rápida, la equilibrada y la grande y lenta. 

Además, tienes bombas que eliminan todo lo que hay en la pantalla y escudo, que vienen a ser las vidas.

En resumen, es un arcade de disparar con la nave, donde puedes desbloquear naves mejores cuanto más juegues.

35740682.review:
Bit Blaster XL is your classic arcade-style shooter game in which you control an overhead view of a "spaceship" and have to stay as long as possible without dying to the enemies, falling off the map, colliding with asteroids, or whatever you can seem to die to. It's actually quite enjoyable for me and allows me to reminisce in the times that everyone would hang out at Nickel City or the arcade and play games on the big machines together.

Essentially, what you want to do is start it up, and change whether you prefer auto fire or not. This 100% depends on your play preference as the auto fire will help you get started but to really grasp the higher levels and be able to take on various power boosts (one specific one I can think of that uses a lot of ammo is the laser, which is extremely helpful especially over 30,000 score.) There are minimal settings, which allow for very smooth and fun at the same time gameplay for everyone of all ages.

There are achievement, and trading cards. The achievements are hard enough to get that you will have to genuinely work for them over just being given them for logging in. Many people will get discouraged by the large amount of score you need but please don't! It's not as hard as it seems and after a few hours of working on your skills I guarentee that you will be able to start getting some of the higher level rockets and achievements.

It's very cheap, for a modern day game. It provides tons of fun, especially offline. And with no in app purchases, pay to win features, and no multiplayer even, you can just wind down or relax after a long day and play some Bit Blaster XL. End verdict? Yes. Definitely. For the short price and amount of enjoyment I've gotten over 2 accounts, I can say that I would be willing to pay for it over and over again.

35700728.review:
This is one of those games not so good to have a positive review but neither so bad to have a negative one.. so, since this can be often bought on sale, and there's no middle option, i'm forced to be positive :P
The game itself is quite basic and adds really nothing nothing nothing new: it's an endless shooter, in which you control a starship (you can buy new ones with different speed, health, fire rate etc. later in the game) in a rectangular fixed space and you have to shoot enemies, asteroids and such (there's auto-fire, but you'll also run out of ammo quite soon!).
I don't know why this game has so many reviews, maybe it's famous for being on mobile phones? I don't really know.
Anyways, I don't think that there's so much to say. The game is pretty all there; you have your basic arcade high score, and you have to beat yourself. You can try the different airships and collect money to unlock new ones. Controls are really basic, since you can't move forward or backwards: left and right, and you can speed up or slow down. That's all.
We '80s kids come from years and years of arcade games and not only arcade games similar to this one, but still this one manages to fulfill its promises. 
And now I'm gonna see through the hundreds of reviews why 8 games out of 10 here have 3-4 reviews and this lil shooter has 20000 of them.
Have fun and don't get bored too early!

35176678.review:
Completado TODAS las naves con más de 30.000 puntos (juego infinito), TODOS los logros conseguidos.

Magnífico juego de arcade espacial que ofrece horas de diversión superando de lejos MUCHOS otros juegos del mismo género en Steam, incluso juegos con mayores y mejores gráficos e historia. La jugabilidad es excelente, las diferentes naves y power ups enriquecen las partidas y son muy variados, la música es buenísima y alcanzar altas puntuaciones es un auténtico reto. Extraordinaria calidad que sorprende en un título que aparenta sencillez, si te gustan los arcades y/o los diseños 8 bit pruébalo.

Gráficos y Tecnología >>> BIEN ! + 1,5 puntos

Planos 3G en 8 bit, el universo pixelado de Bit Blaster contrasta entre power ups y asteroides de diseño muy simplista con naves y enemigos muy variados y bonitos a pesar de usar solo pocos cuadros de color. El diseño de las ocho naves jugables es muy bueno, así como la fluidez gráfica de fondos, disparos, explosiones y haces de luz (que también son pequeños píxeles perdiéndose en el espacio). Sin embargo es todo puro píxel, TIENE que gustarte ese tipo de entornos y para mi gusto abusa un poco del color blanco, sin llegar por eso a ser molesto. El juego pesa solamente 105 mb y podrás jugarlo en cualquier PC medio.

Historia y Niveles >>> POBRE + 0,5 puntos

No hay historia, el objetivo es eliminar todos los astros y enemigos que cruzan la pantalla sin explotar y sin tocar los bordes de ésta.  Aunque hay dos modos de juego, la verdadera diversión es al utilizar las distintas naves con características únicas y tratar de acumular el mayor número de puntos con todas ellas. Las partidas se hacen progresivas y muy emocionantes ofreciendo verdaderos momentos bullet hell, con un nivel de dificultad creciente que poco a poco va oprimiendo hasta no poder evitar morir. El correcto uso de los power ups se hace imprescindible y obtener alto puntaje es complicado, sobretodo pasados los 50k o 60k.

Música y Sonidos >>> BIEN ! + 1,5 puntos

Excelente composición musical de temas 8 bit que tienen mucha profundidad y personalizan cada una de las naves. La banda sonora no solamente transmite emoción por la partida, si no que se hace totalmente disfrutable por sí misma (debería haber un DLC en MP3) y tiene detalles geniales como reducir su tempo y tono cuando el juego está en pausa. También destaco que se reinicia con fluidez cuando una canción termina y sobreviviste lo suficiente. Además, el juego tiene buenos efectos de sonido que  cumplen con nota tanto en explosiones como en las armas y sonidos del espacio, sin por ello molestar o opacar la música.

Control y Jugabilidad >>> PERFECTO !! + 2 puntos

Funciona bien en TODOS mis mandos de PC !! También permite personalizar al gusto controles, teclas y ratón. La cámara es fija y el control de giro relativo, eso puede confundir al principio pero con el tiempo se prueba como muy fluido y permite hacer verdaderas virguerías esquivando disparos. Me encanta que no haya ayuda al disparo ni se use el ratón para apuntar. Por otro lado, las diferentes naves, armas y power ups están MUY bien pensados y te hace descubrir pros y contras para cada uno de ellos, aumentando la calidad del juego enormemente. Y como guinda no he encontrado ni un sólo bug, es un juegazo muy sólido.

Integración en Steam >>>  BIEN ! + 1,5 puntos

El juego tiene tres tipos de logros: Por desbloquear las ocho naves (fácil), por acumulación de puntos (fácil) y por máximo de puntos en una misma partida (solo el de 75.000 es complicado). Para conseguirlo deberás ganar mucha soltura con las diferentes naves y armas hasta encontrar una estrategia que te funcione para tu habilidad de juego. El juego tiene cromos Steam pero se extrañan marcadores o ranking, serían muy interesantes. En cuanto a precio, es juego de un euro que tiene posibilidad de comprarse en un pack con otros juegos del desarrollador, por lo que es compra perfecta en cuanto a calidad/precio.

CONCLUSIÓN FINAL >>>  7,0 un juego Notable, MUY Recomendado

Bit Blaster XL funciona muy bien tanto como juego de arcade espacial como juego retro estilo 8 bit. A pesar de haberlo superado hace tiempo sigo jugando a él, de verdad se extraña mucho un ránking o marcador Steam que permita compararse con jugadores de todo el mundo. Espero con ganas que se añada la banda sonora en DLC y una posible secuela con más naves y power ups, el juego tiene mucho potencial. Muy recomendado tanto si eres especialista del género como si no, por un euro, puedes conseguir un juego de gran calidad apto para todos los públicos que ofrece horas de entretenimiento en cualquier PC.

34525955.review:
[h1]About Bit Blaster XL[/h1]
Bit Blaster XL	is really fun to play and well-designed! It looks like a retro Asteroids-style shooter and it is but while remaining simple in concept it is much more sophisticated than it appears.

[u] Release Date: 22 Jan, 2016[/u]

[h1]The Gameplay[/h1]
The game is addictive, in a very good way, it keeps you coming back and wanting to be better at playing it. The movement is fluid and the graphics look cool but what stands out to me is the sound design: the music is very good and makes you strive to survive and keep going, the sound effects are perfect, giving you that rewarding feeling when you grab a coin or blow up stuff. There is enough variety in the ships you unlock to make playing with each a slightly different experience. Game keeps challenging your mind and focus, as you have to watch out for collisions and be careful not to run out of ammo while aiming and controlling the speed. Another plus is the developer seems to be accessible and listening to feedback.

All in All [u]Bit Blaster XL[/u] is a good Indie Game, for little money.

9/10 From Me
[i] +SDI[/i]

34525485.review:
Bit Blaster XL – opera dello stesso sviluppatore di Orbt XL – è un titolo che guarda con nostalgia alle macchinette da gioco dei bar americani di fine anni '80. Dichiaratamente retrò, il gioco ripropone in chiave moderna il classico della navicella che si fa strada tra meteoriti e "nemici galattici". La grafica è nitida ed estremamente curata nei dettagli. La giocabilità è complessivamente buona, sebbene l'utilizzo di joystick non possa che giovare all'esperienza, (che non si presta granché alla tastiera). Gli achievement sono sensati e sbloccabili con non pochi sforzi.
Il titolo assicura un bel po' di divertimento "old school".

1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn’t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a “homemade” touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

When I saw the game the first time in my discovery queue, I selected switched it to ignore in the future. It just didn't look very interesting with its basic graphics and well known arcade action and that would have been it if I wouldn't have received a 75% bonus for craftig some badge... I looked at it again, was again not really interested and then saw that the programmer is doing this for fun and that he took the pains of also releasing a linux build... oh well, I thought - this has to be rewarded, even if I'm not going to play the game, so I bought it and installed it to see if it would run out of the box on my system (which I do routinely even if I don't play the game)... so I figured, it's a quick game, let's try one time... a few seconds later I was killed... ah well, another one... boom... and on... and on... It is a simple game, and the mechanics are well known, but it brings a lot of variety to the table like many different weapons, the limited ammo, different unlockable ships, various different enemies and a nice soundtrack that doesn't get on your nerves.

For the money it costs, it is a steal and it entertains you for a few minutes or a few hours - whatever you want. It's the arcade look and feel of old. Well done, programmer and thank you for the linux build!

33530959.review:
Really enjoyable game. I have used it as a reward for studying: 25 minutes of studying, then 5 minutes of playing this game. Made studying easier.

Reasons for recommending this game:
- Nice retro graphics and music (best soundtrack since Battlefield 1942 and Fifa 98)
- You can immediately start playing, so it's also fun for just a few minutes
- Fun to play 'hot seat', for the same reason
- Fun to unlock new spaceships

Reasons for not recommending this game (although I do recommend it):
- It's quite brief... it's the first PC game I finished in over a decade, simply because it only took me 4h. Of course, I can continue to try and get higher scores, but it's less appealing, as no further unlocks are available.
- The online ranking button doesn't work (on my game at least).

My improvement suggestions would be:
- Don't increase the price for new unlocks, since it would feel like 'overpricing' the new ships. The current prices are fine. However, extra unlocks would be nice, such as the following.
- Option to increase the ammo cap to 200, price for instance 150 golden-coinlike-things
- Option to get 1 extra ammo per green-ammo-thing, price for instance 100 golden coinlike things. This item should be available for infinite times, but every time for a higher price (e.g. 100-200-300-400-500-600-...)
- Option to increase the time a weapon works (I mean the round items with a letter in it, such as the green L, which gives a laser), price for instance 250 for doubling the time, 500 for doubling it again, 1000 for doubling it again, etc.
- Option to start with a certain weapon (prices dependent on how good the weapon is)
- Option to be able to go through the borders (re-appearing on the opposite site)

This could turn the game into something that would be fun for 10 times as much time, although it will probably cost 10% extra programming time (or less). Nonetheless, I would understand if the developer wouldn't want to introduce such extra's, since it's more like a hobby project of his, to make some small games.

33489972.review:
I checked out the reviews before buying this and I noticed that a few users described the game as "addictive". I didn't take this seriously until I downloaded the game for myself and started playing it. Every single time I 'die', I convince myself that I'll have "just one more round", which naturally turns into several more.

When I think of retro-styled games, I usually think of irritating beeping and booping noises. 'Bit Blaster XL' doesn't punish you with that. There's an awesome soundtrack that only adds to the addictive experience; I don't get sick and tired of the music at all, even when I'm retrying the same level for the dozenth time in a row.

Finally, the controls are simple and easy to learn. I've been playing with a Logitech controller and the game works perfectly with it. I haven't tried playing with the keyboard, but I don't think I want to when I've found that the controller is very responsive.

33424390.review:
[b]Bit Blaster XL - типичный представитель всем хорошо знакомого жанра shoot 'em up.[/b]

Ничего особо примечательного в игре нет, но хорошо заметно, что сделана она на совесть. Её даже можно похвалить за довольно приятное звуковое сопровождение. Стрелять из подбираемых оружий особенно доставляет. Зацикленный на несменяемом пространстве геймплей также радует. Нам не предстоит лететь вперед, как это было в десятках подобных игр. Игровая область ограничивается экраном и из-за этого было изменено и управление: вместо резкого стрейфа корабль плавно отклоняется в сторону. Цена в магазине особенно подкупает. На скидках или по купону можно взять за смешные 2-7 рублей и тут же окупить картами. Как по мне, игра стоит раза в два дороже обычной цены. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=687852444
Помимо прочего, Bit Blaster XL играется куда лучше портативных устройствах (смартфоны, планшеты). Там игра при своей простоте и аркадности становится несравненным таймкиллером в метро или пробке, тогда как на ПК довольно быстро надоедает. 
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=685809402

33260253.review:
Pros:
-responsive controls (no clunky animations to hold back gameplay)
-easy to grasp mechanics (gameplay is simple but has enough depth to reward practice and strategy)
-simple but appealing visual style (bullets and explosions are satisfying, but not disruptive enough to hinder vision)
-great music (each ship has its own unique retro themed track)

Cons:
-in keeping with the retro theme, aiming from a distance is very tricky, so less skilled players may have trouble getting the game rolling (made even more difficult by different ships having different turn rates)
-on the flip side, getting through the early rounds can feel like a chore once you have a good grasp of the mechanics
-powerups have strengths and weaknesses, but balance could use a little tuning (just my opinion)

Summary:
Bit Blaster is an incredibly addicting arcade style shooter. There is a lot of value here for just 99 cents (as of the time of writing). I would strongly recommend this game to any fans of classic arcade shooters, especially those who enjoy replaying games in pursuit of a better high-score.

33209156.review:
I can't see why this has so many positive reviews and so few negative ones.  Rather than being comparable to arcade classics like Asteroid and Space Invaders, it's a pretty average free-to-play mobile game, like an uninspired Tilt To Live clone, up on Steam for some reason.

The good:  Responsive, not buggy, there's a game here with an element of skill.  Graphics and sfx are simple, but appealing.  Seems well-programmed and highly compatible.  Occupies your attention if you need to kill time.

The bad:  Unoriginal.  Slow, dull start.  Awkward control scheme, without enjoyable movement physics (space-themed graphics, but drives like a car).  Success seems more based on randomness than skill, due to random power ups and enemies.  No real depth.  Skinner-box unlockables.  Music is an earworm that gets old fast.

Bottom line: It's not like it's crushingly terrible, and it's certainly not expensive, but why spend time playing this with so many other options?

33208343.review: I bought this game during one of the steam sales, and boy is it ever an addictive arcade game. Once you start unlocking the different ships, each one has a different strategy based on its characteristics. Originally I bought this game to pass the time while waiting for other games to download or update, but then it'd be two hours later still playing this game. Once you get a good round in, you just want to keep trying to beat your highscore in true arcade fashion.

32980801.review:
4/7 - Could be responsible for the revival of the sci-fi genre.

Unlike most games operating out of the "I'm so cheap you have to buy me" market, Bit Blaster XL is exactly what it appears to be - a fun, stupid game where you mow down Space Bleps like the remorseless 8-bit psychopath you are. It's not exactly a big game, but there's more depth than you might think, with cooler ships to unlock and the deep, carnal satisfaction that comes with being the undisputed Bit Blaster champion of your admittedly small friend group. In a world of high mass consumption and wholly unethical consumption across all industries, dare to rage against the capitalist machine by spending very little money on this interstellar orgy of needless carnage.

32908745.review:
What a perfect little space shooter! Don't let the cheap price convince you that this is shovelware. Bit Blaster XL is a great deal of fun.

Imagine Asteroids, except that you control a more maneuverable ship that constantly moves forward, and you face a wider variety of hostile ships that shoot at you.

You can unlock additional ships with slightly different stats (shield count, bomb count, movement speed, hitbox size). Although the ships are all the same basic white palette, and all look kind of similar, they handle differently enough that each one feels like it requires a distinct play style. The game stores separate high scores for each ship, too. The one drawback is that ships must be unlocked in order, meaning you'll have to play for quite some time before you uncover the V8.

Unlockables are purchased using coins that downed enemies and asteroids drop at random during play. This can be a pain, as there are times when you can play for a while without making any progress toward a new ship. On the plus side, finding these collectibles can make even a poor scoring run feel worthwhile, since they bring you that much closer to your next unlockable.

Sessions can last anywhere from a minute to an hour, depending on how well you play. I find that it lines up with my attention span pretty well. Generally, this game is good for a quick round or two while you're procrastinating.

I highly recommend this game if you're a fan of space shooters, or are looking for a cheap, fast game to pad your collections of achievements and trading cards.

32897850.review:
[h1] What is Bit Blaster XL? [/h1]

Bit Blaster XL is "A throwback to the classic quarter eating arcade games of the 80's. Bit Blaster XL is a retro styled, addictive, and fast paced arcade shoot 'em up! (shmup)." -Store page
Well here's my take...
You're a spaceship that shoots bullet against 7 type of enemies.
your spaceship have 10 "weapons" and you can upgrade your ship 6 times.
and that's it :D
[If you didn't get something go https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=631675554
Let's go over this again

[h1]Pros and Cons[/h1]
+True "Throwback" feel
+Variety (Ships,Enemies and Weapons)
+Great soundtrack

9/10 - recommend.

32702647.review:
A simple arcade-like top-down space shooter where the only goal is to survive and rack up a high score. Enemies drop ammo and sometimes coins. Coins are used to unlock more ships (8 total), later ships have more initial shields, bombs, manueverability, and rate of fire. There are separate high scores for each ship.

The power-up system is very minimal. Powerups are randomly generated (14 total types), don't stack and collecting one replaces the previous one. This means that you want to be lucky with which ones are generated and once you get a good one, avoid the rest. I would have preferred a system where power-ups were additive (instead of replacing the prior one) or at least if you picked up multiple of the same ones the effect would be increased.

The game has auto-fire on by default, but manual shooting is recommended to conserve ammo. Power-ups last as long as you don't run out of ammo. If you aren't wasting ammo with auto-fire and don't accidentally collect too much, you should have a hoard of ammo floating around to easily replenish your power-up.

Worth a look if you like very simple top-down shooters and like grinding for high scores.

Other thoughts:
[list]
[*] Bombs don't cover the whole screen unless you're in the center. They also destroy power-ups (but not ammo).
[*] My favorite power-ups are Flame, Blast, and Laser. Homing is nice early, it takes care of enemies automatically but you get overwhelmed later on.
[*] Magnet is pretty useless and just eats up the ammo you usually save for later. Explode feels pretty bad (because of the slow shooting speed) until you unlock ships with better rates of fire.
[/list]

32537571.review:
EDIT: Updated from a No to Yes recommendation.

[h1]Background[/h1]
I am not a fan of arcade shooters. However, I bought this game because it was under a dollar (in terms of USD), and I haven't played arcade shooters in more than a decade. So it was more of a novelty.

[h1]Overview[/h1]
Bit Blaster XL itself is not very innovative. It's a pretty straightforward arcade shooter, with a grindy unlock system for more powerful spaceships. Ironically I preferred the slower, lower-tier spaceship for its easier control haha.

I find the difficulty ramp-up a little unsatisfying. Some spaceships are mere annoyances, while there's 2 particular spaceships that are a must-kill or the map becomes a dodge-em after than a shoot-em-up.

Ammo and Boost/Brake is a limited resource, though the latter is time-rechargeable. The limited ammo is pretty interesting, though I find it a little on the tough side to conserve ammo given that all the Ammo powerups eat through ammo so quickly.

For its price, Bit Blaster XL is pretty alright for a quick, casual play. There's enough gameplay mechanics and polish inside to give you a few good hours spread over a couple of days.

[h1]Music[/h1]
Each ship has its own music. I think my spaceship choice is somewhat related to my preferred choice of tunes. It's a little refreshing when you switch to a new ship after a couple of rounds/days and you hear a new tune.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
I highly recommend using a controller for this game. If you're using controller, you should probably remap the buttons so that you can Fire, Boost/Brake at the same time.

[h1]Performance[/h1]
This game has mild performance issues. Keep VSync on. Although VSync off makes the controls more responsive, but it causes random screen stutters. I'm using i7-7700HQ so it's not a spec issue.

[h1]Overall[/h1]
* Polish: 5/5
* Novelty: 2/5
* Music: 4/5
* Fun: 4/5
* Replayability: 5/5
* Playtime: 0.2 - 0.5 hour each

[h1]See Also: Orbt XL[/h1]
Go get the developer's other game as a Bundle: Orbt XL. It's more addictive and fun.

32342448.review:
"A throwback to the classic quarter eating arcade games of the 80's. Bit Blaster XL is a retro styled, addictive, and fast paced arcade shoot 'em up!"

This line from the description tells it all. A truly awesome game!

It feels like the love child of the classic Asteriods and Geometry Wars with a bit more influence from the former. If you like this genre you'll find a true gem playing this.
The game plays smoothly, I haven't tried the controller as I prefer the keyboard for these kind of games. The 8bit style chiptunes are nice. All the different enemies have a distinct behaviour and attack method, there are a wide range of powerups: you'll like some of them and try avoid the others depending on your play style. 

The author has put a lot of work and love into this piece, and it shows. There are small but important details like the warning stipes at the edge of the screen before an enemy appears, and the fact that you can retry after dying with a single click; exactly how a game like this should be done!
As others said, the game is simple but hard to master, and strangely addictive.

I costs around 1 USD and it's worth every penny. I am looking forward to see other quality games from the author!

32309139.review:
Bit Blaster XL is certainly easy to overlook given a quick look at the screenshots or gameplay, but I have to say I haven't paid so little money for so much fun in a long time.  For the price of what you'd pay these days for 30ish seconds in an arcade, you can buy this endlessly enjoyable arcade-inspired classic.  On the surface it look like it might be a twin-stick shooter, but you actually use a single analog of a gamepad and have to contend with the fact that you are always moving forward.  An interesting challenge for those used to games like Geometry Wars where control is very precise.  It also defaults to an “auto fire” mode which I quickly turned off since there is an ammo element to the game, but I think it does make the game slightly more accessible, which is always a good thing.

What really sets Bit Blaster XL apart from its contemporaries is that it also implements some roguelite mechanics in that, throughout your play session, you're collecting coins to unlock more ships with different characteristics.  They vary in size, speed, firingpower, starting shields (health) and starting bombs.  At first they seem to be more like 'sidegrades' than upgrades, but as you unlock more they clearly become much more capable and allow you to get further – that is, if you're able to control their faster speed.  The best part of this is that each ship has its own musical theme when you use it and they're all pretty solid chiptune tracks.  All of this adds up to a great incentive to play more of what would normally just be a game that centered around chasing high scores.

For the base price of 99 cents, I don't know that this can really be beat as far as the sheer value and how much fun it is.  It's definitely a game I can see myself dipping in to whenever I have a spare 10 or 15 minutes and just want to see if I can knock out my high score.  I fully recommend picking it up even at full price (because who can't spare a dollar) not only because it's a good time, but because a developer like this needs to be encouraged to continue their efforts and dive in to development of even more robust games of this quality.

If you'd like to see more of my reviews, check out my curator page here: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/EndyoGaming#curation

32209281.review: It's funny how arcade games are no longer a booming business. Two decades ago they were all the rage. And this game reminds me of those years. Bit Blaster XL is a throwback in every way. Shooting for points? Check. Powerups? Check. Methods to rack up high scores? Check. Gimmick to keep you comming back? You betcha. This games gimmick is simple. Your ship is on auto-pilot both in acceleration and shooting. You move left and right as well as use turbo and brakes, although you will never stop dead unless you die. You also have an ammo meter that you must build up with pellets enemies drop. Unlockable ships, plenty of power-ups, and retro sound and feel? yeah I recommend this. At $0.99 it's a steal.

32189966.review:
Bit Blaster XL
Oh! solo el nombre nos recuerda a aquellos juegos arcade con los que muchos crecimos donde tenías una nave, munición de diferentes tipos de armas y enemigos a montón. Bit Blaster XL es eso, un juego nuevo que revive lo retro; donde tu meta es  destruir a todo enemigo que se te ponga en el camino o ser destruido por ellos.

Eso sí, con las únicas reglas de hacerlo con estilo, conseguir monedas para obtener la nave que mejor se te adapte e ir batiendo tu record una y otra vez hasta lograr 75,000 puntos en una sola partida. Es tan frenético que se vuelve adictivo. Solo deberás aplicar tus habilidades para esquivar disparos y pasar entre una explosión de ellos mientras te cargas a una bomba que va a soltar más. 
De la banda sonora ni hablamos; esos sonidos de 8bits que amas desde que empiezan a sonar. 
Modos de juego: Básicamente juegas en el mismo punto, lo que quieres hacer es superar tus puntajes pero el juego te da opciones o dos formas de hacerlo, puedes hacerlo con Disparo Automático activado (que se apega todavía más a esos jueguitos de la época de NES y el Nokia 3210, de este último, mi papá tenía uno, recuerdo que además de la serpiente tenía un juego muy al estilo de este) y también puedes desactivarlo (con el que podrás ahorrar munición de tu arma favorita y usarla solo cuando haga falta). Tiene unos gráficos simples y bonitos (nada que te haga llorar los ojos por ver demasiados fotogramas a la vez).


[b] Resumen: [/b]

[list]
[*]Jugabilidad: 10/10, te encantara morir y vengarte (ahora que tienes bombas a tu disposición será más fácil salir de un apuro) Solo dependerá de la habilidad y la practica con la que dispongas; no porque te maten cada 10 segundos debes pensar que el juego es malo y debes darle una nota negativa.
[*]Sonido: 10/10. Es fácil acostumbrarte a los soniditos de tu nave, los disparos enemigos y la música de fondo
[*]DLC: 100/10. ¿Cómo lo explico?… ¡Esa música tan buena que tiene el juego puedes descargarla a tu pc y escucharla mientras haces otra cosa, y es gratis! ¿Qué más puedes pedir?
[*]Modos de juego: 10/10. Tú decides; juegas como hace años en otros juegos o controlas las ráfagas del arma.
[*]Rejugablilidad: 10/10. Más de lo mismo, como ya dije. Es adictivo, va a querer jugarlo una y otra vez para superar tus puntajes, además al conseguir monedas podrás comprar más naves que son ocho en total.
[*]Controles: 10/10. Piensa en lo más suave que conozcas: tu cama, algodón, un peluche, etc. Pues la maniobrabilidad de la nave es todavía más suave que eso.
[/list]

[b]Tiene cromos, tiene logros y además es barato, ¿Qué esperas para añadirlo a tu biblioteca?[/b]

[u]Gracias por leer :3.[/u]

32101831.review:
I recommend this to anyone who wants to play an Asteroids type game with powerups and more ship & enemy variety. 

Pros:
+Great for short periods of time: Only have a few minutes? This game is perfect for that!
+On-going dev support: The game is on version 3 after 1.5 years.  That's rare but awesome for a relatively short game.
+Powerup variety: Took me quite a while to remember what half of the powerup letters meant without looking at the in game cheat sheet. I stuck with the wide shot bursts or long beam type weapons, and got good scores that way.
+Enemy variety: Plenty of enemy types available as time progresses.

Neutral:
~Had to slow down ship often: If I travelled at normal or fast speed most of the time, then I would most likely lose at least one shield.
~Semi addicting score chasingtrying to beat my prior scores for my latest ship or overall was somewhat addicting for a time.

Cons;
~Meaningful ship variety: After unlocking all of the ships, there's only like 2 that I'd consider using anyways.
-Short overall playtime: I didn't expect to get much playtime out of this, but if that matters to you, then I wouldn't buy this game.

32080702.review:
[h1] Задорная Игра.	[/h1]

[i] Bt Blaster XL - весьма задорный минималистичный аренный Shmup, сделанный как ни странно одним-единственным, но рукастым разрабом.
Кстати XL он потому что это улучшенная версия базовой игры которая выходила под мобилы.

Далее по пунктам:
- у нас есть одна квадратная арена, если удариться об границу - здравствуй геймовер!
- в полете мы управлеям скоростью и направлением, остановиться нельзя.
- боеприпасы расходуются, их надо вовремя подбирать.
- уровней и сюжета нет, основная задача - продержаться как можно дольше, заработав при этом максимум очков.
- видов врагов чуть меньше десятка - в основном шары разных размеров, ракеты и их прозводные, а также останавливающийся космический корабль.
- на арене падают монетки за которые можно покупать разные корабли (на это повязаны ачивки), с разным балансом щитов, бомб, скорости и скорости стрельбы.
- также на арене можно подбирать различные временные апгрейды.
- саундтрек представлен довольно драйвовым синтипопом.
- графика минималистичная, но вполне приятная глазу.
- ачивки не слишком сложные, хотя собрать 1.500.000 очков за все раунды потребует времени. 
- до сих пор, регулярно выходят апдейты.
- есть карточки.

Absolutely fantastic little game. Really harkens back to arcade classic, and just like some of those games this is simple, but very VERY addicting. Love this, fun and GREAT value! 

The premise is you are a little pixelated ship in a small walled off area of space. You are auto firing (you can change this) and you need to collect ammo by destroying asteroids, as well as collect power ups, and dodge everything around you, as contact with these will destroy you. Also every so often a coin appears, which upon collection of enough allows the unlocking of a new ship, with various attributes and beneficial upgrades. Nice idea and great execution, highly recommended.

31739369.review:
This game is really small. But for what it is, it is freaking amazing! This game takes the formula of really old retro games like Astriod and updates them with near perfection. The music is really enjoyable, and each ship has a diffferent song that plays with it, which is just the greatest touch ever. I really wish the soundtrack was avaliable for download. There are a few different ships, and while each one has to be bought with coins you randomly get for enemies, it's balanced so it feels less like grinding to get the next ship as it is a suble tutorial to ristrict you to easier ships before giving you accsess to ships that are better, harder to use, or (most often) both.

 Let me jsut tell you: My biggest complain about this game is the shooting soundaffect is a bit out of place. The fact that I have to nit-pick this much for a flaw says a LOT about this game.

 This game may lack in having tons of content, it makes up for in having very hight quaility content, to the point where it's almost perfect. Out of all the games I have played, this one is one of the easiest to pick up and play, and I'm sure I will continue to do so for a long time. At only a dolor, you will not waist a single penny if you buy this game.

难度偏高的一款复古stg游戏，8bit风格音乐很讨喜，同时伴随着新机体的解锁，在使用不同机体进入战斗后的bgm是不一样的
默认键位的操作其实是比较别扭的，只能左右来回摆动前进方向[strike] 不能像某车万那样上下左右随意移动很不爽[/strike] 
后来把减速键改成以前打车万常用的shift之后情况适应了很多

个人目前为止觉得比较友好的机体是花十个硬币解锁的第三个机体
移动初速比较慢，给的残机和bomb较多，操作上可能没有那么让人手忙脚乱，但缺点就是机身很胖，低RPM造成清屏的效率不是很理想，在后期弹幕比较密集的情况下很容易中弹

另外这个stg给人一种沉迷刷分无法自拔的那种感觉，略有毒性，用来杀时间很实用

I'm only writing this review because this game has 3,000 reviews and is at "overwhelmingly positive."  That seems like a jerkoff thing to do and maybe it is.  I don't think Bit Blaster XL is a particularly poor game or anything, it's just not very good and it's weird to me that this random indie game has thousands of good reviews;  it being a dollar game likely being the main reason why.

Basically, BBXL is a momentum-controlled, single-screen arcade shooter with a number of different ships and weapons.  The gameplay and presentation are fine, and that's worth something since BBXL is a dollar game, but there's nothing here to make me want to play it over any other games of a similar style.  Costing a buck at full price doesn't really matter to me since price point doesn't impact my enjoyment of games.

31573494.review:
[h1]This review is my personal Opinion on the game. i will be reviewing the main features of the game. Thank you.[/h1]

[b]I got this game with a 75% off coupon.[/b]

This game is a simple arcade asteroid shooter.
You have a basic rocket with a "Auto Fire" Option i found it annoying because i kept running out of ammo. But it is way harder without it. When you kill blobs you get score and ammo and occasionally coins.
With coins you can buy new rockets, The new rockets have different abilities. The point of the game is to get a high score.


It starts off with small blobs and they get bigger And eventually rockets come and try to shoot you down.
Until eventually you don't even know what is going on.
Theres also trading cards which is a plus.


[h1]Pros[/h1]

[b]-Unlimited replays for the price of one live in a real arcade

-Fun addictive and worth the price!

- A variety of rockets to try out.

- Leaderboards

- Trading cards[/b]


[h1]Cons[/h1]

[b]- Repetetive (New maps would be cool)

- Could find something almost the exact same online for free

- Controls are a little to sensetive (At least for mouse)[/b]


[h1]CONCLUSION[/h1]


For the price i deffinetly recommend the game!

It's a simple arcade shooter And that's all there is to say about it!

[h1]Rating: 8/10[/h1]

31456114.review:
Jogo estilo árcade, simplista e mesmo assim um bom passatempo. Por ser barato com certeza vale pra qualquer um que se interessar pelo estilo. 
Basicamente o jogador controla a nave que fica atirando em linha reta até ficar sem munição, o jogador tem que pegar power ups e munição, desviar de ataques inimigos e manobrar a nave para que os tiros acertem algum inimigo. A dificuldade aumenta conforme o tempo passa, o jogador também pode encontrar moedas e liberar naves com atributos um pouco diferentes. Tudo isso enquanto se tenta superar o score anterior.
-------------------------
Arcade style game, simplistic and yet a good pastime. For being cheap is certainly worth to anyone who is interested in the style.
Basically the player controls the ship that is shooting straight until it runs out of ammo, the player has to pick up power ups and ammo, deflect enemy attacks and maneuver the ship so the shots hit some enemy. The difficulty increases as time goes by, the player can also find coins and unlock ships with slightly different attributes. All this while trying to overcome the previous score.

31288858.review:
NOTE TO THE DEVELOPER: one of my friends stated that my thoughts and feelings about your game are “a bit harsh,” and that “the indie might take it personally.” With that in mind: to you, sir, I advise you not to take my review personally. My overall dislike of your game, explained below, is no summary of your character, nor of your potential at making great games in the future. Now, let us begin. 

Bit Blaster XL is one of the worst things that ever happened!

In this sadness simulator, Bit Blaster XL, players learn nothing about themselves, nor of the state of mankind, nor of the meaning behind their mortality. This “game,” which makes 9/11 look good in comparison, gives no commentary, holds up no mirror to the soul, and is no better than terrorism.

At best, Bit Blaster XL is like innocent babies getting eaten alive.

It is a Zika-carrying mosquito, compared to True Works of Art—like Big Mutha Truckers 2: Truck Me Harder. 

In the THQ-published classic Big Mutha Truckers 2: Truck Me Harder, players see depictions of life in the United States, specifically in The South. It is a great work of video game realism.

Meanwhile, Bit Blaster XL depicts nothing real nor fantastic, and offers no cultural transmission superior to feces spewing forth from a wrestler’s anus. It normalizes racism, and it is worse than Slavery. In fact, Bit Blaster XL manages to be vomit mixed with semen. Even when compared to famously-Worst Games, like E.T. the Extraterrestrial. 

E.T. the Extraterrestrial, famous for its frustrating “gameplay,” at least provides players a touching message about the lives of Illegal Immigrants. While Bit Blaster XL depicts No Life—just soulless, joyless spaceships, amid Space Trash.

One of my friends asked me, as I was discussing this vile garbage with him, “And what is bit blaster in comparison to older arts, like literature?”

Well, in Tolstoy’s Anna Karenina, for example, [spoiler] we see a hot aristocratic mom, Anna, become bored with her suffocating marriage to Karenin. We see her cheat on her husband with the handsome, virile Vronsky, and thus, her family gets destroyed (via her quest for a non-boring life). And by the end of the near-800-page, exquisitely-written novel, we see Anna fall deep into depression with Vronsky, with whom she has moved in. We see her spiral into an existential quagmire, one from which she cannot escape. Except by one method. [/spoiler]

And what does Bit Blaster XL allow us to see? 

Nothing! 

Compared to Tolstoy’s classic, Bit Blaster XL is a Mass Grave—mere seizure-inducing lights appearing on a screen, set to the tune of blindfolded men screaming.

Bit Blaster XL is a digital form of ISIS.

And so, I recommend you save your dollar, and your time. Life is short, and you need not spend any of it on this child porn which masquerades as “Art.” 

Oh, and DON’T GIVE IN to the fact that the developer continues to update his game more than a year post-release, and even answers questions when players email him. Such behavior merely shows his inability to countenance the horror of this plague he’s unleashed on the world.

So overall, I’d say it’s okay.

5/10

Вы такие собираете монетки, открываете новые боевые корабли и... и что, блеать!? Чтобы получить новое унылое гавно, но немного лучше?

Fun little top down shooter, reminicient to a slow-building-paced version of Geometry wars. 

Pros:
- 100% custom control bindings
- Great soundtrack
- love the graphics
- nice scaling on the enemy density 
- powerups are fun (flamethrowing is my favorite by far)

Cons:
- The turning isrelative no matter which way you're facing (left / right always turns the ship left or right, relative to it's current direction) rather than the stick being set to "which way should the ship be pointing" kind of control. It's a bit of an awkward choice, but not too bad once you get used to it.

Fantastic game in the end, can't wait to finish unlocking all the ships!

30915698.review:
A great throwback to the old arcade games like Galaga and many others. 

Bit Blaster XL takes place on one screen with and endless onslaught of enemies that keeps getting more intense over time. You can pick up weapons that each have different variety just like in Contra. You can unlock more ships that have different play styles like more speed, smaller/bigger, and more health. You can also pick up health/shields and boosters that used when you speed up or slowing down. My only complaint is weapons you pick up will replace the one you are currently using so it won't matter if you pick it up by accident.

Rating: 9/10

Super simple, super fun - kind of like a single-screen Luftrausers. 

You can't stop moving, which is what makes it work - your aim and timing has to be dead-on or you plough inexorably into your target. 

Because of this, it has the great and rare quality that every death feels like your fault - you always know just what you did wrong, and you could totally have done better. 

It's a fun and silly one-more-try game to fill in ten minutes. Or twenty.... or thirty... 

Absolutely worth the price. Buy it.

I wasn't really sure why this had overwhelmingly positive. And I still don't. It's asteroids. I gave it a good hard look but apart from the shiny new graphics and a couple powerups, it's asteroids. Maybe I just don't have the nostalgia because I'm a scummy teenager from the new generation whos been spoilt by call of duties and hd rendered porn. It's a fine game, especially considering it's the developers first game. And it's dirt cheap. 

But to me it's basically the same as a hundred free flash games online. It hasn't really done much with the formulae besides said powerups previously mentioned (and possibly new enemies I never saw because my attention span has been crippled by ten years of internet use) I was expecting a 'shower with your dad sim' kind of 4th wall break where the game would go suprise! there's more! But it never came. 

Overall, if you like asteroids, and feel like giving a new developer some money, this is for you. I got it with a humble bundle, and I wouldn't have really played it otherwise. I prefer minesweeper during my coffee breaks.

30497166.review: This is a prime example of a "just one more round" game. Its that game you start to play and then get a highscore, and feel an addiction to beat it and get a better high score. That cycle goes on, and on, and on. This game seemed boring as hell when i saw it on sale at its 69 cent price point, but it was for some reason the highest rated game in its pricing range. I gave it a shot, since i had a dollar left i thought it wouldnt be too much of a loss if it turned out to be a boring game. I was wrong. Games this cheap generally are outright boring, but this game is the opposite. The graphics and just general UI are very well done in the 8 bit theme, and the music fits the game and the theme very well. Sound effects from shooting, explosions, etc sound just like they should with that "arcadey" kind of sound. This game is a steal for 69 cents, i would go so far as to say even the 1 dollar price point its at when not on sale is worth it. If you have a dollar left in steam money, just pick this game up. Trust me, you will get addicted real quick.

I want to like this game. I want to like it so badly, but there are a few things that hold it back, at least for me.
Chief among them is the controls. I like my ships to go where I point, not rotate how I tell them. I'm comparing this game to Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved, and if the movement of the ship was handled like it was in that game I'd enjoy it a lot more -- especially since it would make aiming much easier. I guess it comes down to the disign choice where your ship can't stop moving -- I see the complexity it adds, but even if there was a way to make a control stick correspond to which direction the ship was facing it would be mch appreciated. The other things I dislike -- like a lack of wraparound -- are largely a matter of taste and don't affect my experience that badly, but the controls really hold this game back.

As far as the positives go, the other reviews are largely correct when they sing this game's praises. For the ridiculously low price point, having that many different ships and weapons is downright insane. There's a lot here, and I really want to dig into it further, but without any way to change the controls it may be stuck on the shelf for quite some time.

That said, if this game is on sale it becomes stupid cheap, and it's still inexpensive on its own, so if you want to spend a buck on steam, there are worse ways.

All in all, promising game with huge potential undone by controls that, while they do what they're supposed to, work against the tight maneuverability these sorts of games are known for. The low, low price point redeems a lot o the flaws, but since I still won't be getting much enjoyment out of it, I have to give it a thumbs down.

30035582.review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

Bit Blaster XL is an arcade top down twin stick shoot'em'up.

+ Gameplay is very easy to understand
+ The player, enemies and bullets are easy to recognize
+ Very addicting
+ Many weapons
+ Quick enough to be good for lunch break
+ Works on Arch Linux

[h1]Review[/h1]

The objective of the game is very simple: you control a ship and have to destroy every enemy on screen. The ship controls are one the main difficulties of this game. Your ship moves automatically so you can only steer left, right, thrust or break. Thrusting or breaking uses energy, which is automatically replenished over time. Firing can be automatic or manual. The ammo is limited and can be refilled by getting ammo dropped from enemies. You also have bombs, which destroys the majority of enemies on screen, but will also destroy items.

There is a wide variety of enemies, such as, meteorites, bombs, other ships and black holes. The enemies are not easy to hit due to the controls and some fire at you making it specially hard to get near. As the game goes on more and more enemies show up, some firing multiple bullets, which eventually turns the game into a bullet hell. Fortunally one good aspect of this game is that everything is very easy to distinguish, so there are no excuses, the game is just hard.

There is a wide variety of weapons, each with it's own pros and cons. Weapons show up randomly on screen. Some weapons shoot multiple bullets, others fire one powerful blast and others have special abilities like bouncing. Thrusting or breaking may change the weapon behavior. In particular the shield weapon rotates the shield faster or slower. You need to master every weapon to be proficient in this game. Of course can always use a bomb if the game gets to hard.

Finally there are multiple ships. You can unlock ships by getting coins. Coins are randomly dropped by enemies. The best ship gives you faster firing rate, more lives, more bombs and more speed. However, note that faster firing rate also means that your ammo will run out faster, so at some point you need to go to manual firing. There are eight ships in total and later ships are just better than the previous. It is a linear upgrade system.

The game is arcade style, meaning that the real objective is to get high scores. The high scores are published online and count per ship and auto-firing option. I find this fair since both make a lot of difference. There aren't many acheivements in this game. One of the achievements is getting to 75k score but it is fairly easy to get there. It is small but fun.

In the latest version you can set the keys as you see fit. With the controller I recommend setting the D-Pad instead of the analog sticks because it is more precise. Better yet use the keyboard which is I find to be more precise than the gamepad. It is an experimental feature but I didn't find any issues with it.

It's a small fun arcade style game. I recommend it if you like these kinds of games.

30023950.review: I really enjoy this game.  (In particular, I think the most recent revision has really added to gameplay value, with bombs and 1ups specifically.)  The feel is more "nostalgia" than "retro" for me, as I am middle-aged, and remember the Golden Age of Arcade Games well enough.  But it really is that sort of flavor of a game- "quick": a quick moment to play, and learn.  The action is simple enough I enjoy playing it again and again.  The strategies are a lot like the old arcade classics, too.  This isn't a game that works well with old school arcade controls, however- I have yet to try a gamepad.  But guide authors here seem to be right that a gamepad controller is a good advantage.

29874167.review:
Bit Blaster XL is good bit of casual fun. Reminds me of Super Crate Box a little bit. Very simple mechanics, very addictive, very, very affordable. You can make back most (if not all) of the price of the game easily by selling off Inventory cards obtained from playing it, it's that cheap. 
The music is catchy and I like that the background music changes with each new unlocked ship. It gives the player a reason to get enough coins to unlock one other than a different ship sprite and slightly different stats. 
I really like that there is such a variety of content in such a simple game. Lots of different enemies, obstacles and powerups. My favourite powerups are the Fire/Laser ones(they act pretty similar to each other), the Homing one, and the Exploding one. The Magnet one is entirely detrimental in my opinion, however I don't think that having negative powerups is a bad thing, it makes avoiding them a challenge plus it gives you a reason to use the bombs, as it removes them from the screen. 
I didn't find much use for Autofire mode, I prefer to aim manually and only shoot when I think I'm on target rather than constantly spraying bullets.
I think it would be really cool if the different ship types had mechanics entirely unique to each other; for example, different default firing type/rate, or the amount of ammo the ship can hold at once.
Definitely worth a play, especially at the price of a toilet roll.

Es desafiante porque el control es confuso a proposito, la cantidad de naves comprables es bastante aceptable por el precio y se puede acceder a todo su contenido simplemente jugando el titulo.
La frase "ahora si lo voy a lograr" toma muchísimo protagonismo en este titulo que en verdad no puedo dejar de recomendar, ya que la relación calidad/precio es excelente.
No lo duden, vale invertirle ese dolar a esta maravilla.

29497668.review:
Bt Blaster XL - весьма задорный минималистичный аренный Shmup, сделанный как ни странно одним-единственным, но рукастым разрабом.
[i]Кстати XL он потому что это улучшенная версия базовой игры которая выходила под мобилы[/i].

Далее по пунктам:
- у нас есть одна квадратная арена, если удариться об границу - здравствуй геймовер!
- в полете мы управлеям скоростью и направлением, остановиться нельзя.
- боеприпасы расходуются, их надо вовремя подбирать.
- уровней и сюжета нет, основная задача - продержаться как можно дольше, заработав при этом максимум очков.
- видов врагов чуть меньше десятка - в основном шары разных размеров, ракеты и их прозводные, а также останавливающийся космический корабль.
- на арене падают монетки за которые можно покупать разные корабли (на это повязаны ачивки), с разным балансом щитов, бомб, скорости и скорости стрельбы.
- также на арене можно подбирать различные временные апгрейды.
- саундтрек представлен довольно драйвовым синтипопом.
- графика минималистичная, но вполне приятная глазу.
- ачивки не слишком сложные, хотя собрать 1.500.000 очков за все раунды потребует времени. 
- до сих пор, регулярно выходят апдейты.
- есть карточки.

Как итог: несмотря на общий минимализм и на относительно небольшой контент, игра оказалось весьма годным и драйвовым Shmup`ом. Сюжета и прогресса здесь особо нет, но есть хороший геймплей и соревновательный момент связанный с тем кто больше наберет очков. Любителям жанра рекомендую!
10 shmup`ов из 10.
