29622857.review:
It's good, mostly because it's cheap. I like the graphics, the sounds, the steering and all that. While core mechanic of flying and shooting is nice, everything else is rather bad from game design point of view (at least as far as I can tell):
- the power ups aren't balanced at all. And you get them at random.
- the ships aren't balanced at all. The ship progression is super quick and after that there's really no point in using anything other than the best ship.
- the ammo is just a nuisance, with most weapons it isn't even an issue. I don't feel like it adds anything good to the game.
- the pick-ups (shields, boost and bombs) aren't balanced

I still think it's fun, but it could've been so much more if some thought went into it.

Reviewupdate:
Mein letztes Review zu Bit Blaster XL war ja durch die Steuerung eher negativ.

Die einfach gehaltene Grafik und Animationen mag ich sehr, die verleihen einem so einen Stoß zurück in die Vergangenheit und lösen in einem ein nettes Arcade-Feeling aus. Für den geringen Obolus, ist das Spiel auf jeden Fall einen Kauf wert!

29475858.review:
Personal, having played astroids alot if any of you remember that lovely arcade game (i'm sure you do), this game has a nice progression and a good set of features.

For a dollar, what you are getting is worth a dollar. Personally its only worth about 1 hours (4 if you are achievement hunting) of gameplay, only because its otherwise just a tedious grind up a leader board. To put things simply, here is a list of positives and negatives

POSITIVES:
+ Switch between auto fire and manual fire is well apperciated. I hated auto-fire and I was glad to have gotten rid of it the second i could, but i am sure there are those who enjoy it.
+ Enemies progress rather evenly and fairly, posing a learning curve that is rather simple in nature but more difficult to master entirely
+ Having Fuel - It makes you have to think about your usage of speeding up and slowing down. Adds to the challange appropriately
+ Panic Bombs - Panic Bombs are great in small amounts, as sometimes a situation gets a bit out of hand and its nice to slam.
+ Leaderboard - If you are dedicated enough (like in the old arcades) to try to beat others, minues well find out where you have to be.
+ There is a beta. The fact you are still updating it free off is probably the most admirable thing, even if it is tiny little updates.

NEGATIVES
- The ship upgrades are pretty much progress for the sake of progress. They don't add anything into the game really, not even on the leader boards, so picking the V8 is a given. Minus well start off with it.
- Controls were learned quickly but some of the firing angles were a bit frustrating. I don't always expect to hit my target but its nice to be able to adjust and not miss fire off the sides.
- Some of the weapons with manual fire are rather frustrating, as either they don't give a shot off immedietly in some cases (at least in magnet mode, if not two others).
- It would be (in my opinion) nice if shields and bombs stacked past four. It is a rather shame when an upgrade passes by and I simply have no capability to utilize it when using a maxed ship. At least some extra room even with the top tier ship gives some bounses for going out of your way to get them.

29468155.review:
Addictive and cheerful. It's one of those games that make me say "okay, just one more round, but that's it". 

It's a very simple game, though, so I'd say it's worth a dollar, but not much more than that.

29464979.review:
ホテルの 大浴場にかならずある 卓球台
その卓球台の傍に 20年前からそこにあるかのような 古いアーケードゲーム

卓球で一汗かいて、フルーツ牛乳飲みながら 
長風呂でなかなか出てこない相手を待つ その退屈しのぎに
時間潰せればどうでもいいやと 100円玉を放り込んで
きがつくと ムキになっていて　100円玉をどんどん飲まれていった・・・

そんな感じですかね。このゲーム
見た目はジミなんですけどね。騙されちゃ駄目ですよ


というのも、このゲーム　作りがすごくアーケードぽいのです
ゲームスタートから 30秒ぐらいたつと、敵がいきなり殺しにかかってきます
３分ぐらい粘ってると いい加減にしろよとばかりに さらに敵が増量してきます
でも そうやって襲い掛かってくる敵やいん石を プチプチ潰すのが
とても気持ちいいのです

操作性が 2Dの車ゲーによくある 進行方向を 左右キーで動かすという方法と
ドット絵で構成されている敵や隕石、自機の姿等で レトロっぽい雰囲気を漂わせてますが 
中身はしっかり作りこんであって バランスも良好
上手くなるにつれ 欲がでて、そしてその欲で負けるのも アーケードっぽいです
でも 負けたにせよ 即再戦できるので、ストレスもありません


ただこのゲーム一つ文句を言わせてもらえれば
ゲーム内でお金を貯めて 新しい機体をゲットできるシステムなんですが
お金が ボムをつかって敵を一掃すると、お金も消えちゃうのです
ただでさえ 貯めにくいシステムなのに、ボムで 金の隕石（お金４つでる）を
叩き潰した日には ほんとうに やっちまった感が・・・


でも まあ本当に楽しいです。 巨大ボスみたいなのもでてこないし
ストーリーも存在してないけれども、ワンコイン（98円）で買えますから

レトロなアーケードゲーム機に 100円突っこんだ感覚で 買って遊んでください
たぶん 後悔しないと思います

게임안에는 여러가지의 무기들이 존재하는데 좋은거/쓸만한거/안좋은거/차라리 기본무기 처럼 좋은무기와 안좋은무기가 있습니다

제가 생각하기에 좋은 무기는
H(주황): 유도미사일 나는 탄약만 먹고 알아서 적을 죽여주기때문에 탄약공급도 좋고 점수도 잘올라감
F(노랑): 화염방사기 내가 가는길을 엄청난 화력으로 뚫어줌
L(초록): 레이저 F와 마찬가지로 내가 가는길을 레이저로 뚫어줌

29452155.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a retro-stylised fast-paced arcade shoot ‘em up developed by a small indie developer. 

Graphically, it is clearly an homage to the first generation of videogames from the ‘80s. The visuals are primitive, but fit with the themes of the game, and the same can be said about its unsophisticated sound effects and retro-y soundtrack. Frankly, there is not a lot to say about them as they speak for themselves.

As the title might suggest, the gameplay involves controlling a ship which cannot stop and has to blast as many obstacles on the screen without touching any of them, their own laser blasts, or the edges of the screen. You can collect green blobs as ammo each time you destroy an obstacle and pick up a variety of outright crazy power-ups to enhance your survival. When your ship gets destroyed, you rinse and repeat. Other ships with different statistics (speed, shields, firepower, etc.) do become available by unlocking them with accumulated coins you might have collected from previous playthroughs. The goal is straightforward. Aim for the highest score by surviving the longest.

The controls are simple and intuitive, which is good news for a game like Bit Blast XL that focuses on quick reflexes. You use WASD or the arrow keeps to maneuver the ship and the Spacebar to drop a limited supply of bombs to eliminate everything on screen. The latter is a nifty new ability added after the 3.0 patch that gives the player some room to breathe once in a while (I will explain soon), although it does make the difficulty a tad easier than in the original version. You can also toggle in the options whether you want the ship to shoot automatically or manually if you want to preserve ammo.

But beware! Beneath Bit Blast XL’s simplistic look lies a game which entails a good degree of swiftness, strategy and patience. While it is easy to get into, the difficulty surges over time with more obstacles and even hostile ships showing up on screen. Things heat up rapidly and the screen gets very cluttered. It gets pretty crazy, almost as if you are under LSD.

In the long run, playing Bit Blaster XL is like playing a conglomerated version of Space Invaders, Geometry Wars and Luftrausers. There is no denying that the game got a lot of inspiration and borrowed elements from the abovementioned games, but its execution is nearly-perfect. I cannot see any critical flaws with its gameplay, except that it might get tiresome after a long session. However, there is some element of addictiveness to it, especially if you are an OCD person.

In conclusion, Bit Blaster XL is a genuinely fun arcade game where you can play for as long as you want. Got 10 minutes to spare and have nothing else to do? Boot it up and blast everything in your path! There is no story nor pretentious vibe to it. Just pure fun gameplay like in the old days. The price tag, even at full price, makes this game a must-have. Highly recommend it! Personally, I suppose my only regret is having other priorities, as my playtime for such a fun little game is criminally low.

Bit Blaster XL is simply quite a…blast!
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=789141454

29348527.review:
(This review comes to you courtesy of ArtificialRaven.  Thanks, man.)

[i]Bit Blaster XL[/i] can easily be described as a tribute to the arcade classic [i]Asteroids[/i].  The main twist is that there are powerups, various spaceships trying to kill you (unlike the UFO that would originally fire around randomly), and bombs that wipe the screen clear of enemies and enemy projectiles (unfortunately, it will also wipe out all pickups and coins on the screen).  Aside from that, there isn't much else that can be said.  No bugs or glitches to be found and the controls operate well.

Is [i]Bit Blaster XL[/i] worth asking price ($1)?  Probably, but knowing that you'll 100% it in 3 hours, you might want to wait for a sale.

7/10  An upgraded [i]Asteroids[/i] experience.

29335533.review:
80년대 감성을 완벽히 재현해낸 우주 최강의 슈팅 게임.

게임 그래픽이 어딘가 갤러그나 스페이스 인베이더 같은 게임이 떠오른다. 그러고보니 저 게임들도 슈팅 게임이었지. 왠지 한 판 할 때마다 100원짜리 동전 하나 넣고 플레이해야 할 것 같은 기분이다. 어딘가 80년대 레트로 아케이드의 감성이 떠오른다. 이것이야말로 진정한 RETRO다.

한 화면 안에서 우주선을 조종해 양 옆에서 몰려오는 것들을 격파해나간다. 특이하게도 탄알 개념이 존재하는 게임인데, 탄알을 다 쓰면 더 이상 공격을 할 수 없다. 다른 오브젝트를 격파하면 나오는 탄알들을 지속적으로 공급해줘야 한다. 슈팅 게임으로써는 대단히 이색적인 시스템이다. 따라서 오토파이어는 가급적이면 끄는 편이 좋다. 그리고 게임을 플레이하며 코인을 획득하게 되는데, 이건 성능이 더 좋은 우주선을 해금하는 데 사용된다. 그 밖에 액셀과 브레이크가 있긴 하다만, 개인적으로는 거의 안 썼던 것 같다.

다양한 무기들이 준비되있다. 다만 이런 방식이 항상 그렇듯, 좋은 무기와 구린 무기의 성능이 확 갈린다. 좋은 건 정말 좋고, 구린 건 아예 못 써먹을 정도로 구리다. (솔직히 레이저나 블래스트, 프레임 빼곤 다 구린거같다.) 그래도 다양한 무기가 준비되있어 처음엔 이거저거 성능 구경하는 재미는 있다.

시간이 지나면서 더 까다로운 놈들이 등장하고 화면은 금방 적들과 탄막으로 도배가 되어버린다. 게임이 금방금방 정신사나와진다. 자신이 지닌 게임 센스만큼, 정직한 점수를 보여주는 게임이다. 진정한 의미의 피지컬 게임.

작년 말, 한 차례 대대적인 업데이트가 이뤄졌다. 성능이 한 층 강화된 우주선이 추가됐고, 폭탄 개념이 새롭게 생겼다. 그 밖에 무기들도 전체적으로 성능이 좋아지는 등, 게임이 한 층 쉬워졌다. 덕분에 예전에 비해 고득점을 기록하기가 쉬워졌고 75,000점을 기록하는 도전과제 역시 한 층 쉬워졌다. 출시된지 꼬박 1년이 된 게임인데, 꾸준히 게임을 다듬고 팬들과 교류를 한다는 점이 너무나도 훌륭한 게임이다.

작지만 아주 알찬, 완벽한 게임!! 평가가 '압도적으로 긍정적'인 것에는 다 이유가 있는 법이다. 이런 게임을 단 돈 1,100원(세일하면 더 싸지기도 한다.)에 구매할 수 있다는 게 가장 큰 행복일 것이다.

[i]Shoot bits with a blaster. Hopefully easy to comprehend.[/i]

[h1]The Good Stuff[/h1]
++The perfect game for killing time when you need to past it by for 10-15 minutes
+Games last anywhere from 10 seconds to 100,000 seconds
+Achievements provide extra challenges as well as replay value seeing as most require a very high score
+Keyboard and controller support, both work great
+Leaderboards, high scores, point system, a lot of features for a small game
+Great retro soundtrack!

One of the best indie/retro games I've ever played! It might get boring and repetitive after a while but for a game thats 49 cents (on sale), its a BLAST! Hehehe. I would rate this game a 9.5/10. It does get kind of boring but its a great game to play if you're offline. OH MY GOD, the soundtrack is godly, you'll love it! It's one of the best soundtracks to a video game ever, and keep in mind, the person who made this game makes this game on his free time! It's super fun and not to mention diffucult (for me anyways). DO NOT BUY THIS GAME IF IT IS NOT ON SALE! But not to worry, it goes on sale quite often, just put it on your wishlist and you will be notified. This game is also SUPER easy to run, no need of a beast gaming computer, a $200 notebook laptop would play this game great.

Pros:

+Cheap
+Fun
+Amazing Soundtrack
+Easy to run
+Fun to play offline

Cons: (They are honestly not that big of a deal)

-Can get boring sometimes


Great game! Would reccomend it to everyone!

29017403.review:
[h1] Blast off! [/h1]

There are many retro-esque games that merely mimic the art style, having gameplay that wasn't possible for the time, overdetailed models, and complicated controls. They don't have believable worlds and couldn't be on an 80's console due to the size. Retro games were all about simple games and concepts put into many levels. 

Bit Blaster XL is amazing in creating the illusion that you're playing on an NES. The graphics are on point with the pixel theme, the music feels like an upgraded version of that of "Space Invaders", and the gameplay is golden.

In this game, you take control of a pixel spaceship, your goal is to destroy the enemy fleet which is invading your territory. You do this by collecting one of many powers to help you destroy astroids and ships. But be carefull! If you fly into the edge of the map you instantly die.

[h1] Thoughts and Opnions [/h1]

In conclusion, Bit Blaster XL is a game that everybdy with over 15 minutes of time should play. I give Bit Blaster XL a score of 9.5/10, with the title of "Fit for an arcade; an instant classic".

29017168.review: I was a bit surprised when I heard this game is actually a mobile - steam port. Most of these types of ports are low-effort overpriced trash that's extremely poorly optimized, but this feels like a polished indie title made for Steam. It's really cheap (i'd personally pay $2.99 - $4.99 for it), and it usually goes on sale, so if there's ever a sale and you have a few cents left over, this should be the first thing you get.

29013642.review:
la seule chose que j'ai à dire à propos de ce jeu : il est vraiment cool. Même si les graphismes et les sonorités 8-bit peuvent repousser certains adeptes du "tout en 3D", pour les autres, je pense qu'ils sont du même avis que moi. Les thèmes changent en même temps que l'on change de vaisseau, ce qui les rends encore plus unique. Parlons-en du design de ces vaisseaux, ils on chacun un design qu'il leur est propre. Le gameplay est assez simple à prendre en main ce qui rend le jeu accessible à n'importe qui... Cependant, les hardcore-gamers ne seront pas en reste non plus puisque la difficulté augmente assez rapidement au fur et à mesure que le score défile. 

Au final, les impressions sont très bonnes, le jeu est vraiment sympathique et si vous souhaitez soutenir un (très) petit dévellopeur en lui donnant un euro symbolique, n'hésitez pas, foncez acheter ce jeu.

29103257.review:
Bit Blaster XL is an arcade-styled game in which you control a multitude of different types of spacecraft in order to survive the incoming asteroids/enemies.

Graphics - 7/10
Gameplay - 7/10
Soundtrack - 11/10

The reason for my lower ratings on this game's graphics and gameplay were for a few reasons; even for an 8-Bit game, most of the ships look exactly the same.  As for the gameplay, I wasn't focusing on things like replayability or storyline, since it has one task and one option: survive.  There isn't an actual storyline, however you can unlock new ships with different strengths/weaknesses.  Now, the soundtrack is composed of one or two songs, but I could listen to them all day.  The 8-Bit style of music fits with the game perfectly.  Overall, I would highly reccomend this game.  For the price, I think it's worth giving it a try.

28931132.review: Fun, addictive, retro styled shooter. Can't get enough of this game! And for 50 cents! Not to mention the soundtrack, 10/10. Amazing game for the price, would recommend to anyone. You'll never get sick of this game, or the sound track. Definentally would recommend to anyone for full price, even though I got it on the winter sale. This game is wonderful. The gameplay, which is basically just running around in circles shooting balls that drop ammo, gets harder as the game progresses. Enemies start to appear, which shoot rockets at you. You start of with a shield, and after one hit, its gone. Then, if you take another hit, your done. You have to restart. Which, honestly, doesn't get repetitive, surprisingly. I've only gotten to around 4k score myself. There are many powerups in this game, such as a lightsaber to whack through the big balls, or grenades that spurt out little balls on impact. And, a little cool feature, coins that drop as you get farther in the game. With these coins, you can unlock different space ships. (You can't buy coins either, which is amazing. You actually have to play to unlock more space ships, which I think is a great feature. Non pay 2 win.) This game; I just can't get enough of it. 10/10, a fun retro style shooter that doesn't get old.

28930601.review:
Bought this game because I had a few cents left in an old gift card. For $0.50 it was pretty fun and it entertained me for a good few hours.

My only complaint is how unbalanced the power-up system is. Currently, only five of the fourteen upgrades are viable in the late game when bullet hell breaks loose:
'laser,' arguably the strongest upgrade because it synergizes so well with the game's forced movement mechanic; 'flame,' a less accurate version of laser; 'shield,' the most fun upgrade because you become a spinning sphere of death (would be better than laser if you did'nt need to accelerate to activate it); 'homing,' only because it allows you to put 100% of your focus on dodging which usually leads to longer survival; 'blast,' the weakest of the viable upgrades and just a downgraded version of 'flame'. 
Due to this, I regularly found myself actively looking for one of the above which made it a bit repetitive. 

However, this is still an amazing arcade game for its price. I recommend that you try and go for all the achievement because it just makes the runs more fun. Happy shooting!

28930376.review:

Though i bough it for 0.49 USD and am very happy with this purchase, I think that it's full price deserves to be around $2 USD.

28921247.review: This game is a fun, addictive, challenging 'bullet hell' retro style shooter with simple arcade style controls!. It brings a new feel to the arcade style games of the 80's such as; Luftrausers, Asteroids, Space Invaders, Galaxian and Geometry Wars. This game will bring you many hours of random spawning, screen clearing bombs, ship shields and boost pickups, as well as a wide variety of power ups such as Split Shot, heat seekers, lasers, and more. It also offers Steam achievements, leader board, trading cards, emoticons and profile wallpapers to add to your Steam collection. The graphics are basic retro pixel style that really come to life when in action. This easy to learn and play game is a total Blast! I love it. :)

28868656.developer_response:
Hey, thanks for playing my game and leaving some feedback. If you want to rebind the controls to something different you can open the configuration window by holding "ALT" on Windows, "OPTIONS" on OSX, or "SHIFT" on Linux, and then clicking play in steam while still holding it. This will pop up a window and help you change the controls.

Weirdly for the dpad on gamepads, when I had it available before, numerous people were running into problems where their ship would spin constantly without them touching the controller. Its on my list to sort this out, sorry for the inconveniance.

The other points are gameplay points that are specifically part of the game design so theres not much help I can offer there. I can only point out that my main goal was to replicate 80's arcade games while adding some modern touches. So its definitely a score chaser where you would put in quarter after quarter. :)

I hope you find some more fun with my game. Thanks again for playing
-Adam

28856415.review:
***UPDATED BELOW, for anyone interested

Original review:
I'm not sure I understand all the positive reviews for this one.

Some possible improvements:
- option to rebind keys
- borderless arena option
- increase coin drops

I mistakenly thought this would take me back to the classic Egaroids or Asteroids days, but it most definitely does not. Of course it doesn't cost much, so maybe that is why a lot of people are ok with it as is. Hopefully it will grow into the potential of a seriously great game.

Update:
Man, Adam the developer seems like a really great person. I honestly wrote the above thinking not a whole ot of it, since I don't really review games, and since there were SO many positive reviews that I just didn't understand. So I wrote it real quick, checked for spelling errors (which I still missed some) and clicked submit.

But wow, Adam wrote some very thoughtful and amazing comments below (you should definitely read) and then added some updates to the game. I mean, wow, again. That's the sign of someone who has some insanely great work ethic and a lot of pride in his product. I really admire that.

Based on Adam's comments and some time spent in introspection, I'm flipping my recommendation. But I do have to say this: if you are expecting Egaroids or Asteroids from the old days, which I mistakenly did based on my limited research into the game (i.e. looking at the pics from the store page)...know that it is a different game. 

And with the updates from Adam, I can in good conscious say this: a seriously good game to play. 

Thanks for being amazing Adam!  I wish you the best in your gaming career!
28856415.developer_response:
Hey, thanks for playing my game. Bit Blaster XL is nearly a year old now, I think the positivity in the ratings come from the constant evolving of the game over time. If you don't like it now, you would have hated the much clunkier mess it was when I released it. Its my first solo outing on Steam and I have been adding/fixing things throughout the year at a pretty steady pace. You could spend an evening reading the mass ammounts of patch notes :) My end goal for BBXL is to have a solid and complete experience, and then use all I have learned in the last year to craft a bigger, better sequel from the ground up. Utilizing my new skills as well as many of the things the community have suggested as improvements/additions (like borderless arena) that just wouldn't be feasable in this version of the game.

There are a few more things I plan to implements before it hits one year old, including new music / sound sliders (heavily requested), re-bindable key in the game, and perhaps a few more gameplay related surprises.

To address your other concerns, there is currently a less than ideal way to rebind keys, as I just have yet to figure out how to implement it within my game. If you would like to tinker with rebinding keys, you can hold the "ALT" (on win) or "OPTIONS" (on osx) key or "SHIFT" (on Linux) and then press play in Steam to open the configuration window.

The coin drops will increase as you survive longer. The further you are in a round the better chance of coin drops. I found this to be a good balancing method based on increasing cost in ships plus increasing surivability of unlocked ships. 

Hopefully you end up having some more fun with my game, sorry you didn't feel you could recommend it as a good value. 

Happy New Year!
-Adam

28848796.review:
Un buen pariente del clásico Asteroids. Bit Blaster XL es un pequeño pero entretenido juego en el que manejamos una nave espacial en pleno campo de batalla; sencilla diversión estilo arcade de poco espacio y bajo precio.

Tenemos un único modo de juego con tres reglas básicas: Dispara a los obstáculos, esquiva las balas enemigas y no golpees la pared. La meta es sumar la mayor cantidad de puntos antes de colisionar, aumentando la curva de dificultad conforme avanza la partida. Para la primera regla dispones de una variedad de proyectiles con características diferentes, apareciendo de forma aleatoria por alguno de los lados en la pantalla. Para entregar algún incentivo al jugador, está la posibilidad de comprar siete naves con monedas que surgirán de los obstáculos destruidos, cada una de ellas con variables distintas entre los rasgos de velocidad, velocidad de disparo, cantidad de vidas y de bombas.

En el aspecto visual, el juego presenta una apariencia retro con tonos grises, reservando gran parte del color a los ítems que servirán para recargar nuestra munición, los proyectiles y las monedas. Esto logra que el jugador no se pierda entre escenario, caracteres y proyectiles. Más alla de eso, no esperes gran variedad, el diseño de enemigos es limitado y el escenario no varía. 

La música es su punto más fuerte, y lo sería más si se dispusiera de todas las canciones durante la partida, pero los desarrolladores han tomado la decisión de otorgar una pista a cada nave conseguida. Por lo mismo, el increíble trabajo musical que se ha hecho, el cual acompaña de forma excelente al estilo visual pixelado, puede llegar a resultar cansino si se dedica a una sola nave para conseguirlas a todas. Se recomienda ir variando para aprovechar la totalidad del soundtrack.

Echo en falta algunos elementos que podrían expandir la experiencia. La incorporación de un modo con misiones, variedad de mapas o multijugador (2 jugadores en modo local u online) habrían sido ideales para entregar más horas de juego. Los logros de Steam pueden acabarse en unas 3 o 5 horas si eres hábil (no me incluyo), pero por el precio, sin contar la rebaja que alcanza en ofertas, sigue siendo una buena cantidad de tiempo.

Con todo esto, Bit Blaster XL es un juego recomendable si quieres una opción entretenida para darle unas pocas horas intensivas y, una vez compradas las naves y ganados los logros, poder dar una que otra visita en los periodos de ocio para superar tus marcas personales, así como también las del ranking global.

28807155.review:
Bit Blaster XL is an outstanding PC rebuild of the mobile game Bit Blaster (redundancy much?). This game is quite literally Asteroids ON STEROIDS!

With all of these newer games being driven by graphics and story, it's a breath of fresh air to see a game that hearkens back to the golden age of games where the only thing that mattered was getting as high of a score as you could. And that is exactly what the dev wanted from Bit Blaster XL.

The minimalist art style further extends the feeling that you are playing a quarter-eating arcade game from the 80's, along with simple controls that could be played on even an NES controller, short rounds for quick sessions, and competing for high scores with other players.

And now for my big question: For this game, would you rather pay a quarter per-round, or a dollar for as many rounds as you'd like? I'd choose the latter. Seriously, this game is only one dollar; a steal of a deal considering how well-made this game really is. Don't wait for a sale, BUY IT NOW!

28674589.review:
Mindless fun, but don't play on a Mac without a controller.

It's a dollar worth of fun (although I got it at 51% off--WOW!).  I can play it while I'm watching TV, which is nice.   I'm sure it would be better on a Windows machine with a controller.  I played it on a Mac (since that's all I have while I'm away), and the controls are utter crap without a joystick.  I can't use the arrow keys and shoot at the same time, probably because the firing key is Control.  And unbeknownst to me, control + left arrow on a Mac takes you to the dashboard--even in the middle of the game!  And you have to press Control + Option to fire a bomb, because that key is Alt, which is much more accessible on a Windows machine than on a Mac.

What that basically means is I'm stuck using the "autofire" mode, which is still fun enough, but much harder to sustain as you progress.  Especially when you get those sweet ships with the fast rate of fire.  On autofire mode, those ships aren't very useful since they run out of ammo so fast.  I don't think I'll be able to progress much more without a controller.

All of this wouldn't be an issue if we were allowed to designate new keys for the functions.  Please?

28742557.review:
首先这游戏的音乐估计是买新飞船才能“解锁”的，换而言之bgm取决于你用的飞船。而一开始一局游戏一般能拿2-3个金币，攒5个才能买第一艘新飞船，接着是攒10个、攒20个。
但这个游戏的定位是什么？休闲打飞机小游戏。你一个休闲打飞机小游戏还需要我玩一两小时甚至以上才能播放新的音乐？本来我炸机就已经很气了，重复听（个人感觉时长太短，旋律重复且单调所以并不好听）bgm就更气了。
所以我并不认可标签里的好评原声音乐。
另一个硬伤是键位问题，这游戏的方向键可用wasd也可用光标键，但是，

射击（ctrl）和炸弹键（alt）无法调整
射击（ctrl）和炸弹键（alt）无法调整
射击（ctrl）和炸弹键（alt）无法调整

我去啊，你既然“贴心”地准备了两套方向键，为什么只给射击和炸弹一套，还是隔开来的键位呢？

我就不说用一般键盘的玩家了，他们的ctrl和alt只隔一个键，相对来说按的比较轻松。

但是大多数笔记本键盘隔着两个键啊，按着别扭不说（你手大当我没说），我连续几次按炸弹都误按到windows，回到游戏就gg了。

因为你躲子弹和吃增益道具时是要集中精力的，一集中精力的话手指这种别扭的拉太开的姿势就会不自觉地调整，于是，等到你想扔炸弹的时候，你就按到了windows。（windows：怪我咯）

所以另一方面这游戏不禁用windows键也是挺蠢的。。

总而言之，这游戏卖一块钱可以考虑入手，我没试手柄，应该可以比键盘更惬意地玩耍。但如果你是冲着音乐来的，点叉吧，没错的。

Bit Blaster XL, das wohl billigste aber auch tollstes Spiel auf Steam!

Ja, es hat irgendwas von Space Invaidors... oder so.. 

Du spielst eine Rakete die schießen kann.. und du bewegst dich DAUERHAFT! Jetzt fragst du dich, kann das noch was? JA es gibt viele verschiedene Power-Ups und etliche und verschiedene Raketen zum freischalten.. ist zwar etwas knifflich.. aber ich denke das schafft man schon! Also: Wenn ihr noch einen Euronen übrig habt, und ihr sucht etwas tolles, dann ist das eine Kaufempfehlung! (Es sei denn GTA V kostet auch 1€.. dann kauf das lieber)

94/100 -World would blast again

Per quello che l'ho pagato (una manciata di euro) vale tutte le partite che ho fin ora fatto, anche perchè ai tempi una partita in sala giochi costava 200£ che oggi sarebbero su per giù 0.10€ .. insomma: un regalo molto gradito.

28401429.review:
[i]Bit Blaster XL[/i] is a simple shmup in the best way possible! You are, but, a Bit Blaster ship with fininite amount of ammo, shooting down enemies that could destroy you in one shot/touch all while picking up ammo/coins that slowly gravitate towards you, power ups that [could] change how you shoot down said enemies, and sometimes a shield/bomb/boost to help you last just a bit longer to surpass your own score and beyond...

The store page's description of the game (as of Ver. 3.0) is about as accurate as it sounds! The more you play, the more coins you could collect overall to buy the next [better] Bit Blaster ship and so on and so forth... Each ship carries their own strengths and weaknesses in size, speed, rate of auto fire, and initial shield-to-bomb ratio at the beginning of each round... Depending on one's own playstyle, you may gravitate to certain ship versions more than others once you do unlock all of the Bit Blaster ship versions...

Now, at the time of this review, this game for only 0.99 USD seems like the most perfect game within its own genre... In a way, it does suceeed in using its own throwback aesthetic to its advantage while also changing it up a bit with the concept of fininte ammo and now almost-screen-clearing bombs you can activate manually... However, on a more personal note, the game could not recognize my Steam Controller outside of the game's [controller] rumble feature (thus resorting to me playing this game with a PS3 controller binded with 360 controls controller-wise)... Also, despite it's easy-to-play-hard-to-master gameplay, all of the power ups and potential shield/bomb/boost pickups appear at random (just like the enemies only without a pending visual cue), thus finding that one power up/pickup to appear on the screen that you know will give you that [better] edge may not happen soon enough and/or appear too soon to react to it effectively...

Regardless, this game is still fun for the price and still has means to improve like the previous versions of this game! If you are a fan of arcade shooters like [i]Asteriods[/i] (for the obvious comparison/example) or the first few [i]Geometry Wars[/i] games, then it's worth putting some time into... I mean, most of the achievements are prety easy-ish to get, there's Steam Trading Cards (if you're into that sort of thing), and the soundtrack is FREE after purchase! Also, you don't have to wait for a [pending] Steam Sale becuase it's cost [less than] a US dollar in general!

28398520.review:
-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_
Bit Blaster XL
-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_-_


Всем прива ! и пива :-)
Простенькая игруха плана "галлаксиан*, сюжет игры такой : ты вылетел на космическом корабле на орбиту Земли  и должен долететь на планету Марс с большим и жизненно необходимым провиантом(еда,вода,туалетная бумага там, пыво) и только включать свой гипер-драйв как на тебя начинают крошить батон инопланетяне !!!естественно тебе надо выжить , ведь  они c тобой хотят расквитатться эти злобные твари , и постараются сделать всё чтобы подбить твой супер современный оборудованный по последнему слову техники корабль .Инопланетские абармоты, пролетающие на своих космических колымагах мимо тебя ,постреливают из своих устаревших пукалок в твою сторону очень даже прицельным огнём... также летают метеориты , всё это тебе надо разрушить чтоб получить специальное сырьё для твоих пушек, ведь если оно кончиться то твой корабль останется без пушек... Земляне увидя что с тобой твориться на орбите , начинают запускать специальные посылки с разного свойства оружием, ведь они были готовы к этому худшему сценарию, а разные потому-что разные страны их посылают со своих супер космодромов...Даже отсталая маленькая страна Зимбабве арендовала морскую платформу и запускает оружие на орбиту , правда сомнительного маломощного качества !!!
С каждым разом натиск врага будет усиливаться - и только самый стойкий наберёт 75000 экспы и соответственно 100% ачивементса )   и довезёт долгожданный груз на Марс, коллонисты на Вас надеются !!!....................удачи Вам друзья в этом нелёгком испытании...
П.С. - естественно игру пройти нельзя в полном понимании этого выражения , но вот 100% ачива впринципе может считаться косвенным доказательством этого события :-)
пройдена 16.12.2016 г.                          \ Dez \

28352944.review: Plays more like an avoid 'em up than a shoot 'em up. The controls are artificially difficult: the ship constantly moves forward, but you're able to turn left or right and increase or decrease speed. This makes it difficult to navigate in general, while particularly difficult to accurately aim. Ignoring that part of the interface, the game world is well designed. Both enemies and special weapons feel unique and fairly balanced, and the visuals are very informative. The price is right for an arcade game, but I'm not sure it's worth playing unless you're interested in struggling against quirky, obtuse controls.
28352944.developer_response:
Hey, sorry you didn't enjoy the game. I had definitely intended the game to be difficult and play in the way that you didn't seem to enjoy. (always moving and having to think ahead about how to avoid things) I'd love to know what you think if you try it with a controller too, as well, you can change the control buttons through the configuration menu by holding "alt" and clicking play on steam, it will bring up the menu allowing further customization of bindings.

Thanks so much for playing. Heres hoping you have more fun with it.
-Adam

28251191.review:
This is a nice little game to play when your bored, it is fairly simple, and it is more of a casual game, but it can still have a challenging side to it. It has pixelated graphics (the good type of pixelated graphics), and different music for each different space ship. I'm personally a sucker for any game with unlockable characters/abilities and powerups, this game has both. Also, the game has a variety of ways to control the spaceship; the mouse, arrows, wasd, and you can use controllers, this is a nice little touch so that anyone can play the game the way they please. Overall, I liked this game, there are a few downsides though; even with the powerups the gameplay is very simple, making it repetitive. The controls are good, but the way the spaceship works isn't as good, you can't strafe, you can only shoot where your moving towards and you can't stop your spaceship, although you can slow it down. I think adding completely different game modes, and in those new game modes adding a different movement system could help make the game better.

The game is relatively cheap. I would recommend this game to casual gamers, people with a thirst for high scores, or people that just don't have a lot of time on their hands and just wanna play for a bit.

28247279.review: Just started today and it's a pretty good little game, reminds me of astroids.  I like that you included the option to automatically shoot or manually fire.  Also liked the variety of upgrades and ships (haven't unlocked all just yet).  It's pretty simple so not much to explain.  Wouldn't hurt to have just a few seconds of additional instructions about how to collect coins, but it's so simple it wasn't really needed I suppose.  If you make more advanced games I imagine you'll include additonal instructions as needed.

28245780.review: Here's a game that would have been a classic had it been made on the arcade 40 years ago. For it's price it's an absolute must buy.

28232127.review:
Давно не играл Bit Blaster, а тут решил зайти и был не абы-как приятно удивлён, по-скольку игра изменилась во-многом, оставаясь при этом ещё больше интереснее и увлекательнее, каждый залёт - это как отдельная история о бравом пилоте космического пепелаца, катька я тебя люблю, короче, понадобавляли всяких пауэрапов, а также нау мы имеем не онли кнопку газа, бат ещё кнопку "притормозить", она актуальна в основном для пепелацов у которых гравицапа есть, а иф ю хэв ет цапу, то без этой кнопочьки апшэ ни-как.
 Ещё добавил (потому-что разработчик и издатель Bit Blaster является ван персона) атомную бомбу, аж две, и да, их можно фармить в процессе зарубы, теперь стало посибол ресторэ и житки, и ману для ускорения-торможения, поверапы теперь стали бесконечными, - пока есть в обойме выстрелы, - будешь поливать инвайдеров тем апом который в данный момент не кончился, это значительно как - по мне повлияло на мой геймплей. Пишу этот обзор под методоном на димедроле сваренным, и слушаю саундтрэки с Bit Blaster, и они реально качают, их добавили для прослушивания в плеере стима как DLC совершенно бесплатно, за что разработчику огромное спасибо.
 Так же рестартнули таблицу рекордов, и теперь заново нужно открывать все пепелацы, что мне лично понравилось.
 Кароче у Bit Blaster есть будущее, и надеюсь неплохое, так - как игру постоянно усовершенствуют, ото кофе вкусный с лимоном и грецким орешком по утряне вмазавшись перед ним.

28222617.review:
这款游戏 刚开始接触 我还是非常好奇的 毕竟有个各种子弹让游戏可玩性增加了不少 但是 玩到后来才发现 原来是被游戏玩了游戏有着不错的BGM 紧张刺激的游戏体验 但是游戏玩法单一 而且很难超控  一开始玩根本打不到敌人就算熟练了 到后期 也是不停躲子弹躲敌人 找子弹 游戏有着很高的挑战性 很容易让人 停不下来 但是实际体验并不是很好 因为游戏有很多限制机制游戏一般是自动开火（手动根本自顾不暇） 所以子弹无时无刻不在消耗 又因为游戏是有子弹数量的 后期敌人刷新提高后 基本就靠全凭轰砸来开局 但是全屏轰炸会炸掉除子弹外的所有东西 有时候甚至有点得不偿失 然后是战场 屏幕多大活动范围就有多大 在躲避敌人和子弹的同时还有防止撞墙 而撞墙是毁灭性的 ，诸多的限制使得游戏得不到充分的发挥和延展，这几乎摧毁了这个游戏。
    操作       6分
    游戏性    7分
    内容       5分
    玩法        4分
    BGM       7分  
很明显作为一款游戏 这款作品所体现的品质 更像是一件残次品   而作为一款休闲游戏 游戏的设定明显过于苛刻 不过作为一款小游戏 它的特殊性和独立性还是有所体现的 相对于它的价格而言 还是值得体验的 我也相信玩家能够从中获得不少欢乐和成就感 但我并不推荐 个人观点 欢迎碰撞

28215203.review:
Simple yet original asteroids/blasteroids inspired oldschool single screen shoot-em-up, which sees you piloting one of a variety of unlockable ships. Although you'll probably stick to the last, most powerful ship once it's unlocked.

Ship constantly accelerates, which can be slowed down or sped up. And constantly shoots by default, you should probably turn this off. There's a diverse variety of weaponry to be collected, although you'll probably want to avoid collecting them once you've got your favorite weapon. Be sure to keep an eye on your ammo, as when it runs out you'll be downgraded back to the crappy single shot starting weapon.

Great if you've got a few minutes to kill, and those minutes will soon add up to hours. And for only a dollar, you can't go wrong.

9.0/10

28098987.review:
Gioco incredibile, piccolo ma solido.
Nella migliore tradizione dei buoni vecchi giochi semplici ma efficaci, come Pac Man, Bit Blaster XL ha delle regole assolutamente semplici: muoviti, spara agli ostacoli e non farti colpire. L'estrema semplicità di queste regole base viene poi arricchita da power up, nemici sempre più infami e da più navicelle tra cui scegliere.
Cercare di fare il punteggio più alto possibile e sbloccare nuove navicelle sono il motivo per cui tornare a giocare ogni volta questo gioco è un enorme piacere.
Per non parlare del prezzo, su Steam si trovano giochi di infima qualità ad un prezzo più alto di questa gemma di game design che offre persino achievement e carte collezionabili.

Bit Blaster XL è un must per la vostra libreria di Steam.

28090454.review:
Terrible controls!!!  The ship always flies forward, and the left/right turns are relative to the ship direction, not to the screen.  So if it's upside down then good luck.

EDIT: Despite my initial negative impression, the developer response convinced me to give it another try!  I'll reinstall sometime in the future.
28090454.developer_response:
Hey, sorry to hear you don't like the controls. I have made sure to try and be really clear in the store description as to how the game plays, would love feedback as to how I can change it better if you have some :)

Some people indeed have trouble with the controls and I wish there was more I could do, but I can't drastically change them without upsetting all the others that enjoy the old style control. 

Also a good way to play is to just think of it as youre driving the ship, press left when you want the ship to turn left, right when you want it to turn right. Man, that sounds weirdly obvious and stupid when I typed it out, but haha, its not wrong I guess.

Either way, I hope you find some more fun with the game and end up able to recommend it as a good value.

Thanks for playing
-Adam

28088310.review: A great game to play when you just want to to have a good time and don't want any pesky polygons or stories getting in the way

28077889.review:
Bit Blaster XL is very simple arcade shooter with retro art and audio.

It's rather similar to the classic Asteroids, but with a number of powerups and different ships thrown in. It's not very ambitious game by any means, but at this price point it doesn't have to be.

Unfortunately, the controls really killed the game for me. Your ship is always moving forward which can be extremely frustrating at times. You can temporarily speed up and slow down, but you can never stop.

Personally I wouldn't recommend Bit Blaster XL (even at the extremely low price point) as I feel there are far better arcade shooters out there.

The good:
- Nice variety of powerups
- Decent retro soundtrack

The bad:
- Always moving forward is very annoying
- Pixel art is rather ugly
- Powerup balance is not great
28077889.developer_response:
Awe man, sorry to hear you didn't think you could recommend my game. But I guess its not foreveryone :) I just wanted to recreate that classic style of quarter eating arcade game with some modern twists.  Just an FYI, you will be able to download the soundtrack for free DLC starting next Monday (dec 5th) as well, I will be releasing a v3.0 patch then too that may actually address your powerup balance negative. I have rebalanced the way powerups appear so there are less utility powerups at late game and I also have tuned several of the powerups ammo rate, powers, and effectiveness based on user feedback, so that will all roll out then. Let me know if you want early access to the patch and you can give it a go and see if it pushes you over the top to being able to recommend bit blaster.

Either way, thanks for playing :)
-Adam

总的来说这是个好游戏，10/10，即使原价（￥6）入不亏，现在还半价！还看什么，赶快入！


我提名此游戏“再五分钟就好”奖。

A shot type that isn't very good on a slow ship may be great on a fast ship for example.  I'm not a big fan of 8bit style retro games but I'm happy I bought this game.  At such a low price point I feel like even if I quit playing it in a couple weeks I will have received more than my moneys worth. BTW I have been playing with an xbox controller instead of the keyboard/mouse.

27192676.review:
[h1] 一句话评价：[/h1]
          优秀的像素风清版射击游戏，值得一玩。

[h1] 评分：[/h1]
          玩法：8.5/10   画面：9/10   音效：9/10   可玩度：10/10
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
[b] 玩法：[/b]
          游戏中左右键转向，上键加速，下键减速，与许多清版射击游戏不同，本游戏中的主角时时刻刻都在前进，因此让游戏难度提升不少。再加上游戏地图有边框限制，更是不经意就会被逼进绝路。
同时，游戏有"子弹数"这一概念，对一个有各种boost加成的游戏来说子弹数限制让玩家不能随心所欲的割草，也更考验玩家技术。但目前仅有的无尽模式让游戏显得有些单调，因此我给8.5分。

[b] 画面：[/b]
          游戏画面是像素风格，充斥着浓浓的8位元色彩，粒子效果做的十分到位。绚丽的战场经常让我分不清哪里是敌人、哪里是弹药，很明显混乱的画面也是为了提升难度的。希望能有更多特效。

[b] 音效及配乐：[/b]
          根据作者所说："游戏音效来自于自己的嘴和一些免费使用的音效素材"，对于小成本的独立游戏当然不能奢望太多啦，即使如此游戏音效还是非常出色的。值得称道的是配乐，异常魔性，听的时间长了会在脑子里无限循环，完全停不下来。
可能是游戏没有开发完全所致，配乐也是仅此一首，如果再来几首就更好了。

[b] 可玩性：[/b]
          这是一款完全不需要脑子的游戏，非常适合在忙了一天后打两局轻松轻松。不同飞船有着不同玩法，所以在我这种休闲党看来游戏的可玩性非常高。
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
[h1] 萌新攻略：[/h1]

          [spoiler]           推荐关闭自动开火，节省每一发弹药。但这并不意味着一定要点射，关闭自动开火仅仅是为了防止在面前没有敌人时浪费宝贵的弹药。一旦进入射击窗口就能摁住Alt键不放啦。
   我将游戏分为三个阶段，大概是0~2000分，2000~7000分，7000~∞分。在第一阶段推荐使用L弹药，在大型球球面前一个挥砍就能把一个大的+四个分身全都解决掉，一次性恢复15+弹药，可以保     证在游戏中期寻找其它弹药时的生存率；也可以使用H弹药，制导子弹大大减小了事故率，缺点是射速太低不适合中后期使用。
   在第二阶段推荐使用S(蓝)弹药及B(紫色)弹药，这两种都是霰弹枪，范围攻击可以莽过重重敌人，在敌人数量众多的中期可以一试。
   在第三阶段里敌人中出现了会跟踪玩家的飞船，这时强烈建议使用E弹药，E弹药类似三式弹的效果可以快速清掉小范围内大批敌人，不停续命。[/spoiler]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
游戏本身就不贵，感恩节更是-50%，本游戏也有免费但内置广告(可内购解除)的iOS和Android版本，还不快买买买！

Sweet little arcade space shooter.
You're a spaceship that moves continuously with the ability to boost or break, both of these actions will deplete your "fuel" bar, which regenerates over time, or by collecting a blue sphere pickup.
Other than killing stuff in space, you also collect random weapons, ammo and coins - the coins will unlock better ships as you amass them inbetween sessions.

Pro tip: Once you unlock the final ship it's gg, so suicide for those coins early game.

26392867.review:
Ótimo jogo com enorme custo benefício!

Bit Blaster XL é bem como um daqueles joguinhos de nave antigos: inúmeros itens na tela, alguns power-ups e uma dificuldade sacana.

Apesar de a jogabilidade se resumir apenas a isso, existe um pequeno sistema de progressão onde você pode coletar moedas para desbloqueiar naves com atributos diferentes (Lenta e Resistente ou Rápida e Frágil?), o que por si só cria um motivozinho a mais pra querer jogar.

Devido à dificuldade do jogo, você pode até não brincar horas e horas a fio, mas apenas cinco minutinhos de partidas vão ser bem intensos e vão demandar muita atenção -- ou seja, finalmente um jogo que faz o tempo passar mais devagar!

Curto, Favorito e Compartilho.
Por menos de três reais, é realmente um ótimo negócio!

Obs.: O visual e a trilha sonora, apesar de serem pixelados e minimalistas, são bem interessantes. Detalhe para as naves bem diferenciadas e com trilha sonora própria para quando você jogar com elas.

26364326.review: Tight little asteroids derivative with a dash of geometry wars and shmup influence. Your ship naturally accelerates and fires(you can turn off auto-fire however), only a single hand on the directional pad is needed for control. It's different than Asteroids in that you can die by hitting the sides, the movement of your ship is very solid/controlled and there is limited ammo which you must gather to maintain. You still are able to still able to boost and slow the ship. Lots of cool ammo updgrades and some nice pixel effects, good for wasting a few minutes and well worth the 50 cents I paid.

26360039.review:
Voy a reescribir mi analisis ya que en su momento solo lo recomendé a los amantes del género (yo no lo era) y ahora, después de darle una segunda oportinidad al juego y haberme enganchado hasta sacarme todos los logros, he de decir que se lo recomiendo a todo el mundo!!
Este juego es de tipo arcade en el que cada vez que inicias una partida empiezas con 0 puntos y con enemigos fáciles y mediante vas subiendo te van saliendo más complicados y en mayor cantidad, lo único que puedes hacer diferente es cambiar de nave, las cuales la vas consiguiendo recolectando monedas en cada partida que juegas.

+Estetica retro, te harán revivir los años 80'!
+Diferentes naves, todas ellas con caracteristicas bien diferenciadas.
+Precio! Menos de 1€, casi regalado!
+Variedad de armas.
+La BSO es simplemente genial!

-El juego engancha, pero una vez consigues todas las naves ya no te queda nada más que hacer, solo intentar superarte en puntuación.

Puntuación: 7,5
Conclusión: El juego engancha mucho y está tirado de precio, si quieres sacarte todas las naves y logros tendrás para unas cuatro horas si no eres muy manco. Recomendado!!

26350363.review:
Bit Blaster XL, a game made by Nickervision Studios. Bit Blaster is the first game for the "BUDGET BUY" reviews. You can purchase Bit Blaster XL for 99 cents (USD) but is usually on sale for 49 cents (USD).

Bit Blaster is a fun game which I would recommend buying for a game to play when you want to relax. There are 12 different power ups you can collect while in game which all have different capabilities. The power ups are very interesting but some are too underpowered and should be fixed. There are around 6-7 different ships that you can unlock, these also all have different capabilities. Some of the ships are on the tanky side so they survive longer, some are quicker etc.

I think if Nickervision studios added a multiplayer function to the game it would sell a lot more copies as it is a really cheap game and is very fun. I don't know if this would be easy for Nickervision Studios to add this to the game but I think this would boost the popularity of the game a lot. The peak of players this game has in the average 24 hours is around 30.

The gameplay is reasonably smooth, the graphics are not obviously the best because it is a 2D arcade shooter but they are acceptable for a game like this. This game is also available for IOS and ANDROID if you want to play the game on the go for free, the PC version is a lot better though.  

Bit Blaster XL is a fun game which was made by a small developer. I would like to see Nickervision Studios produce more games as this one is a great game. I definitely recommend this game, it is just a chilled out fun game which I think you would be able to play it for around 30 hours. For the price it is a must buy!

OVERALL SCORE

7/10

-marra

26285266.review:
[h1]Описание:[/h1]
Аркадная арена. Летаем с помощью клавиатуры (WASD) или джойстика по небольшой арене, где постоянно генерируются вражеские корабли. Уничтожаем врагов, подбираем патроны и монетки, получаем бонусы, умираем. Чем дальше в лес - тем толще партизаны. С каждой минутой игра преподносит нам новых врагов и выжить становится по-настоящему трудно.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
¥ Возможность купить новые корабли.
¥ Динамичный саундтрек.
¥ Наличие достижений (получаются довольно затруднительно и нужно потратить на игру не один час).
¥ Множество различных боевых орудий.
¥ Глобальный рейтинг по набранным очкам.

[h1]Минусы:[/h1]
¥ Очень мало контента.
¥ К игре прилагается DLC с саундтреком, но оно не устанавливается и следовательно это обманка.

[h1]Итог:[/h1]
Приятная игра, в которой лежа на диване провел расслаблено несколько часов. Тут не нужно напрягаться - летай в свое удовольствие. Умер - начинай сначала. Игра оставила положительные эмоции и я её рекомендую.

[h1]Оценка: 5/10[/h1]

[h1]Послесловие:[/h1]
Если вам понравился этот обзор добро пожаловать в группу
http://steamcommunity.com/groups/uojer - тут вы сможете увидеть рекомендованные мною игры, другие обзоры, а также просто пообщаться в хорошей компании.

26161786.review:
[u]Bit Blaster XL	[/u] is really fun to play and well-designed! It looks like a retro Asteroids-style shooter and it is but while remaining simple in concept it is much more sophisticated than it appears.

The game is addictive, in a very good way, it keeps you coming back and wanting to be better at playing it. The movement is fluid and the graphics look cool but what stands out to me is the sound design: the music is very good and makes you strive to survive and keep going, the sound effects are perfect, giving you that rewarding feeling when you grab a coin or blow up stuff. There is enough variety in the ships you unlock to make playing with each a slightly different experience. Game keeps challenging your mind and focus, as you have to watch out for collisions and be careful not to run out of ammo while aiming and controlling the speed. Another plus is the developer seems to be accessible and listening to feedback.

All in All Bit Blaster XL is a good Indie Game, for little money.

9/10 From Me
[i] Sweep 	[/i]

Ok, so I ended up getting this on sale and got it for just $0.49. However, after playing it, I wouldn't have regretted even $5!

 I had sold a few steam cards and was loking to buy something super cheap. Bought this, and I absolutely loved it! In fact the second I bought it I immediantly got more steam cards to sell and bought my friend a copy, and we both love it!

It's basically an arcade style game, where you shoot asteroids, gain power ups, earn points, and try to make a high score without dying. Basically an arcade game. Overall great purchase, and I definitely recommend it!

Уровень всего один - это наше пространство где и будет происходить вся бойня! По времени, чем дальше, тем сложнее, объектов для истребления, засоряющих экран все больше и больше врагов в виде ракет, других кораблей, их выстрелов и всего что движется! Становится все сложнее и сложнее!

[h1]Bit Blaster XL
5/10[/h1]
[b]Złe zaplanowanie rozgrywki.[/b]
Grafika i dźwięk są... po prostu ok. Rozgrywka za to jest beznadziejna. Na początku zapowiadało się nieźle. Jednak pierwsze co można zauważyć - szybszymi statkami gorzej się gra. A zazwyczaj te odblokowywane wraz z naszym postępem były coraz szybsze. Do pary można dodać amunicję, która w tej grze była nie tylko kompletnie niepotrzebna - niepotrzebnie frustruje, niszczy przyjemność z rozgrywki. Głównie te dwie cechy spowodowały, że po 2 godzinach zrezygnowałem z dalszej gry, choć nie zostało nic więcej, poza odblokowaniem ostatniego statku i biciu highscora.

Gra kupiona za 0,49€ z 0,99€, dużo bardziej wolałbym sobie kupić za to nawet mniej smacznego batonika. Dziwi mnie ogólna ocena - 98% pozytywnych głosów. Ja wiem, że za tyle nie da się wiele oczekiwać, ale rozgrywka jest dla mnie tragicznie przemyślana.

::Update:: After some very nice and polite feedback from the dev, I'd like to say that while I personally don't like the controls, they were designed to be the way they are and it would seem a lot of people do like them. Also, it seems the Boost pickup does do rather useful things, and I hadn't noticed. 

I'm leaving the original review intact, sans edit, in order to preserve my original impressions of the game, but any reader should bear in mind that the game is still very solid despite my distaste for certain aspects. I'm changing my recommendation to Yes, though I wish Steam had a more nuanced reccomendation system, because the developer seems very nice and I'd like to see him succeed.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

A really fun little game weighed down by terrible controls.

I'm not kidding. It's as simple as that. I played this a fair bit, and more often than not, I didn't die because of a mistake or an enemy, but because th controls are really bad. They're sluggish and poorly executed. Here's the breakdown.

1. Your ship propells itself, rather quickly.
2. Use the left and right keys to spin around in a wide circle. The turning radius of a large truck.
3. Use back and forward to go faster or slower, but you'll only ever go slower because if you go faster you'll die.
4. That's it.

Now, if you think about it, you can see the problem here. When the screen fills up with enemies and bullets, you will die because your reaction time is ruined by your massive turning circle. Even if you see a bullet coming, if it's closer than a certain distance, it's unavoidable.

25884538.review:
Deceptively simple.

A true throwback to the addictive gameplay loops that long ago had us divesting ourselves of quarters like there was no tomorrow, it doesn't seem like this game would hold a seasoned, modern gamer's attention for very long... and maybe it doesn't, at least in terms of hours per play session. But I challenge you not to feel the itch to come back to it at least once a day to try and beat your score.

And if you do, then you'll find a super enjoyable old school shooter that has precise, responsive controls, fun and unpredictable powerups, and even incentive for continuing to play in the form of unlockable ships. So much so, that even just a single coin makes me say, "Well, even if I die now at least I made progress!"

And die you will, every few minutes or less. But you'll have fun the whole time if you're into classic shmups.

25876313.review:
It seems like a nice idea of a game, I think the firing should be assigned to the right stick but that's not the only problem. The other problems were visible as soon as I booted the game up. I'm using a dualshock 4 with DS4Windows, which works fine on every other game, I also tried it without the software and it worked just as badly. B was activating B and X and X was activating X and A, as well as quitting the game randomly. Not a great first impression. Luckily that seems to be the only problem with mapping but as the dualshock 4 isn't officially supported with windows then I'm willing to let that slide, even if the game has broken native support for it and 360 controller users have had the same issue. Actually playing the game, isn't much better with an unresponsive and slow turning system, even on a keyboard, leading to multiple deaths as I was trying to figure out how fast the turning was going to be on that round as the turning speed seems almost entirely random between rounds. Another issue is that after you click play and it loads up (an almost instant loading time as expected) the ship automatically takes off as normal, the problem is that you dont gain any control for about a second. This is a much larger issue than it seems as you will most likely want to turn as soon as you get into the game to get powerups for instance. But you can't.

 Fortuanately the rest of the game seems well enough made to get away with its price (I did pick this up on sale for 51% off bringing the price to 39p ($0.49) from 79p ($0.99)). While the powerups look well made, the sprites for the ship and the enemies look like cheap assets, but that's an overlookable issue. The 8-bit art style works well for it although the whole UI and all of the sprites looked like they were slightly blurred, like they were a much lower resolution then they should be. As for the menu's, they have clear controller prompts which for some reason don't change to keyboard prompts when a controller is disconnected. Later I realised the reason is because the buttons are the same. To go to the play screen a gamepad would use the A button, but on a keyboard, where enter, spacebar or the mouse (you can use the mouse by the way) would be used, the A button on the keyboard is used. The same applies for going back in the menu's, both the gamepad and the keyboard use the B button, I don't understand why, Is it just so the developer can save on assets by using the same ones? But something that confused me more was that you can't use the sticks on a controller in the menu's. Instead, all the menu's (apart from the ship select) uses the face buttons. On the keyboard and mouse, you can use the mouse to navigate the menu's (the right choice), or you can fumble around the keyboard pressing the A, B, X and Y keys all on different areas of the keyboard.

I understand that this is a game made by a small company (it even says so when you exit the game) and that they are trying to make games in their spare time so I've tried making this review as helpful as possible. I hope this game is fixed but in its current state it isn't very good, despite the reviews. There will be plenty of people who like this game but I'm not one of them. I don't have an issue with any bugs that I have found but instead with repeated poor design choices such as the movement being slow and sluggish (this can easily be fixed while also making the game much faster paced by using a twin stick control layout where the left stick moves the ship around and the right stick fires in whichever direction the stick is facing, and by using WSAD as movement and the mouse as turning with left click as fire) and weirdly made menu's.



[Update]
There are still issues with DS4 inputs causing incorrect commands, but if you use a program like DS4 windows and enable "Hide DS4 Controller" the game works fine.
Other than that and one or two minor bugs the latest patch has added an explosion ability which is useful for decluttering the screen, (even if I forget to use it), and now the menus look a lot better. New music has been added which sounds good and fits the game very well, and it's also available as free DLC which is nice. I learnt the slow turning times are fixed when new ships are unlocked, some turn slower and some turn faster, that's just part of the game. It seems all resolution issues have been fixed as well, and once you've put some time into the game it gets a lot better, so now I recommend this game, especially for the price.

25875865.review:
Did you like Asteroids or Comet Busters? Are you on a budget? Then this is a game for you! It plays pretty much like that with one exception- you cannot wrap around the screen like you could in those games. If you try to do that you will be murdered instantly by the borders. BORDERS! I prefer crashing into asteroids, thank you very much! Over time you unlock new ships that behave a little differently (more hp, speed and firing speed you get the idea) and they have unique music theme. And there are weapon pickups, which spice up the gameplay a little bit. The controls however seem to be a little funky from time to time (I swear sometimes my spaceship refuses to steer).

It's not brilliant, but considering it's price, I don't think anyone would expect otherwise.

25875518.review:
This is a simple, funny and adictive arena shooting game. If you do like the old asteroïd game, you'll have fun on bit blaster. Graphics looks retro, but they are very easy to read, which is a good point for a shooter. There is a large variety of bonuses, which makes the game funny (and sometime a little bit strategic), cool enemies.

The game is hard, and you'll die a lot, but just after dying you'll just do "an other 5 minute run", and you'll thak the vodoo god of game that the arcade period is finished, and that you don't pay for "credits" anymore. And luckily foor the poorest of you, this game is very cheap and its fun worth your money.

It's also a good game to play with friends on a hot seat (i.e., two players on one computer, one player at a time), as a run takes only few minutes. So that's cool! try it.

25875403.review:
I'm going to review this game. Because I have to say, I've enjoyed this game 

1. Great Music - Each ship has its own theme; had me playing every single one just to hear the soundtrack
2. Great variety of ships you can use (they get progressively better (more firepower, more shields and speed))
3. Gameplay is basic, but its addicting and keeps you wanting to play

For what its worth; give it a try - its a game that is actually quite enjoyable if you have a few minutes to play it at a time. This is a game with challenge, you will have to adjust to some elements in the game - but if you give it chance and practice, then you'll definitely get a BLAST out of playing it!

25875270.review:
Its the perfect game for when you're getting your tires rotated.

Lots of clever gameplay elements. Its fun from the beginning and then it continues to be fun as new powerups and baddies are thrown at you. Probably would have threatened Asteroids and Space Invaders if it came out in the seventies. If you like this try Waves. 

I only have a few complaints in that a ship lasts for a short time. The screen quickly gets crowded with enemies and thier missiles and you won't survive a hit with a wall or more than a couple impacts so you're constantly starting over. Its very easy to steer into a wall when things get hectic and that usually ends the game. Some of the missiles fired by enemies are the same color as missiles fired by your own ship which is unnecessarily confusing. 

After only a few hours of gameplay I already have owned all the ships available for a couple of hours. It doesn't have to be that short of a game. 

They let you select auto fire or manual fire but they only let you use the X button on your x box controller for PC. That isn't very practical since you're using a and b heavily to speed up and slow down your ship. It would be nice if you could use a trigger button or shoulder button. More programmable buttons is what I'm saying. Give the customer lots of options to come up with the ideal configuration. And how about a power up to give you a protective bouncy bubble for slamming against the wall or other ships? That would be nice for BB2XL. Also, some bright, pretty graphics. Not clutter but sharper.

25873811.review:
Retro gaming done right

The gameplay is simple, retro yet hooking, the music is repetitive but not downright annoying (just a little bit...), and the graphic... well, the graphic is a new-C64 style, so I wouldn't call it "good", but it's functional and makes sense for the context.

A very good game, in the indie/retro tier, and a total win for the price (btw, I got for, like, 50c. They actually discounted it...).

A great way to spend some time between more serious occupations (whether game related or not), and crime not to have it.

25792965.review: I hate to say it, but I own nearly 200 games on Steam and I've never written a review for any of them...until now.  This game is so good that I genuinely wanted to come here and tell you (yes, you!) how much sheer, simple fun Bit Blaster XL is.  If you love low-res, chiptune-y old space shoot-'em-ups, then I *promise* you this is the game for you.  It has an almost perfect balance of "Aaaagh, that was tough!" and "I could have survived that - I've gotta play it one more time!"  Your ship encounters frequent and very varied powerups that change the game in interesting ways and almost surely as often as you're ever likely to want or need.  And you'll need them, because the enemies are pleasantly and escalatingly varied as well.  The music is propulsive, the action is smooth, the graphics have *just enough* pixels...trust me (me, a guy who's written *one* review!); buy this game.  It's perfect for a brief session or a long obsession.

For me, this game currently has t̶w̶o̶  one big problem.

F̶i̶r̶s̶t̶,̶ ̶i̶s̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶l̶a̶c̶k̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶i̶n̶f̶o̶r̶m̶a̶t̶i̶o̶n̶.̶ ̶E̶a̶c̶h̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶p̶a̶g̶e̶ ̶h̶a̶s̶ ̶t̶h̶r̶e̶e̶ ̶s̶t̶a̶t̶s̶ ̶o̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶,̶ ̶r̶e̶p̶r̶e̶s̶e̶n̶t̶e̶d̶ ̶b̶y̶ ̶a̶ ̶c̶r̶o̶s̶s̶h̶a̶i̶r̶,̶ ̶a̶ ̶g̶r̶o̶u̶p̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶a̶r̶r̶o̶w̶s̶,̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶a̶ ̶h̶e̶a̶r̶t̶.̶ ̶W̶h̶i̶l̶e̶ ̶i̶t̶'̶s̶ ̶e̶a̶s̶y̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶i̶n̶f̶e̶r̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶a̶r̶r̶o̶w̶s̶ ̶r̶e̶p̶r̶e̶s̶e̶n̶t̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶s̶p̶e̶e̶d̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶h̶e̶a̶r̶t̶ ̶i̶t̶'̶s̶ ̶h̶e̶a̶l̶t̶h̶ ̶o̶r̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶e̶l̶d̶s̶,̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶c̶r̶o̶s̶s̶h̶a̶i̶r̶ ̶i̶s̶ ̶c̶o̶n̶f̶u̶s̶i̶n̶g̶-̶i̶t̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶b̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶a̶c̶c̶u̶r̶a̶c̶y̶,̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶y̶ ̶a̶l̶l̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶ ̶s̶e̶e̶m̶i̶n̶g̶l̶y̶ ̶p̶e̶r̶f̶e̶c̶t̶ ̶a̶c̶c̶u̶r̶a̶c̶y̶;̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶c̶a̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶b̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶d̶a̶m̶a̶g̶e̶,̶ ̶e̶v̶e̶r̶y̶t̶h̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶I̶'̶v̶e̶ ̶s̶e̶e̶n̶ ̶d̶i̶e̶s̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶o̶n̶e̶ ̶h̶i̶t̶;̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶c̶o̶u̶l̶d̶ ̶b̶e̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶s̶h̶i̶p̶'̶s̶ ̶f̶i̶r̶e̶ ̶r̶a̶t̶e̶,̶ ̶b̶u̶t̶ ̶I̶ ̶h̶a̶v̶e̶n̶'̶t̶ ̶n̶o̶t̶i̶c̶e̶d̶ ̶a̶ ̶d̶i̶f̶f̶e̶r̶e̶n̶c̶e̶ ̶b̶e̶t̶w̶e̶e̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶m̶.̶ ̶E̶v̶e̶n̶ ̶w̶o̶r̶s̶e̶ ̶i̶s̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶p̶o̶w̶e̶r̶u̶p̶s̶,̶ ̶w̶h̶i̶c̶h̶ ̶b̶a̶d̶l̶y̶ ̶n̶e̶e̶d̶ ̶s̶o̶m̶e̶ ̶k̶i̶n̶d̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶k̶e̶y̶-̶ ̶I̶'̶d̶ ̶l̶o̶v̶e̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶k̶n̶o̶w̶ ̶w̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶"̶y̶e̶l̶l̶o̶w̶ ̶M̶"̶ ̶d̶o̶e̶s̶ ̶b̶e̶f̶o̶r̶e̶ ̶I̶ ̶p̶i̶c̶k̶ ̶i̶t̶ ̶u̶p̶.̶
EDIT: the above paragraph no longer applies. The crosshair is actually the fire rate, and the dev pointed out that there is a powerup legend in the pause menu (which I had never opened before now).

The other problem is the inconsistant progression system. Ships are purchased using coins that seemingly randomly drop from enemies-I've gone ten games without seeing a single coin and suddenly find 3 in the eleventh. I think a progression system that relies less on luck could greatly benefit this game.

Overall, I think the game is pretty ok. To me, it feels like this game is sitting in the uncomfortable position between PC game and mobile game- it's too simplistic to be a good PC game, but it's clearly designed for computers (I can't imagine how the controls would work on a phone or tablet). But, this game has a lot of potential, it just needs some small changes and additions.

作为一款小品级的STG游戏,Bit Blaster XL确实物超所值,稍微花上一点时间习惯了游戏的规则和操作后,便很容易让人沉浸其中.前期为了解锁更好飞船,收集金币会是一个较漫长的旅途,然而事实上,游戏的BGM是根据你所选择的飞船来决定的,每一个飞船都有着专属于自己的BGM,不得不说有些飞船虽然不好用,但是BGM真的还蛮好听的,就凭这一点也大大增加了把游戏玩下去的动力

总之欢迎大家尝试这款游戏

25111827.review:
Как по мне, Bit Blaster - игрушка скромная, но вполне неплохая. Думаю, как раз подойдет для того, чтобы расслабиться, а заодно проверить свой скилл стрельбы и быстроту реакции. Игра чем то похожа на старые аркады из Nintendo, как Star Force, Star Soldier и Galaxian, это заметно по графике и похожему игровому процессу, как будто вначале эту игру хотели выпустить на приставку 90 - х годов, например Sega или PlayStation 1. Что я могу выделить из достоинств - это разнообразие в вооружении: тут тебе и огнемет и лазерный меч и самонаводящиеся выстрелы и дробовик и одновременная стрельба вперед и назад, можно перечислять еще долго! Также я оценил разнообразие врагов: от безобидных маленьких шариков, которые можно уничтожить всего одним выстрелом вплоть до шатлов, которые ведут шквальный огонь и которые вполне могут потягаться с нашим космическим кораблем. Что мне еще понравилось, это возрастающая сложность вместе со временем, казалось бы, вы только начали игру, где стреляли в шарики, а уже воюете с ракетами и торпедами! Можно сказать, что эта игра - тренировка вашей реакции, меткости и умению выживать на энергичной и беспощадной арене, полной врагов, у которых своя тактика боя, своя стратегия движения и которые появляются в разное время. Также у каждого космического корабля есть своя музыка времен 8 - битных игр, это безусловно, тоже плюс. Как я еще заметил, разработчики с ценой не ошиблись, игра хоть и простенькая и явно еще нуждается в доработке, но свои 29 рублей оправдывает, как я уже говорил, игра отлично подходит для того, чтобы хорошо отдохнуть и вспомнить то время, когда такие 8 - битные игры были для нас шедевром, как вышеупомянутые аркады из Nintendo. Так что если думаете брать эту игру, покупайте сразу! И еще один плюс: Каждый космический корабль хоть чем то, но все равно отличается друг от друга, к примеру, один скоростной, но не защищенный, или другой, медленный, но очень крепкий, с одной стороны эти эффекты положительные, а с другой отрицательные, но, как говорится, каждому свое...
Ну а насчет минусов, это отсуствие мультиплеера, вот реально, как то не очень интересно играть в игру, где ты сражаешься с одним исскуственным интелектом, у меня, кстати, есть идея для мультиплеера: надо сделать карту побольше, добавить еще вооружения, функцию, чтобы прокачивать свой корабль, его защиту, скорость, скорострельность и несколько игровых режимов. Это командная битва, где 2 команды (Например Альфа и Бета) противостоят друг другу, это DeathMatch, где каждый сам за себя. И еще один режим: где все игроки сражаются против торпед, ракет, шариков и стараются как можно дольше выжить.
Я надеюсь, что разработчики не забросят этот проект и будут стабильно выпускать разного рода обновления и добавлять всяческие плюшки, потому что видно, игра заслуживает определенных плюсов.
Удачи вам в боях за космос, пилоты!

25236424.review: Tak až tahle hra mě přinutila napsat komentář k nějaké hře. Nemusím vám říkat co vše "za své peníze" dostanete, není co říct. Je to prostě PRO ODDECHOVÉ CHVÍLE A POSLECH 8-BIT HUDBY (která se omrzí). ALE TO JE PRÁVĚ TO, je to jednoduché a krásné, krásné natolik, že si budete připadat blbě, že jste vůbec přemýšleli nad koupí, až vás donutí napsat recenzi na hru u který snad nikdo nemůže číst recenze. Ale jestli jsi vážně tak daleko a jsi až tady po te marné snaze tě přinutit objetovat to nic, tak ti musím říct že asi přemýšlíš až moc a potřebuješ si oddechnout a přemýšlet nad něčím důležitějším. Máš štěstí že jsi zrovna u týhle hry. Pro skrblíky je tu možnost vrácení do dvou hodin hraní (nebo si najít samozdřejmě jinou, podobnou hru na internetu, což bych nevěřil že tam taková není)

24937529.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a simple and addictive retro-style shooter for the price of 0,99€ without discounts. Being originaly not the type of game I would spend myself money for , I was lucky to win a giveaway hosted by the Developer himself and I ended up trying the game. To my surprise I had tons of fun! 

[b]The Pros:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Nostalgia hits home and the game delivers right.
    [*]Each ship that you can unlock to play with, has its own soundtrack!
    [*]Works well with Controller as well as it does with Keyboard
    [*]Achievements and Trading Cards
[/list]

[b]The Cons:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Limited Replay Value
    [*]As of Update Atleast V2.10 [Current Date 15/8/2016] the Power Ups system while having a decent variety and unique ideas in some cases lacks true distinction as some Power Ups are straight up better versions of other ones.
[/list]

I overall DO recommend this game if you are looking for a cheap , short and well made arcade retro shooter!

24899738.review:
Bit Blaster XL es ese juego que necesitas cuando quieres hacer algo y no sabes el qué.
Es un juego de controles sencillos (solo necesitas usar las flechas de dirección) aunque complicado para hacer highscores. 

Conforme juegas van saliendo potenciadores o distintas formas de disparo para tu nave y mientras destruyes cosas puedes conseguir monedas para comprar otras naves. Además, incluye logros de Steam.

En resumen: juego simple pero adictivo, para pasar el rato, y por un precio muy asequible.

24837818.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a casual 8-bit game where you control a spaceship and shoot aliens, blocks and other things. After you destroy anything by shooting it, that "anything" drops ammo which you have to collect since you have a limited number of ammunition, although shooting a lot of things brings, of course, a lot of it.

You have a lot of spaceships which you unlock by collecting golden coins, which are awarded for just playing the game.

Bad thing is, the game gets boring pretty fast. It's just one map, with the same enemies every time. The game also doesn't have a volume option, you can just turn volume on/off.

But generally speaking, for its price, it's worth the weight.

24633379.review:
[h1]◆ 遊んでみたら実際良かったので納得[/h1]
画面内を行き交う敵を倒してスコアを稼ぐシューティングゲーム｡
何だかレビューの好評ぶりがスゴイことになっているが､
値段の割りによくできている点が高く評価されている印象｡

[h1]◆ 序盤は楽々｡徐々に弾幕ゲーに[/h1]
ストーリー等はないので､実績解除がゲームの目的となる｡
とにかく殺しまくって避けまくってスコアを稼いでいくわけだが､
機体は強制的に前進するので､左右旋回と加速・減速操作で移動する｡
画面の上下左右に触れてしまうと即死｡しかし強制前進ということで､
常に緊張感を伴うプレイングとなる｡また､このゲームは残弾制で､
主に敵を倒すことにより手に入る弾薬の確保・節約が必要になるため､
闇雲に撃ちまくっていると死あるのみ｡全自動射撃はオフ推奨｡
時折拾えるパワーアップ武器は､通常弾よりはもちろん強いが
性能的な当たり外れの差が大きく､消費弾数もまちまちなので､
乱戦の最中に拾いに行くか否かの判断も重要になってくる｡
機体の速度やバリア個数などにも違いがあり､徐々に強い機体を
アンロックしていける｡敵も種類は少ないながらもそれぞれ個性豊か｡
4時間で全実績解除できたが､75K実績は結構な難易度だった｡

[h1]◆ やはり値段が魅力か[/h1]
トレカ・実績対応､日本語未対応だが問題なし｡Steamランキング
にも対応しているので､ひたすら高みを目指してみるのも一興｡
プレイ中は駆け引きの連続で退屈せず､欠点らしい欠点もない本作､
そのお値段はなんと98円！この内容でこの価格となると､
特別推したいとまでは行かずともサムズダウンするわけにもいかない､
そういう評価が連なってこの好評ぶりということなのだと思う｡
しょーもない内容で三桁以上取ろうとするクソゲーの開発者達には
本作の開発者の爪の垢を煎じて飲ませたい｡

24631592.review:
Bit Blaster XL is an extremely fun game if you have some free time on your hands and want to jump in and out of a game real quick

Graphics: classic retro graphics, with great special effects
Sound: The music/soundtracks of this game are simply amazing, and just like the graphics in retro style.
Gameplay: The gameplay can get repetative, but that won't happen quickly, especially since the achievements and unlockables are fun to chase after. Overall its a fun and fast-paced experience

tl;dr:
Its .99ct, what can really go wrong? GET IT!

24607038.review:
I used to play a lot of Asteroids as a kid, and Bit Blaster leans more towards rip-off than homage.  I didn't find this game very fun.

I played this for about 15 minutes then idled to get the cards.
24607038.developer_response:
Oh man, that's unfortunate you didn't like it. Sorry to hear that. I really enjoyed asteroids as well, but I thought I had made my game with some different mechanics to make it play significantly different than the classic asteroids did. 

Please don't hesitate to get a refund if it wasn't up to your standards. As well, please let me know what you think I could improve upon, Im new to game development and any feedback can help me keep improving my game :)

Thanks
-Adam

24605240.review:
UPDATED UPDATE: The game is basic arcade game fun, great for killing time a little time. I have NOT got my controller yet to play the game yet, spinning with arrow keys is not for me. I wish I never wasted money on Controller Companion and I purchased the steam controller with steam link when it was on a deal.

UPDATE: This review has been downgraded until further notice! I only want to play this game with a controller, I have several xbox 360 controllers, so I hooked 1 up to the computer and downloaded software updates. Then I paid $2.99 to steam for controller companion but I can't write a bad review for it because I can't get 5minutes played since I can't get it to work period. This review will go back to positive if my controller ever works.

I'm going to have to buy the steam controller or find a way to hook a controller up! I enjoy this game though, I miss the old arcade joystick to be honest... The arrow keys just aren't that much fun for me to play with. This game cost me around $1 and I think it's worth every penny.

24580402.review:
This is not a game for everyone, like me for one, but I see a lot of other people do. So instead of giving you reasons why not to buy it, I'll tell you what the game is, as a game, and what I think the game will be fun for. 
     Bit Blaster XL is just dumb fun. That is probably the best way to describe it. There's no DLC, no microtransactions; just a funn expierience for $0.99 I, personally thought the game was boring. I may just have a short attention span, but still I did. I wanted more from it, when I should'nt have. I thought this wasn't suitable for Steam, and more a free game with microtransactions on an IPhone or Android. But this game I great for what it's going for: Just some midless fun.
24580402.developer_response:
Hey, I'd love to know if you have any intention of playing a little more and trying more powerups and unlocking a couple better ships and see if it scratches that arcade score chaser itch :)

Thanks.
-Adam
