24545915.review:
Look, this game is extremely cheap and the developer has put a wealth of work into the game, even to the extent of reaching out to me for advise on what to improve on. This review used to be a negative one because i saw this game at the top of the steam games list but when i played it it wasnt much fun. I have been periodically going back to it to see whats new with the updates and whatnot and now I have been pushed over the edge in giving this one a positive review since the amount of pollish and work put into this is worth a purchase on its own.

I do have a few nitpicks, enemies don't seem to have a telegraph for their shooting, on more than one occasion i have been shot by an enemy that I just  killed because their was no tell for when they would shoot. Additionally since the game is score based, there isnt much insentive to shoot asteroids since ammo drops give you an increase in score as well, patient players can just bide their time picking up ammo drops to increase their score, I think this behaviour should be discouraged, maybe just by taking away the score increase for the ammo drops.

But these are minor gripes and the average player will have fun with this game regardless, you will definitely get your £- per-hour here so do yourself a favour and consider buying. Also if you like this game you might also like Luftrausers as well who knows.
24545915.developer_response:
Hey, I recently put out a big patch bringing the version to 3.0. It includes a wide variety of balance fixes, changes and improvements. I'd love to know if it improves your opinion of Bit Blaster XL and whether or not you're able to recommend it.

Thanks for playing.
-Adam

24545213.review: i bought this game for less the one Euro and thought, this is one of those cheap games that are released to entertain you for a couple of hours before you realise that it is not that good and lacks content. I am happy to say that this is not the case and that the game can be played for a long time with much enjoyment. The game also seems to get some nice updates from time to time which is a guge plus. Bit blaster XL is a solid and cheap game that i highly recommend :steamhappy:

24543868.review:
Dieses kleine Spiel kann ich eigentlich jedem Retro Fan empfehlen. Es macht viel Spaß und ist definitiv das bisschen Kleingeld wert. Die Musik die bei jedem Schiff ein bisschen anders ist, hört sich ziemlich cool an(wenn man 8-bit Musik mag) 
und den Reiz seine hart erarbeiteten Highscores zu knacken lassen einen nicht mehr los.
Das Spielprinzip an sich, endlos im All alles abzuballern und sich immer wieder zu verbessern, reicht schon um eine menge Spielspaß zu bieten, auch ohne Hochauflösende Texturen oder einer tiefen Story.
Es ist super so wie es ist und es kommen sogar regelmäßig Updates. Was will man mehr?
[b] Fazit [/b]: Ein kleiner süchtig machender, im Retrostil gehaltener Spaceshooter der auf jedenfall sein Geld wert ist!

24534808.review:
This game is fantastic for its 0.99 dollar pricetag and provides anyone with hours of offline enjoyment. This game is fantastic and is basically a modernised 2D arcade games.

Pros :)
-Offline Compatible
-Over 5 different ships with unique qualities
-Fun and Simple game
-Amazing in game music
-Very Reasonable Price

Cons :(
-Game ends
-Game progresses slower as levels go on

Bit Blaster XL is a fantastic game and really lives up to expectations. The game delivers what you would expect of a 2D arcade game with great music and a multitude of weapons. Even though there may be a few things to work on the game is worth its 0.99 dollar price tag and I highly recommend it.

24512263.review:
Retro graphics, which I am really getting tired of - learn to draw or hire someone.

Gameplay is reasonably fun but the lack of an in game high score board is a really major oversight. 

This type of game needs a high score board (local and global) to give you incentive to continue playing and better your score. A single high score is kept for each ship. There is a global leaderboard, which is extremely bare bones, outside of the game, in the achievements.

Without comprehensive high score tables (local and global), this type of game isn't any fun for me and I soon tired of it.
24512263.developer_response:
Hey, it's unfortunate you didn't like my game, I just reached out to see if you had further feedback to give to me, as it's very helpful to a new developer, and I was very surprised to see you've blocked me since my first comment. Sorry if I said something that bothered you.

-Adam

24490226.review:
Un shooter espacial en Steam...otro más al saco,este lo considero
muy especial porque salió a un precio muy asequible,creo que
también esta disponible para otas plataformas moviles...

El menu tiene pocas opciones como por ejemplo el menú de
selección de nave,al principio sólo tendremos la primera pero
con el tiempo iremos consiguiendo el resto,se desbloquean
mediante monedas que se recolectan durante la partida.

Los controles son muy sencillos,nos desplazaremos a la
izquierda,derecha;tendremos un boost o impulso y a su
ves un freno también llamado break.

Quiza lo mejor del juego sean sus powerups que son
potenciadores para nuestra nave que nos confiere
habilidades especiales,hay una veintena por lo
menos y esteaspecto es lo que nos mantendra
pegados a la pantalla.

Cada nave tienes sus particularidades como su
forma y su capacidad de escudo,con cada una
quedara registrado la puntuación lograda,al igual
que en los leaderboards.

los logros estan basado en la puntuación conseguida
y los desbloqueos de naves,lo cual se hace bastante
sencillo (los primeros) algunos otros necesitaras mas
tiempo.

Recomiendo este juego b_H89

24487087.review:
Hi I'd like to start this review by saying that I am a very amateur reviewer and have very little time in the game which I can promise does not affect my review at all. 

Music

Now then, Bit Blaster XL is surprisingly a very well made game. When you first play it your thoughts may be the following "Wow thats some sexy music!" which that is one of my favorite parts of this game. The music is just so wonderful and can remind you of the old days of classic arcade games. 

Gameplay

So whats next right? Gameplay, ah yes the gameplay for this game is truthfully a very fun bullet hell. It reminds me of Galaga minus the fact that you're blowing astroids and other ships up and giant alien spiders aren't constantly murdering you.  The one complaint I do have with the game though are the controls. Now hear me out on this one, when you first start playing the game the controls ( both keyboard/mouse and controller ) 
seem wonky.

Here's a  great pro's / con's list.

Pros 

Great Music
Good Gameplay
Nice Developer

Cons

Controls are a little wonky at first.

My final verdict would be a 10/10, honestly theres alot of great things this developer can do and I would love to see more content from him.

24474223.review:
can't recommend this game enough to anybody who enjoys arcade shooters, and even if you're not familiar with these types of games, it's worth a try for the price. 

it often had me on "one more try" mode to earn all of the achievements, which i finally did, but that doesn't mean i'm done with it for good.  it's a well-made game that i'll surely keep revisiting to immerse and overwhelm myself in some fun chaos once again.

it's not a big deal, but i do wish the steam emoticons for this game were the spaceships instead of the powerups.

edit: i should also note that the dev seems like an incredibly nice guy who cares about the quality of this game and is open minded towards suggestions made by players.

24452619.review: A very fun, challenging arcade game.  Similar to the retro Asteroids game from the 1980's but your eight Ships and these Special Ammo abilities that will help you achieve highscore.  Each Ship is different of their fire speed, movement speed, and the number of shields they have.  You start with your first ship (Bit Blaster V1) and you have to find coins by destroying asteroids and enemy ships to unlock more Ships.  The Special Ammo abilities you get by collecting them during the round will increase your ammunition but they take up more bullets than your Regular Ammo.  You lose the Special Ammo by running out of ammo.  You collect more ammo by destroying asteroids and enemy ships.  These Special Ammo are: Blast (creates a wide spread for a short range; takes away 6 bullets per shot), Bounce (big bullets that bounce off the edge of the map and hit an enemy; takes away 3 bullets per shot), Explode (a bullet that detonates on impact or a couple seconds after launched, creating a blast radius and hit multiple targets; takes away 2 bullets per shot), Giant (a large bullet that explode on impact and launch four smaller bullets; takes away 4 bullets per shot), Homing (bullets that home in on enemies; takes away 3 bullets per shot), Laser (a laser that fires at a short distance that will obliterate enemies; takes away 2 bullets per second), Mirror (this will activate the rear cannon creating mirror shots; takes away 2 bullets per shot), Magnet (this activates the magnet that will pull in ammo and coins scattered around in the crossfire; takes away 2 bullets per second), Rapid (fires the cannon faster than normal; takes away 1 bullet per shot), Shields (forms bigger shield and destroys anything it hits; takes away 4 bullets per second), Spread (creates a tight spread for longer range; takes away 3 bullets per shot), Through (bullets that will go through enemies ensuring multiple kills; takes away 3 bullets per shot).

7/9. Good score.

24383159.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a fun, refined arcade style shooter. Don't touch the sides of the screen, pick up different weapons, upgrade your ship as you play more. I have a great time playing this intermittently on my lunch breaks at work, but got pretty bored of it quickly if I tried to play for more than 30 minutes. Some of the weapons in the game are clearly less effective than others. This game gives the arcade feel really well and will probably give you that dose of nostalgia if that's what you're looking for. Very affordable game too!

100% Achievements Time (17/17) - 7 hours

24369109.review: Das Spiel ist, trotz seiner Einfachheit, genial! Es macht immer wieder Spaß es zu spielen. Dank der Schiffupgrades und den verschiedenen Powerups langweilt man sich auch auf Dauer nicht. Eine klare Kaufempfehlung. Für einen knappen Euro ist das Spiel den Kauf mehr als wert.

24360737.review: I really liked this game, especially the music & pixel graphics, and variety of power ups to try.  It keeps you playing to get a higher score on each ship.  Each ship (you unlock by dropped coins from some enemies) flies a little differently, faster or more shield.  But then there are a variety of powerups that change your shooting, faster, rebound, laster, wide blast, homing, etc.  All use ammo, which you re-acquire by killing things, some exhaust faster than others.   For the short time you can have with this until you've unlocked all and tried all the weapons, it was fun, especially in short bursts to try to do better than my high score.  However, unlocking the last ship (100 coins) was the only one that seemed a bit of a grind because by then I had my favorite power up and ship.

24326892.review: Alright, so this guy says he's a newbie? His first real game? If that is truly the case then I am more impressed with this than I am with a lot of games made by teams. It's simply fun to play and it's pretty hard to play. It's also kinda has the entertainment "quick fun" of an iphone game without the cheap gimmicks like requiring you to farm for hours to get coins. It's actually a good chance, not a 1/10000000 and you dont buy them with money. The ships also let you choose how you wanna play, but not so much you can't play with the others. It's mainly just well thought out, and the dev didnt try to overdo it, but spent quite a bit of time on it. I like this, and so if you've got a spare dollar, save a trip to the arcade and a few  quarters and try this for a while. You'll like it, especially if you're into retro.

24259577.review: This game is so much fun. I've been playing it nonstop for quite some time and I'm thinking about usiong this game during a family game night event. It's a lot of fun and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a game that is extremely simple but can keep you entertained for hours. Not to mention the freaking awesome soundtrack as well and honestly, the gaem is only a dollar. I wouldn't mind paying 4.99 for this. I have this music playing all the time in the background and i love it. I would like to see another mode added, like instant mayhem where it doesn't start you off slow. I would also LOVE to see multiplayer mode added! If it supported up to 4 people at once on the same device, this game could really become a fun Friday night get together ordeal.

24244101.review:
Consiglio al 100% questo gioco, costa davvero pochissimo e ti tiene attaccato allo schermo per tanto tempo, davvero è diventato una droga! Consigliato a chi magari vuole avere un gioco ''tappabuchi'' che non tenga molto impegnato il suo tempo e il cervello e vuole staccare la spina per un po' magari dal lavoro o dallo studio.
Lavoro eccellente, nessun bug, super fluido e divertentissimo il tutto a un prezzo regalato!
Consigliatissimo. 100/100.

24243902.review:
Super fun game, with a good learning curve. Unlike most arcade games, instead of having time, score, levels, bosses, etc., this game focuses exclusively on getting a highscore.
Some of the upgrades are useless, but thats pretty common in a rouguelike.
Simple game with a low price!

Great game, definitely worth it's price. The controls are very responsive, the ship is a pleasure to control and it offers some depth with unlocks / high scores.

Highly recommended.

24205763.review:
Simple, but fun and addictive. Perfect for 5-10 minutes breaks.

In this game you fly around and shoot increasingly more challenging enemies while trying to avoid colliding with them, the game area walls, and enemy bullets. Simple as it is, it's very fun. There are some pickups that give you different kind of weapons - some more, some less useful. You have a bunch of ships to unlock by collecting coins dropped occasionally by enemies - the ships differ in their speed/turn rate, size, amount of shield they start with, and fire rate. That's about it, but coupled with cute pixel graphics and a very nice soundtrack, it's enough to make a fun game I keep returning to whenever I have spare 10 minutes.

24173372.review:
*my original review* (this included a thumbs down recommendation)
The game is boring, it will give you a few minutes of entertainment at best and rot in your steam library. I'm very surprised that it isn't free. It really should be. Even on sale this is not worth the price, even at such a low price.
 
*new review*
The game to me is boring. It lacks body, not exactly filling. I'd say it gives a few minutes of entertainment at best and then you'll never play it again, or at least thats what I did. I was surprised it wasn't free, becuase it is something I would have guessed would have been. 

That being said, the developer is the reason I would give this a good review. He's a good guy that cares about the gamer's experience. First thing he did when he saw that I was not a fan of his game is offer a refund. He went further to contact me when I had not responded (I'll rarely respond to a comment) to know how to improve his game and make sure that I knew that a refund was still on the table. Overall it may be the game style and play that just don't mesh for me, but others have compared this to downwell and said it's just as good, that's why I would recommend this game. At worst, you may not like it, you may hate it, but if you really don't like it, Adam (the game dev) will surley do his best to improve on the game for a better experience, and give you a refund if you can't get into it.

24070007.review:
"I am just learning to make games." the exit screen says.

Sir, you've figured out how to make games that are fun down to its very core - the gameplay.  Incredibly enjoyable - old school Asteroids playstyle.  You have limited ammo - that ammo can be obtained from the enemies you destroy on screen.  Random powerups spawn and give you all sorts of fun enhancements - bouncing bullets, shotguns, behind-the-back attacks, bombs, etc.  You just keep playing until you die and keep trying to make the highest score.

Unlike Asteroids you are always moving and can only slow your ship down at the cost of using your boost meter.  If you run out of ammo you're left vulnerable so always keep track of how much you have left.  Different weapons use different amounts of ammo.

I look forward to seeing more from this author.  Stick with this formula Adam, you understand what a lot of us gamers want - addicting and fun gameplay.

Seriously, if you see it on sale, get it, but get it anyway if it's not.  You can do far worse with a buck.  I absolutely love these types of "here's the gameplay, have fun" sorta games.

Addicting Shoot-em Up that has tight controls!

My only constructive criticism I have is the bounce bullets are too similar in color to the enemies' meteor-looking bullets. May be darken the colors for the meteor-looking bullets a little bit? Or is this aspect of the game purposely done to troll users. In that case, well done because ~90% of my impeding doom comes from not being able to differentiate my bouncing bullets to the fireballs that shoot out of the sides of the enemy ships.

Two Thumps Up! I'm thoroughly enjoying this game!

24040687.review:
Bought this on the Steam sale a couple days ago, and it's already taken a place, alongside Downwell, in the category of games that I play 5 to 20 minutes a day. The game has a very simple but effective design, and the variety of power-ups puts this game above many of its classic counterparts. I also consider this to be on par with Geometry Wars, if not better.

Like games such as Downwell, and the great arcade games of the early-mid 80s, this game has an incredible ability to put you "in the zone". My first two runs frequently end in the first minute. Then something clicks, I shift into gear, ignore the distractions around me, and I have a...blast. If not a blast, then I grow a big green sword out my front side and swash-buckle them fat space circles.

Such a great game.

24036181.review: Due to the recent summer sale, I found myself digging around in the "cheap cheap" part of the store and I came across a few titles that I decided to give a try because hey, 49 cents is pretty good for small games. I found Bit Blaster XL. This is a quaint little pixle-based space shooter that throws bullets at you faster and faster over time. You start out with the first basic ship and gain the ability to buy new ones with coins you recieve as drops from kills. There are a nice amount of ships for the game, since the game is so small, you dont really need many anyway. You will be focused on not only your score, but unlocking more ships as well as the achievements the game has to offer. Do i recommend this game? Yes. This game is a nice little time killer that is really addicting when you really get into it. At the time of writing this, the game is on sale for 49 cents but the original price is only 99 cents. I also recommend the game at that price as well. A dollar is a fair price in my opinion for this cute little game. Also, the music is sweet too!

23975704.review:
*Note: This Review is based off using a PC Keyboard and Mouse for v3.11*

Ever play Asteroids back in the day and loved every second of it? Then this game is for you! With its Asteroid style gameplay, you'll be sure to love this! However, even though the game is magnificent there are some slight problems which could be fixed to make it even better which I'll outline in my Pros and Cons below:

Pros:

♦ Hours of gameplay for the low price of $1 (You definitely get your money's worth)
♦ Has Trading Cards
♦ Awesome Number of Achievements gotten for just playing the game (You don’t have to do anything special to get these, just play the game)
♦ Controls seem to be responsive and work as intended (Pressing the button seems to do what is intended and work very well) 
♦ Decent variation and number of powerups (Not one powerup seems similar to the last and their seems to be a decent number to always keep the game interesting) 
♦ Decent variation of enemies (This is decent because  when you progress it doesn’t feel like you are versing the same select enemies over and over again as more types seem to come in the longer you are alive)
♦ Nice number of balanced unlockable playable ships 
♦ Eargasmic Music and Sound Effects that fit the bullet hell scene and make it feel intense whilst you are playing and makes you want to keep playing
♦ Graphics are stunning for the genre
♦ Everything seems balanced and works off skill more than the power of something (For example, a better ship or weapon upgrade doesn’t always mean you’ll do better, as the game relies on skill)
♦ Two modes to suite everyone’s playstyle (Auto-Fire and Non-Auto-Fire which means if you want to really test your skill you can or if you want to casually play you can) 
♦ Old School look and feel is on point (If you ever played old school pixel, bullet hell games, this is a very good representation. For example, if you played Asteroids, you will love this)
♦ Very Good at being both a casual or uncasual game (If you have spare time and just want to casually play something this game works perfectly or if you want to go for a highscore and beat your friends this works perfectly too)
♦ Difficulty seems scaled correctly (I say this as the longer you play the harder it gets without being too easy at the start or too hard at the end. It feels like you ease into harder stages without actually realising which is decent)
♦ PC Option Menu that seems to work (Decent for what it is)
♦ Remapable controls (This is amazing as we can easily and quickly change the keys to whatever button we want)

Cons:
♦ No incentive to switch powerups unless needing extra ammo (This is annoying as I didn’t really feel ammo was a problem and some powerups suited me better than others, so why switch?)
♦ Powerups don’t stack (This seems weird as I would have thought that collecting more than one of the same powerup would have stacked and upgraded it to a certain point, instead collecting more more than one of the same powerup only gives you ammo and nothing else)
♦ Some people who don’t like this gamestyle may find it very repetitive (This is because there is no levels and not much variation from each time you click play)
♦ Steam highscores don't seem to go off mode or ship (This is really bad as someone can play any ship and auto-fire and be registered on Steam with the same score as someone who played non-auto-fire. Steam highscores should be done like ingame highscores by fire mode and ship)

Overall, the game is one of the best Pixelated, Old School, Bullet Hell games that I’ve ever played on Steam. Even though there are lots of cons, the pros still outweigh the cons as the cons are only minor things which I believe would help improve the game. Therefore, if you like Old School games like Asteroids, then you’ll love this and at the low price of $1.00, you can’t go wrong!

PS: It also seems the Developers read the reviews, which is good. I had listed in my Cons things like obvious Steam highscores hacking and no PC resolution mode. Since listing these in my Cons the obviously hacked highscores have been removed and a PC resolution mode has been added. Amazing game and amazing Developers!

23974888.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a perfect example of how to make a great little indie-game.  First pick a classic genre, in this case space shooters.  Pick a gimmick or two to make your game stand out from other similar titles.  Finally, give the player a some motivation to continue playing beyond just for high-scores.  One easy way to achieve this is via a light progression system.  Bring all that together like this game does and you're destined for success.

The developer's motto "live, die, retry" becomes quite apparent very quickly.  Bit Blaster is a space shooter similar the classic Asteroids.  There are various meteors, bombs, and spaceships coming at you from both sides of the screen.  The longer you survive the more stuff gets thrown at you.  Its usually not much more than two or three minutes till you're overwhelmed and you're ship is destroyed.  You'll want to keep jumping right back into the action because with the aid of the various weapons you'll know there is potential to do better.

The weapon and ammo system is one of the features that really stands out about this game.  You have one ammo base that carries across for all the different weapons including your standard gun.  In order to get more ammo you'll either have to pick it up from destroying the objects around you or grabing new weapons.  Once you pick up a weapon you're stuck with it unless your ship gets hit, runs out of ammo, or you pick up a different weapon.  There are classic weapons like rapid fire, scattershot, and homing missiles as well as unique ammo that either explodes, bounces, or tears through multiple enemies.

To help keep you motivated you earn coins as you play which will unlock you new ships.  The first couple ships offer a specific selling points such as extra speed or multiple shields.  As you unlock the later ships they are pretty much straight up upgrades of previous models.  By the end of the game there will probably just one or two clear favorites you usually stick with if you choose to keep playing.  There is some incentive to go back to the other ships as each has their own leader-boards for high-scores.

Either you like retro space shooters or you don't.  If you do Bit Blaster is definitely worth checking out.  The various weapons and ships make it quite an enjoyable game that can be hard to put down.  Since it is rather light you may not be very motivated to keep playing after unlocking all the ships but you'll still have had enough fun up to that point to have made the purchase worth wild.  There are bits that need blasting, how much more need I say.

23974695.review:
It's saying something when I'd pay more than I payed for the game for just the soundtrack!

This game is insanely cheap, but don't let that fool you. It's an incredibly tight, brilliantly simple asteroids style shooter with a wide variety of power ups and a killer soundtrack. Definitely worth picking up, and a steal if you catch it on sale!

23968453.review:
Bit Blaster XL is fantastic if you're looking for a simple arcade shooter. There's a wide variety of weapons, and each ship having its own music is a very neat touch.  It doesn't take long for each run to become challenging and frantic either, which is nice since a lot of games like this take forever with their build-up.  I also appreciated being able to toggle the auto-fire to manual for better aiming.

You really can't go wrong here for less than $1.  I'd love to see a sequel or patch to add more arenas in different shapes other than the basic square.

23962130.review:
Потратил 14 рублей (50% скидка), получил 3 карточки, продал каждую за 7. Заработал 7 рублей. Мало, не рекомендую.

п.с. в игре бонусы дисбалансны, трек быстро надоедает, прицельно стрелять нет смысла начиная с 10-15к очков
23962130.developer_response:
Привет XoLoD ,

Я просто хотел , чтобы вы знали , что я выпустил v2.10 от Bit Blaster XL . Он имеет целый ряд усовершенствований , так как вы в последний раз играл , а также некоторые другие вещи, которые вы можете полюбить.

-Более Бесперебойного питания
-Лучше Баланс на обоих органов управления и мощности ИБП
-Вы Можете отключить в стрельбы очередями меню выбора корабля
-Overall Улучшения в обратной связи с пользователями и GFX эффекты
-И многое другое :)

Я действительно надеюсь, что вы дать ему еще один взгляд и пересмотреть ли ее стоит ваша рекомендация . спасибо

Адам

23957842.review:
[h1]Info:[/h1]
Got this as a gift off of Nickervision after I showed interest in [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/263080/]Pixel Boy and the Ever Expanding Dungeon[/url] - another game he worked on.

[b]Disclaimer: This is my opinion, and that may differ from yours so don't get triggered IF you buy the game and (somehow) don't like it :D[/b]

[h1]Reveiw:[/h1]
Rating: 9/10
One Word: Enjoyable

Okay, so this game probably wont be for everyone - just like most games. Its a simple to play game thats surprisingly challenging (especially as you progress). The difficulty curve is just perfect and the 'abilities' really provide more to gameplay.  I reccommend this game and given the price, I'm - quite frankly - shoked at why not everyone owns this game already.

23955652.review: Jogo divertido,e bom para passar o tempo

23943444.review:
I've edited my review since the developer has addressed my primary complaint, and I can now confidently recommend this game.

Old review:

This game has analogue controls (you can adjust the speed at which your craft turns) and yet there is a minimum turning speed. This makes the controls feel loose, and it is very difficult to make small directional adjustments. Seeing as the entire game is about aiming accuracy, the main difficulty in this game is an artifical one introduced by sloppy controls.
23943444.developer_response:
Hey, I have made some changes to the way the joysticks dead zones work. I would love your feedback to see if it improves the feel for you. I'd like to work with you to get my game to a point you could recommend it :)

Thanks
-Adam

23915018.review: It's simple, addictive and fun like the old-school arcade games it was clearly influenced by.  Easy to pick up and learn, difficult to master, exactly the same formula that made the old games so much fun even to this day.  Bought it on sale and it's easily the best 50 cents I've spent since the arcade days.  I probably would have sunk several dollars worth of quarters into this game back in the day.  Go ahead, buy it and try it for yourself.  You probably have more than enough change in your car or couch to afford it.

23910098.review:
Erstmal: Wieso? Wieso kauft jemand mit einer GTX650 GPU und einem 3GhZ Quadcore CPU ein spiel, das 512MB Videospeicher und einen einzelnen GB an Arbeitsspeicher braucht? 

Tatsächlich ist dieses Spiel bei mir für meinen HTPC gedacht. ein kleines gelegenheitsspiel das ich spielen kann, wenn Linux mal wieder über das gammel-WLan updates installiert. Tatsächlich kann ich mich aber selbst nicht zurück halten, das spiel auch am Gaming PC zu spielen. 
Der HTPC hat diese Specs:
-Intel Celeron G1610, 2x2,6GhZ CPU
-ATI RADEON 5400HD 2GB GPU
-ASRock H61M-DGS R2.0 mATX MoBoard
-2x2GB DDR3 1333MhZ Kingston ValueRAM
-Creative X-FI TITANIUM PCIe soundkarte

Das spiel läuft, unerwarteterweise, fehlerfrei und flüssig auf dem HTPC, der sonst immer gerne bei spielen gemeckert hat. Keine ruckler, nichts. 

Und warum spiele ich das spiel auch am PC? Der soundtrack! Ein interessanter Soundtrack, der einem schwer wieder aus dem kopf geht. 

für das geld hat man hier ein nettes kleines Spiel. Ich empfehle jedoch einen Controller zu benutzen, da die tastatursteuerung etwas... unpassend ist.

23909066.review: Fun little time killer for when you've got nothing to do or are waiting for something. Would recommend to people who have a lot of free time on their hands or just love the pixle style of an old arcade game.

Летите и стреляйте во врагов, которые роняют патроны, которые вы должны подобрать, чтобы стрелять во врагов.
Есть бонусы, которые заставляют стрелять ваш корабль веером, лазером, самонаводящимися снарядами и т.д.
Можно покупать корабли с разными статами. На этом всё. Контента в игре не много, но за свою цену вполне нормально.

23829123.review:
This game's retro style is so nostalgic, I actually forgot that i was using my computer and not an arcade machine. it is the most innocent of gaming. The music was so good i stayed on the menu screen for over 30 minutes doing other things for the music.

23819704.review:
The kind of game where you think "well, it's fun but not exceptional" yet before you know it you have played for hours without finding any second annoying. 

Most reviews will tell that you can't stop autofiring and that you are therefore very limited in ammo, and also that you can't stop moving forward. They were written before the latest patches: you can now choose to disable autofire before starting a game, and in the current beta patch, there is even a key to slow down the ship, which makes it far easier to control.

Oh, and if you are wondering the meaning of the three attributes for each ship: 1)fire rate, 2)speed, 3)shield count (the number of hits you can take before dying - note that running into a wall will always instantly kill you).

I didn't find a single bug, the game is regularly updated, the developer is really really nice, and the price, heh... What are you waiting for?

23818161.review:
You'll know within 5 minutes whether or not you'll love this game, but the game itself already knows its audience. Bit Blaster XL is a fun, simple arcade-style shooting game for an incredibly cheap price, and for the amount of content and replayability this game has, I'd say it's well-worth 5 times more than its listed price.

+Pros+
+Simple, addicting gameplay. You can pick it up the controls within seconds.
+Scratches that 'Asteroids' itch you may / may not have.
+Great soundtrack with a different tune for each ship, making each attempt feel unique.
+You can buy it for pocket change.
+The dev is consistently taking feedback and updating the game, which is a major plus for a small game like this.

-Cons-
-Doesn't appeal to everyone, but it really doesn't have to.
-Gradual difficulty ramp-up may be frustrating for some.

All in all, this game is a solid effort from an indie dev, and it doesn't have any big issues that would prevent a simple, easy purchase. Do you like fun, addicting games? Then boom, you can pick this up for less than a cheeseburger at McDonalds.

10/10, this game knows what it wants to do and does it right.

23799859.review:
動画を見てもらえればどんなゲームかわかると思います
日本語じゃなくてもなにも困らない
操作もとても簡単
コントローラーでもできるが　自分はキーボード派

キーボード操作
←　→　曲がる
↑　加速
Ctrl　Alt　ショット
（他のボタンでもあったかもしれないが自分は使ってないので割愛）

このゲームはscoreが上がると敵が増えます
ショットはオート（ボタン押さなくてもずっと撃つ）にしたりもできます

音楽はいい感じ
98円　安い値段


おすすめです

Just wanted to let you know I have made some more changes in the latest V2.10 Patch. Some things that may interest you;

-Faster / smoother ramping based on score

-Four new power ups (16 total now)
-Improvements to a variety of GFX effects / user feedback in the game

I hope these improvements help push you toward being able to recommend Bit Blaster XL to your friends and family.

Thanks so much for playing, I'd really appreciate you taking another look.
Adam

23774160.review: Jogo muito bem feito,viciante e por um preço acessível.A única coisa que não entendi a primeira vez que joguei foram os controles,mas depois que entendi joguei quase 6 horas seguidas.Então se você gosta de um jogo simples que qualquer um pode jogar é um jogo muito bom

23773601.review:
Certainly worth 50 cents, but don't expect any innovation from this bare-bones space shooter.  I would have liked to have seen ships with different movement physics, and the ability to skip the easy first couple of minutes in a round.  A more fleshed-out upgrade system would also have been welcome.

If you are looking for a similar type of game, I would recommend Downwell instead.
23773601.developer_response:
Hey Rook,

Just wanted to let you know I have made some more changes in the latest V2.10 Patch. Some things that may interest you;

-Faster / smoother ramping based on score
-Tighter controls
-Four more power ups
-Improvements to a variety of GFX effects / user feedback in the game

I hope these improvements help push you toward being able to recommend Bit Blaster to your friends and family.

Thanks so much for playing and the feedback.
Adam

23772634.review:
Suprisingly fun little game!

This is an oldschool arcade game with some fun added features. Being oldschool arcade, it is actually challenging and  that challenge enables replayability and replayability equals FUN. 

Gameplay is smooth and great. Mechanics very simple but hard to master. Several different weapons to pick up and destroy the endless waves of enemies.

Person working on this game is communicating with players and is adding additional upgrades to the game. Not sure, but I think it is his school project. I couldn't give him anything but an A.

23770558.review:
Neat little game for the price. Has kind of an Asteroids feel with some unique twists and some powerups and progression. It has enough unique gameplay elements that it doesn't feel like a clone.

The problems I have with this game are primarily with the way you progress. You get new ships by getting a certain number of tokens. The problem here is that the tokens seem to be awarded arbitrarily and it just keeps a continuous count. Some games you will get a token right away while others you may make record score and still be lucky to even see a single one. It makes it feel like you are just grinding the game for tokens and not really being rewarded for doing well.

23769337.review:
I'm the type of guy who isn't into indie games, they're just not my thing, I prefer shooters, local co-op games and adventure games. Even though this is none of those, I really enjoyed this game, it's simple yet hard to master. The unlocking mechanic keeps me currently invested in the game and after I've unlocked every ship I'll probably try to get all achievements, which seem to be fairly down to earthm unlike many other games. 

Only thing that I'd like to complain about is that when you die the main menu song sttarts playing which sounds a bit annoying in the transition. There is a solution though: [spoiler] git gud [/spoiler]

TL;DR many gud gaem

23722203.review: This gets an easy reccomend from me. $0.99 is ridculously good price for this game. That graphics are  lo fi but bearable and some of the particle effects are good. The game play and feedback loop are particulary strong. Its more of a single stick shooter but still manages evoke the orginal Geometry wars with its boxed in play area. Overall you can easily get a few hours of enjoyment out of it, just by playing unlocking and trying to get a high score for each of the ship types

23721824.review: First with 1 Euro its dirt cheap. The Graphics are done pretty well too, verything is kept simple so the action never gets out of hand. It even manages to keeps its own style and not fall in to the Pixel-Look-because-its-easier-to-make category. The Gameplay is pretty simple but still addictive as the game more and more turns into a bullet hell when reaching later stages of the game. You can't really go wrong with spending that little money on the game. And the developer is very friendly too and keeps the game regularely updated. Overall a fun little game for in between.

23675288.review:
Bit Blaster XL is a simple, easy to learn game that holds infinite fun for a price that is completely almost ignorable. I bought this game almost without thinking about it, a small investment, and if it doesn't last, it doesn't matter. Not only is this game a superb little Indie gem, it doesn't charge for something it's not.

As a one-man Indie crew myself, I love the fact that this game has got so much support, and this dev can hopefully go on to make more games, and I am 100% for supporting this guy (or gal!) through giving them an unnoticable amount of money.

TL;DR Buy this.

[h1] Очешуенный космический скролл-шутер,[/h1] в котором нам дадут управлять одной из 8 ракет с различными характеристиками (7 из них необходимо купить за заработанные золотые монеты, которые не так легко получить).

[u] Плюсы:[/u] 
[list]
[*]Приятная стилистика
[*]Возрастающая в зависимости от набранных очков сложность
[*]Бешеная скорость и постоянный форсаж - как и пологается порядочной ракете
[*]Поддержка Steamworks (достижения и таблицы рекордов)
[*]Вторую такую игру вы вряд ли найдете, она по-своему оригинальна, но в то же время кажется очень знакомой.
[*]Низкая цена 
[/list]

[u] Минусы:[/u]
[list]
[*]Всего один режим игры/уровнь. Хотелось бы разнообразия. 
[/list]

23467457.review:
[b] [h1] Bit Blaster XL ist ein Retro-Gelegenheitsspiel der alten Schule von Nickerversion Studios [/h1] [/b]

[h1] Story: [/h1]

Wie bei den meisten Spielen dieser Kategorie ist keine Story enthalten, das Spiel ist lediglich zur kurzzeitigen / kurzweiligen Belustigung gedacht.

[h1] Atmosphäre: [/h1] 

Die Atmosphäre, die das Spiel ausstrahlt ist sehr angespannt. Man versucht um jeden Preis, mit Nichts und Niemandem zu kollidieren.
Genau das sollen solche Spiele bewirken.

[h1] Spielfunktionen: [/h1]

Als ich zu spielen begann, erwartete ich einen einfachen Asteroids-Klon, was ich bekam, war etwas ganz anderes.
Das Spiel mag auf den ersten Blick einfach sein, aber so viel Content erwartet man bei den wenigsten Spielen dieser Preisklasse.

Es gibt zwei "Schwierigkeitsstufen":

Auto-Shoot und Nicht Auto-Shoot.
Der unterschied besteht darin, dass im einen Modus die nur begrenzte Munition einfach wild herausgeballert wird und im anderen mit einer weiteren Taste geschossen werden muss.

Tastenbelegung und Steuerung: 

Das Spiel wird im Auto-Shoot Modus mit drei Tasten gespielt (A, D für die Steuerung des Raumschiffs, Leertaste für den Booster). Wahlweise kann auch mit Gamepad gespielt werden.

Im zweiten Modus wird das Spiel zusätzlich mit Strg gespielt, welche für das abfeuern der Munition benötigt wird.

Die Steuerung ist anfangs bei jedem einzelnen Raumschiff gewöhnungsbedürftig, aber nach ein paar Toden, hat man den Dreh raus.


Jedes Raumschiff hat in jedem Modus einen eigenen Score, den es zu übertreffen gilt, hierbei helfen massenhaft PowerUps. (z.B. Schild, verschiedene Feuermodi, Waffen, Munition).

Es gibt viele verschiedene Gegner, von denen sich auch einige zur Wehr setzen können.

Manche Gegner lassen Coins fallen. Wenn man eine gewisse Anzahl an Coins gesammelt hat, kann man sich neue Raumschiffe kaufen.

Das Menü ist phantastisch gestaltet!
Es ist auf den ersten Blick klar ersichtlich, was einen erwartet, feindliche Raumschiffe fliegen gegen den Titel und die verschiedenen Reiter und explodieren in einem weißen Schwall aus Pixeln.
Äußerst detailreich, alleine das Menü könnte auf Steam verkauft werden!

Das einzige, was mir im Menü gefehlt hat, war die Interaktivität.
Einfach vor Spielbeginn ein bisschen auf die visualisierten Inhalte ballern und damit ein wenig üben, bevor es dann zur Sache geht.

[h1] Grafik: [/h1]

Das Spiel ist, wie es sich für Retro-Spiele dieser Art gehört, in PixelArt gehalten, schöner, kann man ein solches Spiel nicht mit PixelArt gestalten.

[h1] Übersetzung: [/h1]

Eine deutsche Übersetzung fehlt, diese wäre jedoch auch Überflüssig und zu viel Arbeit. Das Spielprinzip, die Steuerung und alles andere könnte auch ohne jegliche Verschriftlichung leicht verstanden werden.

[h1] Musik: [/h1]

Die Musik ist faszinierend, der Entwickler muss lange Zeit daran gesessen haben.
Es handelt sich hierbei um mehrere 8-bit Endlosschleifen, die weder nerven, noch langweilig werden.

Jedes Raumschiff hat seinen eigenen Track.

[h1] Innovation: [/h1]

Ist dieses Spiel Innovativ? 

Gab es sowas ähnliches schon vorher?

Wiedersprechen sich diese Fragen, wenn beide positiv beantwortet werden?

Die Antwort lautet DREI MAL JA!

Einfach, weil wir alle diese Art von Spielen kennen, jeder kennt das Spielprinzip, jeder weiß, wie es funktioniert.

Die Innovation liegt hier im Detail. Kleinste Veränderungen, die viele ähnliche Spiele von früher in den Schatten stellen.

[h1] Spielspaß: [/h1]

Bit Blaster XL ist an Spielspaß kaum zu übertreffen.
Das Spiel hat einfach alles, was es braucht. Und mehr!

Mehr möchte ich zum Spielspaß nicht sagen, das Spiel spricht einfach für sich.

[h1] Preis/Leistung: [/h1]

Ein bessere Preis/Leistungs-Verhältnis kann sich der Käufer gar nicht vorstellen. 
Eine Tonne vollgestopft mit Content und die Angst von diesem Spiel süchtig zu werden... Und das für weniger als einen Euro?!

Der Entwickler könnte Bit Blaster XL für das 10-fache verkaufen, ohne mit schlechten Kritiken rechnen zu müssen.

Ich bin auf jeden Fall froh, dieses Spiel in meiner Bibliothek zu haben und kann es nur weiterempfehlen.


[h1] Spielfunktion: 8/10
Atmosphäre:        7/10
Grafik:                  7/10 [/h1]
[h1] Innovation:   5/10
Musik:                  8/10
Spielspaß:          10/10
Preis/Leistung:  10/10 [/h1]

[b] [h1] Gesamtpunktzahl: 8/10  [/h1]
Ein Indie-Meisterwerk!

Omakoma over and out!

23524886.review:
Ótimo jogo. A proposta é ser casual, desafiante e frenético. Você não pode parar de se movimentar e pode ativar o ataque automático, o que fará você não precisar mais clicar em disparar. As balas acabam rápido no modo automático, mas você poderá coletá-las no cenário o tempo todo para evitar a chegada do momento em que haverão muitos inimigos e, sem balas, você certamente morrerá. Se você bater em uma nave inimiga, você morre. Se vc colidir com os cantos do cenário, vc morre. Se tu levar bala dos inimigos, tu morre. Se destruires o inimigo e ele se despedaçar e um dos pedaços te acertar, adivinhem só: tu morre também. 

O jogo não é fácil. É divertido, desafiante e cumpre bem o papel a que se propõe. Tem muitas armas e estratégias possíveis com cada uma delas. A movimentação é fácil, porém requer um pouco de treino para dominá-la bem. Dá pra jogar no mouse, mas eu achei a jogabilidade meio ruim nele. Dá pra usar as setas do teclado (o que eu uso) ou um controle de xbox (movimentos no analógico). Existe uma outra tecla de jogabilidade que serve para ativar o turbo (o controle vibra quando você ativa o turbo), que serve apenas pra você movimentar a nave um pouco mais rápido. 

O cenário, embora no vídeo possa parecer meio poluído e até meio sem lógica, é de fácil compreensão e os muitos itens que surgem nele não atrapalham na jogabilidade pois são bem representados por cores e formatos diferenciados. 

Você encontra um item que serve como moeda dentro do jogo. Você usa ele pra comprar outras naves. Não destravei todas, então, não irei detalhar o que cada uma tem de vantagem sobre a outra. Quando tiver condições de fazer essa análise eu atualizo aqui.

Recomendo!

23440235.review:
"I think I'm going to play World of T... No, wait! There's a new update for BIT Blaster! Again!"

This review is for the version 2.10 of the game.

Graphics: 30%
Audio: 30%
Gameplay: 60%
Replayability: 80%
Value for money: 100%
Overall: 60%

About the scores: In shoot'em ups/bullet hell, I feel the visual- and audio presentation is as important as the gameplay. You need a catchy tune and some real cool graphics to really get the adrenaline pumping. That is why I weight all 5 scores similar.

The first time I played this game, I was not impressed, to say the least. The graphics were dull, the music did not fit the game, and the sound effects needed work. This is still the case. The gameplay was not very engaging, and the controls were not optimal. That, on the other hand has changed... a lot!

And maybe the constant changes and additions is what makes me play this game over and over again. Even though I gave it such a low score. Because, as a game, I feel the price tag is about right. You get your moneys' worth. It might be engaging for 10 minutes. Then you put it away and forget about it. Unless you try to unlock all the ships. But since I wrote the intial review, the developer has been in constant dialogue with me, improving the parts that me and the other players pointed out. Implementing ideas, and makes the game evolve over time. That is very interesting to be a part of. Personally, I feel Steam is not the arena for developing a game. I require a finished product, when I buy something from steam. But that time is probably in the past.

So what do you get if you buy this game? It's a shoot'em up with simple graphics. The controls are tight. The ships have diffrent stats, but not much more different than that. It's a single difficulty/level with increasing numbers of enemies over time. And powerups. A lot of different powerups.

I would reccomend this game to anyone that likes shoot'em ups/bullet hells. I must admit that I have pressed the play "again button" too many times. Just to get a better score. Because I know I can do better the next time.
23440235.developer_response:
Hey Insomnia'77,

I just wanted to let you know that the latest version makes a number of changes you may appreciate.

-Better GFX effects for a variety of things including picking up powerups, destroying enemies, and menu transitions
-More powerups
-Braking and Boosting is now available

I would love to know if the new changes help push the game into your recommended selection :)

Thanks again for the feedback, its been invaluable.
Adam

(the latest version is 2.10 in BETA branch, soon to be public version)

23423625.review:
Well, I always liked a challenge.

This IS a challenge.

A good, sweet, challenging challenge.

For that price, I don't even know why you didn't buy it already.

Stop reading me. Buy it. Or give the dolar to one of your friend, he knows what is good for him.

EDIT:

After some more hours playing, I can add that :
Progression is good, altought a little short
Music is amazing
The complexity increase rapidly
I didn't manage to get more than 33.000 points, and the last achievment is at 75.000...

23409189.review: One of the wierdest and most fun fps games ever! Some people call it hat simulator and I can see why there are tons of hats from strange hats to unusual hats this game is all about hats!

23407972.review: Bit Blaster XL is the prefect game that combines the past and the present. It combines the old retro feeling like games from the Atari 2600 and a newer, more modern feel with nice visuals and a mentally appeasing soundtrack. The controls are very resposive, and moving between different sorts of enemies in the game is made easy. Unlockables make the game more satisfying, while also beating your high score gets quickly addicting. You can play this game when you have just a few short moments to play, or for several hours at a time. As an overall, this game is very well made and worth the price.

23387684.review:
Чтож, поиграв в игру несколько часов без остановки и сразу же после покупки можно писать обзор ^_^
Игрушка не моего детства сразу понятно ( 15 летняя школьница-бомж) но меня она заинтерисавала. "Чем же?"- спросите вы. А я отвечу : " Не знаю". Просто преглянулась и было у меня на кошелке стим 15 рублей ( игра стоит 14 рублей на момент скидки) и купила. а затянула собака. Я просто каталась этими несчасными корабликами по космеческому пространству и всё. Большие шарики , маленькие шарики, потом какие-то кораблики и так далее...
Вообщем, игра прикольная, затягивающая, можно убиить не одну тройку часов, как по мне....
Замечаний несколько: 
1) можно было перемещать задник ( задний план) что бы выглядело поинтереснее.
ну или докупать их как-нибудь
2) Саундтрек ( много кто писал об этом в отзывах , но я не первая и не последняя )
Он действительно немного надоедающий. Можно было бы их менять постоянно, тогда бы вообще не заметно было что они одниковые. Или опять же , докупать их, перемешивать, делать свои плейлисты.
( ͡° ͜ʖ ͡°)

23382924.review:
It's cheap, yeah. That's the main thing everyone seems to say in this game's favor. "Well, it didn't cost me anyhting!"

I wanted to like this game but found it simplistic, unenjoyably limited, and lacking strategy. The game artificially limits you in ways that games like Asteroids (yeah, that one, from the 1980s) doesn't. Let that sink in for a moment. 

In this game, you are constantly moving forward. You cant stop or vary your speed below the minimum threshold of thrust/velocity. The only thing you can do is boost to further speed up, but once you unlock the 2nd ship, it's already too fast even without boost. 

This causes a problem with another limitation that Asteroids didn't have - in Bit Blaster, if you touch the edges of the screen, you die instantly, rather than wrapping around to the other side (you know, a feature that is actually fun). 

Finally, in this game you are forced to constantly shoot at an automated rate, which removes all strategy from aiming and placing precise shots, and is further compounded by the fact that ammo is severely limited and once you run out, you literally cant fire at anything until you pick up more ammo, which drops as loot from things that you destroy (see the catch 22?). 

I guess other people like those features but to me they are pointless limitations that ruin any sense of strategy or fun. This game forces you to play by its rules at all times, in direct contravention to the established rules of this genre since basically the beginning of video game time. Sorry, but I didn't like it and do not recommend it.
23382924.developer_response:
Hi Deftinwolf,

Just wanted to give you a heads up that the latest patch (V2.10 currently in the BETA branch on Steam) tightens the controls of all ships. As well as adds more powerups, GFX changes, and bug fixes. 

There are also a couple other things that will hopefully please you :)
-Pressing X in the ship select turns off Autofire, so you can maintain your ammo at your own pace
-New pause menu while playing
-Faster turning ships to unlock
-The triggers on the controller will now Boost (right trigger) or Brake (left trigger) allowing you better control over your ship.

Hope you get a chance to take another look. Thanks for playing, I would greatly appreciate hearing from you :)
Adam

23373432.review:
Esse simpatico jogo de navinha, lhe proporciona um grande desafio !
Passar por entre tiros e asteroides com uma jogabilidade muito simbles e bem feita ... pode trazer horas de diversão e desafios ! OU apenas ser aquele joguinho para passar um tempo enquando você esta esperando uma instalação ou Download !
Com 8 Naves que variam os status e 6 diferentes tipos de tiros, o jogo traz muitas combinações e deixa você livre para se adaptar a maneira que mais gosta de jogar !

Não é um jogo que almeja a grandiosidade, mas faz bem feito na sua pequena proposta.

23360652.review:
So far i have been enjoying the game, and i actually was able to sell a couple steam cards to get this for no extra payment. this game so far is great for the price. it seems well developed and the developer himslef seems like a nice person who is OPEN to critisism and feedback. unlike some companys and indie developers that will take offense to any kind of negative feedback. but i am not going to judge the game over the developer himself. so here i will go briefly through the pros and cons of Bit Blaster XL

Pros
+the game has a nice feel and decent control.
+graphics emulate the feeling of an 80's game and does it great.
+unique powerups that will help in their own way.
+different ships that have cool looks to them (Stae Trek one FTW)
+Challenging, yet feels not too frustrating, just enough to make you want to play more.

Cons
-after you complete everything there is nothing really left to keep you playing. but can be excused for the $1 price tag
-not too satisfying to destroy things, and no good feedback to the player (100 points added! laser power up added! etc
-sounds are good. but feels  to quite and times and makes me sleepy.

overall for the $1 price tag, if you are interested in retro and space shooting games from the 80's you should check this out. it is addicting and would be around 3-6 hours of fun. pretty far since 2- 50 cent gumballs only last for 20 minutes.

23349960.review:
Genuinly one of the best shmup's I've ever played. The fantastic pixel art blends perfectly with the really catchy music that chirps away as you blast astriods and enemy spaceships. 

The sense of progression is simple, as it should be in this retro style game, and doesn't feel overwhelmingly grindy - although it is essentially what you're doing. The weapons really stand out too - Some are your average three-way bullets, or your slightly bigger ones - but there are some really intuitive weapons too. My personal favourite is the lazor sword, which is bloody perfect as long as you manage your ammo.

Oh - This game also has ammo. Yeah, it's an odd mechanic to add into an endless shooter like this, but it works really well. You can have your shooting set to automatic, which is really handy when you just want to focus on getting out of annoying situations, but I prefer to play with this turn off. One addition that I feel would really help the game feel much smoother would be the ability to toggle this function on and off during a game - Maybe binding it to 'Y' or 'B' on the controller? That way, one can switch their focus from gaining points and swerving to dodge the debris that quickly fills your screen.

Overall, if you think you like the look of this, you'll probably have tonnes of fun with it. And why not? It's under £1~

-Ashe

23348644.review:
Genre: arcade style 8 bit asteroids style.

What makes this game different: Random powerups, auto-fire is bad because you can run out of ammo. Unlike asteroids you can never come to a complete stop.  The edges of the map are a boundary you can not pass and will crash into.

Worth checking out when it's on sale if you're looking for a nintendo hard 80s style asteroid. This is one of those times where I wish I could leave a meh review. It's a good game, but not one I am personally excited about.

23344804.review: I have always been a fan of the asteroid space shooters from days gone by, so when I saw this game on the store at such a brilliant price, I just had to purchase it. This game is brilliant. Gameplay is extremely well balanced, it's not too easy, and it's not too hard either, it's just a very fun challenge of a space shooter. Plus this works really well on a gamepad, which is a huge plus for that retro feel of gameplay. Quite a varied amount of ships to play with, some locked, as you pick up in game coin icons that are hidden in certain asteroids etc... then you can purchase the other ships with your earned credit. I highly recommend this game to any gamer that loves these kind of shooters, 10/10 from me, very fun and has that one more go factor about it, that really does shine in the gameplay.

23339290.review:
复古的游戏模式，复古的操作，以及带着8bit风格但是十分有魄力的BGM。
游戏难度在中等，后期满屏敌人还是挺考验操作的，[strike]对弹幕游戏厨来说然并卵吧，笑[/strike]有点像LUFTRAUSERS，当然与之相比本作内容单薄不少，毕竟 Nickervision Studios 是专注于移动端的开发商，本作也是直接移植自安卓平台的同名作品，[strike]而且才1$，而且还带卡[/strike]。
看来移动端游戏反向移植到PC还是有点前途，嘛，各种大作之间也需要这样的休闲游戏填充市场。

If you can get this cheap, it's a good game to have some fun.

23332691.review:
[h1]Meine Review zum Spiel: Bit Blaster XL.[/h1]


Bit Blaster XL ist ein kleines aber feines, im Retro Stil gehaltenes "Pixelart" Spiel. Wir steuern ein kleines lustiges Raumschiff (da uns am anfang nur eins zur verfügung steht), bewaffnet mit einer art Laserkanone und schützen uns gegen Wellen vor komischen "Kreis Gegnern". Berührt man diese, stirbt man und muss von vorne anfangen. Es gibt natürlich nicht nur die genannten "Kreis Gegner", es gibt zum beispiel auch Raketen, welche langsame Schüsse abfeuern, die dann durch die Map fliegen und dich töten, solltest du in eines der Schüsse fliegen, da muss man ganz schön aufpassen.


Im laufe des Spieles hat man die möglichkeit Pickups zu finden, welche einem eine bessere Kanone verleihen oder einem eine bessere selbstverteidigung geben bis hin zum "Munitionsaufsauger", da man nur begrenzte Munition zur verfügung hat. Keine sorge, es fliegen genügend Munitionspickups durch die gegend, auch wenn ihr Gegner tötet, erhaltet ihr welche. 


Haben wir Münzen gesammelt, können wir diese gegen neue Raumschiffe, welche schneller sind und/oder mehr aushalten eintauschen, was einem definitiv einen Motivationsschub sowie gute Abwechslung bietet..


U N D ____  D A S ____  A L L E S ____   F Ü R ____  NICHT ____ MAL ____ E I N E N ____   E U R O ! ! 


Ich habe Bit Blaster XL gerade mal 30 Minuten gespielt und muss sagen: Top.


Ich hoffe ich konnte euch dazu bewegen euch dieses tolle Spiel, welches definitiv der perfekte Killer gegen langeweile ist, zu kaufen. ;d Viel Spaß und danke fürs lesen meiner Review!


Datsik

23328385.review:
「シューティングゲームは好きだ」
「シューティングゲームがお好き？　けっこう。ではますます好きになりますよ。さぁさぁ、どうぞ。2016年のニューモデルです。
……見た目シンプルでしょ？　んああぁ、仰らないで。
デザインがドット調。でも3Dなんて見かけだけで、弾が見ずらいし、よくわからんわ、すぐ酔うわ、ろくなことはない。
機体も武装もたっぷりありますよ。どんなやり方でも大丈夫。どうぞ動画見てみてください。
……簡単でしょう？　余裕のゲーム性だ、すぐハマりますよ」
「一番気に入ってるのは……」
「何です？」
「……値段だ」

23303540.review:
[quote=Wasterbull] Reseña en español[/quote]

[i]¿Un Asteroid moderno? Que malo... No! Es tan bueno![/i]

[h1] HISTORIA	- 10/10*[/h1]
No tiene historia, es un juego para disfrutar el rato.

[b]Nota del autor:[/b]
[i]La alta puntuación es cuando un juego cuenta con una idea básica y que tenga sentido a la hora de jugar.[/i]

[h1] GAMEPLAY - 10/10[/h1]
Simple pero efectivo. Es fluido y equilibrado el juego, la idea es sobrevivir y como hay logros, más ganas tienes incluso existe el Marcador mundial, en donde los jugadores compiten por lograr una mejor marca de puntos o romper récord.

Al principio, no le tenía fe hasta que compré en otra cuenta para autoregalarme en dicha cuenta, al probarlo sin duda me gustó y aunque llevo pocas horas, igual me he viciado mucho. Es un reto tener que aguantar por más tiempo sin chocar o ser disparado.

Son 8 tipos de naves, cada uno tiene más velocidad y defensa. Al principio tendrás única nave, al disparar los objetos que flotan en el espacio cerrado, te dan suministro de energía de láser y cuando aparecen misiles y naves enemigas, es importante evitar ser disparado o ser chocado si no entonces fin de juego. Para adquirir las siguientes naves con mejoras, deberás acumular dinero.

Además incluye los Power Up, existen distintos tipos de armas y mis favoritos son la S de color celeste y E de color azul, ambas armas son efectivas para mi. Cabe destacar que si quieres que dichos Power Up sean duraderos, dispara unos cuantos y acumular suministros y así mantienes.

[h1] GRÁFICA - 10/10[/h1]
Lo bueno es que el diseño es original y tiene buenos sprites y bien cuidado el aspecto retro con lo moderno.

[h1] MÚSICA - 10/10[/h1]
A decir verdad me gusta mucho su OST, sin duda es muy ameno.

[h1] OPINIÓN SOBRE EL VIDEOJUEGO	[/h1]
Diria que es una gran compra para los jugadores que quieren para pasar el rato de disparar naves y objetos. Me parece bien que el juego esté en el precio justo y sea accesible para todos además su calidad es espectacular.

[h1] PRO +[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Logros (17)
    [*]Cromos (5)
    [*]Adictivo desde los primeros segundos.
[/list]

[h1]CONTRA -[/h1]
[list]
    [*]Nada que decir.
[/list]

[code] ¿Qué esperas? Compra ahora mismo y disfruta el juego. [/code]

23300803.review:
118,698
That is the highscore my best score is 6,000 (so far, I plan on playing this game much more because it's awesome)
This game is super fun fast paced and a great game for a long car ride or flight. 
The game has a ton of weapons and space ships the enemies seem easy at first but get much harder (mainly because it's hard to aim)
People complain about ships not having tight turning but that is a stat for each ship its speed determines its turning the high health ones turn like a tank (no duh).
I normally play this game with auto fire on so I have less buttons to press just pick up ammo from dead enemies. 
This game has a great difficulty curve not too hard to put people off not too easy to be boring.
This game is amazing and with its 49 cent price tag (on sale of course) I got it by selling my steam cards making the game cost me basically nothing to get. This game is flawless and fun I would definately get it if I was you.
10/10 great fun arcade game

23293862.review: Zaman ve kafa dağıtmalık eğlenceli ufak oyun. 8/10

23293835.review:
EDIT: I've Nominated this game for the "I thought this game was cool before it won an award" award!

Ah. Where do I even start?

     Bit Blaster XL is a modern take on some of the old retro-sytle arcade games you played back in the 80s(yes i'm not from the 80s. mind you. I was born 2001) there is 8 ships, and each has its' own custom speed,fire rate, shield durability, and song! with each ship it is a little different than the last considering you only have a max of 100 ammo, but there is an option for manual shooting if you want more of a challenge.

       Not to mention since each ship is different you have to adapt to all of them. they each have a different play style. it's kinda like you just got a new game and need to learn how it works. The game has great graphics, and even if you have a $200 laptop that's OK! this game barely needs much at all. there is around a dozen or more powerups and each is different. once you run out of ammo with a powerup then you have to collect more ammo, but you lose the powerup, but don't worry. you can pick up ammo with the powerup: just be careful! don't run into the walls! there is a bit of variety when it comes to enemies. the higher your score: the stronger then enemies(and the more too! might I add).

        You unlock ships by using coins which randomly drop from enemies and some enemies only drop coins. What to talk about next? Ah Yes! The songs are also great! they have a real 8-Bit feel to them(Props and kudos to Spiff Tune. he did an amazing job on the songs. if you're reading this; good job man!). there is such a variety with this game and no two games will be the same! all the things fit really well together and it really feels like an 80s game!

          And that should just about wrap things up here! I hope this review helped and if there is anything I should add please let me know! other than that I want to thank the dev for being active and really listening to what we have to say! I can only imagine how hard it is to be a single dev, but hey! no one can argue with you! Good job Nickervision! I can't wait for a possible sequel!

Basically what I am trying to say is:

23292861.review:
Now this is quite a fun game! Usually, mobile games don't translate well onto PCs. But Bit Blaster made proof that many gamers got it wrong with this one. Bit Blaster XL does what other mobile games to PC got it all wrong. Heck, I even got addicted to it. Now, 17 achievements, leaderboards, and even makes it great for 0.99 cents. (or, if you are in the UK, £0.79)

Sometimes, your game doesn't HAVE to be a AAA game or even a big indie game, like Braid or Terraria, to be great and fun. And Bit Blaster XL shows proof. If you have some spare change left on your wallet, go ahead. Get the game and get addicted!

23292822.review:
If you don't know what to spend 1€ on, buy this. If you don't know what to play when you are bored, launch this up. This is an extremely awesome game which can really throw retro players back to the good old 80's (not me). The enemies are challenging and the game is "heating up" when you get above 10k. Oh, and the ammo count is also a challenge :)
The game itself is pumped up with many major updates, especially the V2.00 which is my opinion makes the game more enjoyable. Also, the soundtrack is good for the ear and it can cure cancer.
So, overall, >10/10. IGN's rating broke up.

23292498.review:
Bon jeu...
Ce jeu n'est pas mal, mais si vous l'achetez, c'est, ou bien pour passer le temp, ou alors pour gagner les succès, à part sa, je ne vois pas trop l'utiliter de l'acheter pour autres choses, il est très répetitif, et votre seul bute est de battre votre score, a part au début du jeu quand vous devez encore débloquer les vaisseaux, sinon par la suite, rien d'autres que de battre votre score.
Il n'y a pas de mods sur ce jeu, mais plus votre score est élevé, plus sa se corse, et sa se corse vraiment, vous ne comprendrez parfois même pas se qui se passe tellement il y aura de vaisseaux et de "météores" (sais comme sa que j'appele les rond blanc), et sa ajoute du "piment" au jeu, je trouve, et sans sa, j'aurait sûrement mis une mauvaise recommendation pour ce jeu.
Bref... Ce jeu, si vous êtes a la recherche d'occupation ou de succès facile, est fait pour vous, je le conseille a 55 % !

My first review about bit blaster was negative, but, after seeing the dev's concern with the game, i have to change it.

2- the game is one of the best rated games on steam, and it is a cheap game, give it a try!

A very enjoyable game; addictive, with great retro graphics and sound track. Most impressive, though, is that the developer has done a great job of game mechanics - the ship progression is worth playing repeatedly for, the powerups are satisfying and exciting, and the gameplay is slick and engaging.

Especially at the price, I can't think of a better game to keep coming back to in spare moments.

23238332.review:
[h1][b]Незатейливая скролл-полеталка от разработчика-одиночки за что ни на есть самую демократичную и справедливую цену.[/b][/h1]

[quote][h1]Похвальности:[/h1]

[list]
    [*] Приятный пиксельный минимализм.

    [*] Незатейливость.

    [*] Весёленький восьмибитный саундтрек.

    [*] Ценник, ага.
[/list]
[/quote]

[quote][h1]Негодности:[/h1]

[list]
    [*] Чeртовски никудышный баланс оружия. 

[code]Стрелять в этой игре действительно непросто, здесь нет линии наводки или прицела, а враги-мишени находятся в постоянном движении. Подбирая прямостреляющее оружие, коего тут большинство, приходится ориентироваться по чуйке "попадёт-не попадёт", разворачивая нос корабля в идеальную для попадания позицию. Спустя минуту игры, по мере заполнения экрана волнами врагов и летающими повсюду красными ракетами, испускаемыми этими врагами, процесс прямого нацеливания становится невыносимым. 

Исходя из этого, играбельно тут лишь сплэш-оружие, коего всего два вида. Остальные пушки - мусор разной степени полезности на начальной стадии. Как итог, геймплэй сводится к надежде на скорейшее выпадение сплэш-апгрейдов и критическому избеганию подбора всех остальных. 

Ко всему прочему, "ауровые" улучшения - магнит и кольцо из шариков - почему-то "клинят" стандартные зелёные выстрелы при поворотах корабля. Бессмысленный и очень раздражающий эффект.[/code]

    [*] За каждым кораблём закреплён свой музыкальный трек. Надоедает. Было бы гораздо лучше с рандомным перебором всего саундтрека.

    [*] Низкая реиграбельность и вариативность врагов, отсутствие затягивающих элементов.

    [*] Фарм-ачивки. Половина на открытие кораблей, половина на набивание определённого рекорда / суммы очков. С другой стороны, грех требовать от подобной игры чего-то иного.
[/list]
[/quote]

[h1][u][i]Итого:[/i][/u][/h1] Шестёрочка (5 + 1 балл за в целом хороший дебют).

슈팅게임 좋아하시나 복고풍 게임 좋아한다면 꼭 해보시기 바란다.

23112752.review:
[b]While I was on the fence about [i]Bit Blaster XL[/i], the moderately fun (albeit simple) retro gameplay coupled with a price you can't argue with forces me to upvote.[/b]

[i]This is pure arcade-style gameplay.[/i] The only 'permanent' upgrades are unlockable ships that you gain from earning in-game currency. The only real goal is getting a high score.

[i]Essentially, the whole game plays on a single scren.[/i] If you hit the edge of the screen, you die. The primary mechanic or novelty is the shooting mechanic. While it is toggle-able, you are constantly shooting which obviously depletes ammo stores - which you replenish by pickups dropped when enemies are killed. There are various temporary gun upgrades sort of reminiscent of [i]Contra[/i] (not sure why that game comes to mind, but it does).

[b]Look, are you going to dump hours and hours into this? Probably not. But for about a buck, you get a pretty wicked game to pass the controller around with friends and try to beat each other's score.[/b]

22895400.review:
Bit Blaster XL is an arcade game in the style of Asteroids and Geometry Wars. 

This game can get pretty brutal at points, especially at the beginning when you don’t have very good ships. You collect coins and can buy new ships that move faster, have more shields, or fire faster. They vary enough that you can find the one you are most comfortable using. However, most of the time you will just end up using Ship 7 or 8 as they have the most shield, fire the quickest, and move the fastest.

There are also weapon pickups that change the way you fire. Some cause explosions, some give you a shotgun style blast, some make you fire incredibly fast. The amount of pickups does become a bit redundant as there are two pickups that are really overpowered and make the others pointless.  You will end up only using about 3 different pickups.

One of the biggest problems with this game is the controls. Using a controller still made it hard to be accurate at points and the keyboard was even worse. The ships move way to quick at points and make it hard to be precise. I’m not sure if it was just me but this ended up infuriating me at points. Another problem is how slow the score rises. If you go for every achievement, getting to 75k can take a while. You just don’t get enough points. This is quite disheartening when you think you are doing really well and you have destroyed a load of enemies to find out that you only have 15k points.  

I honestly didn’t really enjoy my time playing this game for the reasons that i gave above, however i know that some people will enjoy this game.  It is quite fun if you played it to kill 10 minutes every now and then, but as someone who played this for a 5 hour sitting one time, it might start to bug the hell out of you, If you think this looks fun, go for it. Its pretty cheap and you will get your moneys worth in the end. 5/10.

22656515.review:
I had some negative criticism about this game at first, and although some of the problems I have with it still stand, The dev Nickervision has been extremely cool about taking my critique seriously and adding things to the game based on my suggestions. That's something I've never ever experienced before, so props to him.

As for the game its a pretty simple score attack asteroids clone with some interesting powerups, a little variation in enemies, a few different ships, and some pretty jammin music.

The game is fun to play as a casual arcade game, and for $1 you can't beat the value, so I'd recommend it. However there are a few areas where I think this game falls short / could be improved. 

-Overall the game feels very slow. I’m sure some users like this / are used to this and so I do not necessarily think it has to be changed for the main game mode, but I personally like fast paced games, and I would like a "Hard Mode" or "Super Speed" mode where everything is faster, your ship, the enemies and how fast the enemies appear on screen. Also I think the biggest difficulty is how cramped the screen gets when it fills up with enemies, for this new mode it would be cool to see the screen expanded so you had more movement space.

-There is not too much diversity in what you are shooting at, I have not gotten too far so there may be more enemies later, but the game is hard enough that you will spend most of your time shooting at circles and the occasional ship before dying and starting over. Since I'm going to be spending most of my time in the first part of the game it should be engaging.

-The powerups still feel a little lacking to me, some suggestions I have for new ones are: lightning, plasma beam, multiple guided missiles, sin wave ray? My favorite powerups are the lightsaber and the one that shoots energy bombs, because they feel unique, the rest are just slight variations on the starting gun.

-With powerups I would also like to see some kind of tier or upgrade system. players want to be able to upgrade their weapons and hopefully be overpowered, this could be implemented in another mode perhaps where along with ammo dead enemies also drop another type of pickup that upgrades your current weapon if you pick up enough. Also I think primary and secondary upgrades should be separate, you should be able to have the shield or magnet with another weapon.

-The coin system feels lacking, I would rather pick up 20 coins per run and need 500 to get the next ship than maybe pick up 1 coin and only need 10. If i play a round and get no coins, it feels unsatisfying, also different tiers of coins would be fun, red, blue green, and different values for each

-The main upgrade system could also be reworked, buying new ships is nice, and I know you cant have too much change due to the leaderboards, but as a player I would like to be able to permanently upgrade my ship or have some external options to use my coins and feel like I have a sense of progression.

In closing: More enemy variation, crazier powerups, more upgrades, and a sense of progression would all be additions that would make what is already a good game into something with more replayability and addictiveness.

22653001.review:
Welp, my mind has changed; I now realize it was a bit early to be writing a review.

I have now also realized the awesome nature of large battles with dozens of enemies all firing at you through which you must skillfully dodge each shot! I've been hooked with trying to pass my high score... but I've been even more hooked by trying to collect enough coins to unlock the next ship. The amount of diversity between its different weapons while somehow being able to maintain balance between them all is amazing - each weapon does something totally different, yet  none are distictly better than some other weapon. Overall it's great for whether I want to sit down for an hour or if I have just a few minutes of free time to kill. Totally worth it for one dollar and no ads or microtransactions!

My only complaint is the bouncing weapon. Its projectiles bounce, but not in a realistic fashion- they just bounce back the same direction in which they came. If that were changed, I might not actively avoid the bounce weapon.

Oh, and the music is awesome
